Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat product, and I'm lucky to have one of the fastest cpu reported
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2017
Reviews: CPU: Intel i7 7700k:l have mixed feeling about this processor, first lets start with the positive side:Pro: Great speed, i was able to overclock it to 5.53 ghz without a problem, and reached benchmark number one on CMU-Z with speed of 577 beating any similar processor around.with clock speed 4.2 - 4.5 ghz this CPU speed is more then capable to handle any application no matter what, i'm running Lightroom, Photoshop, Bridge, Time Lapse application, plus other application and yet able to play COD in the background at full fps on Eco mode :)Cons: processor can overheat and have spikes in temp, this is what many reported and i have noticed till I was able to fix it by resting bios, i was able to solve this issue buy bios reset, and i'm not sure if it was a bio, but now i'm no longer overclocking the CPU, i'm leaving it on Eco mode or performance up to 4.5ghz.Temp works idle 30c maximum while playing games <45cBenchmark is beyond great, since i received fastest single thread result in july 2017 @ 557Maybe when i'm going to receive my new liquid coolant i will give it another try, but it will be for benchmark purposes only, since there is no application which will require anything above 4.5ghz that i'm using.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsi7-7700K OC'd and Running at 5.1GHz (Water cooled)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2017
Reviews: 4 of 5 Stars - Value for the MoneyThere is little headroom on increased speed and the price to get there is higher than previous generations. If you aren't planning using Windows 10 - Kaby Lake will not support previous versions of Windows natively (There may be work arounds but...) It's worth noting, this version does not come with a Stock Fan, so you will need to buy a 3rd party CPU Cooler for it.This System Buildi7-7700KASUS ROG Maximus IX HeroCorsair Hydro Series H115i Extreme Performance Liquid CPU CoolernVidia GTX 1080Ti Founders EditionG.SKILL TridentZ RGB Series 16GBEVGA SuperNOVA 1000 G2 PSUCorsair Graphite Series 780T Full TowerWindows 10 HomeGetting to 5.1GhzI updated my ASUS BIOS to the newest versionI used the ASUS Windows app AI Suite 3 to stress test the system to its Max stable performance. It actually did a very good job. I rebooted  Windows, (hiit F1) entered the BIOS and saved the OC settings into the ASUS BIOS Profile. This saved a lot of time doing manual settings in the BIOS first, then running stress tests.TempsMy Temps  Idle speed 28-30C - Under Load 70c-73cKaby Lake CPU's run warmer under load - but should Never exceed meet 80c Max temps.I never run my older Intel CPU's beyond 60c as stability couldn't be insured. All my OC'd PC's are still running 9 years later. With that said, Kaby Lake CPU's run warmer. I have not experienced instability under Max load with the i7-7700K.ProsThe i7-7700K can be overclocked to a stable 5.1GHz with water coolingConsYou need to run Windows 10. Although some online forums offer work arounds to this limitation. Is it worth it to run into issues down the line.The speed performance premium may be too high for some.Other ThoughtsConsider that I still run two i7 2600k systems I built in 2011 (running at 4.8Ghz) on Air Cooling, The stock speed of a i7 2600k is 3.4GHz - The i7-7700K runs at 4.2GHz and requires water cooling to  get to 5.1GHz. The headroom for increased speed considerably less then it was six years ago.ConclusionIf you've purchased or built a high end PC in the last two years for gaming, there may not be a lot on offer here. A GPU upgrade may deliver more tangible speed results.If you use applications that are CPU dependent 3D rendering or Video editing, this increase in speed is welcome.For gaming, nVidia/AMD GPU's play a bigger role on your gaming than CPU's once did. If you are buying this for gaming, there are cheaper alternatives. I've been running this for 3 days without issues. Games: Doom, Battlefield 1, Battlefield 4, Overwatch ran smoothly, without issues - The water cooling fans kicking in consistently.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsHow did I not break this?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
Reviews: I purchased this in 2018 and finally found the invoice to write a review. The other day my friends had me download a program to see my computer temperatures. I was clocking in at 100 degrees Celsius! Again, I've been using this for years, with a case that has horrible air flow, and how this thing has lived this long is a miracle! I didn't even know what drivers were until last year too. I don't know if it was dumb luck that it has lived this long, but my goodness. I have a new CPU coolant and already put a new case on it that will actually allow airflow and the temps are already better even before the coolant arrived.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsYes, it runs hot. But that's not a showstopper.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2018
Reviews: There is a lot of drama surrounding the temperature range of this CPU, so I thought I would chime in here. I did NOT delid the CPU, and refuse to. I am using it with a Cooler Master Elite 130, ASUS Z270-I, and Corsair H60.Fixing it to a standard clock (4.2GHz with turbo mode turned off, etc.), 2 hours of Prime95 with an AVX load pushes it to an absolute max of 85 degrees. 85 degrees is outrageous for all the CPUs we're used to, but it's actually perfectly fine for this one. Bear in mind that my idle temperatures are in the 30's.With a stable DDR4-3000 overclock, the same test hits an absolute maximum of 95 degrees. That's 5 degrees away from TJMax. Scary but bear in mind that this is an unrealistic load.With turbo mode and other optimizations turned on, and RAM at standard clock, absolute maximum was again 95 degrees. With a small, conservative setup like mine this is actually impressive. 4.5GHz without DDR4-3000? I'll take it.With DDR4-3000 and all the built-in optimizations turned on, I finally hit the TJMax of 100 degrees and experienced light throttling, but no lock-ups or freezing. Many of the old systems I built would simply freeze or shut down in this situation, but this CPU gracefully steps back from the dangerous temperatures. That said, as well as the fact that this stress test is a hilariously unrealistic load, some users might consider this configuration to be perfectly fine.So my recommendation? If you are like me and just need a fast CPU in a small case, adjust your motherboard to fix this thing to a standard clock. Aggressive overclocking inside a small case like mine is simply not feasible with this CPU if you need rock solidity. I did keep the RAM overclock though since that passed 10-hour stress tests without a hitch. Alternately, if you have a big case, definitely get a liquid cooler with a big radiator. An extra fan and bigger radiator would easily knock off 10-20 degrees from all the aforementioned tests. You'll read all over google that people delidded the CPU to get the performance they're looking for. Unless you have a small case like mine, I can't see why it's better to spend money on the delid kit than for a bigger, better cooler.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsSwitched over to Kaby Lake Intel from AMD
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2017
Reviews: Let me start by saying that I like AMD.  I have bought lots of their products over the years-- cpus, gpus, and more recently apus.  They've always had good price to performance ratio.  I want them to succeed; I want healthy competition with Intel.However, when my last PC rig (Phenom II x6 w/ Radeon 6970 from 2011) turned 6 years old this January it was time for an upgrade and Intel Skylake and the brand new Kabylake were the only shows in town.  Though I had bought some great Kaveri apus in recent years for budget 1080p HTPCs, AMD in general felt really stale and my most recent build had actually been an i3  skylake for a pfsense router.  But when the announcement of March release for Ryzen 7 came I certainly felt like I could wait another 60 days to see what the long awaited Ryzen offered.In short, what a disappointment.  My main rig is used for gaming, software development, and light video editing.  AMD kept claiming that Ryzen would go head to head with Intel's best and beat it with its price.  And, that's true if your use cases are multi-core with heavy graphics editing or various academic algorithms.  But it still fell short of the i7-7700k for single-threaded scenarios (which applies to many apps).  Sure, it's great that Ryzen performs as well as and costs half as much as a $1k Haswell but I was never going to spend a $1k on a CPU so that's neither here nor there.  What really bothered me was their highlighting of gaming benchmarks where the CPU wasn't the bottleneck.  Who cares if Ryzen 7 can perform as well as an i7 when the GPU is the bottleneck because you're gaming in 4k or 1440p?  Why would I pay $150 more for an 1800x that was inferior in many scenarios to the best i7?Furthermore, many professional reviewers easily found flaws with the Ryzen 7 (including a bizarre performance drop off at 1080p gaming).  When they brought those to the attention of AMD, they were told to disable features in the bios to improve things.  Disable features in my bios to improve performance?  WTF?  What kind of a weak response is that?  That shows a clear... no disturbing ... lack of preparedness on AMD's part to things that they had to have known professional reviewers were going to test.After having read a dozen or so professional reviews of Ryzen 7 all saying the same thing: 'looks promising but has warts and is clearly inferior to i7 in multiple use cases'.  I just couldn't pull the trigger on AMD.  They weren't ready.So, I took the safe route.  I went i7-7700k.  No regrets ... but godspeed to AMD and here's hoping they can get some real competition against Intel.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 1.0 out of 5 starsI do not recommend any Intel CPU Due to lack of Premium support, CPU Quality and Consumer Trust.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2017
Reviews: August 10, 2017- I Bought the CPU and Paired it with a Cooler Master Hyper 212 LED, My Old Gigabyte AM2+ MoBo was getting old and the Top of the line Phenom II 6X 1045T was not cutting it and started to start from scratch again by doing a full revamp of the system. I found the Deal to be economical and cost effective compared to Ryzen 7 1800X Flag ship CPU. The CPU has High Frequency Clock and is a Beast when Gaming I did how ever had issues with XMP working with my Gigabyte Z170 Gaming 7 Motherboard but everything works as it should.3/6/2018This is the worst experience with Intel i had. I bought a Pentium one year to build a HTPC and had trouble of being slow, Then I bought this Core I7-7700k for a Gaming rig and payed ~$300 for, I had Buyer regret and was temped to sell this CPU and the supporting motherboard. then come to find out that Intel used bad thermal paste on the CPU die instead of using better quality thermal paste or go back to using soldering technology. Then hear that Intel had a Exploit with the management engine, Meltdown and spector that has been hidden for 20+ years and Found out Intel hid this information from the public for 6 month before releasing this information. and on top of that i never got my one question answered about the Die being crack or chip and what would have caused it when the CPU was operating with in spec. it was voided of warranty before i even thought of removing IHS, so i did not bother submitting a Request for RMA and just needed a answer so i would not let it happen again. I had nothing to lose when removing the IHS because Intel would have done the same thing to find why it was not working. That is why i stuck with AMD Processors for the last 6-8 years because they worked just the way they were design and fit my need and there Price to performance was more compelling then Intel processors. This has been the most disappointing company i have come crossed, Customer Service was too Focus on the Removal of the IHS instead of telling me what could of happen. There response to all this is to buy a new Intel Core I7-7700k for $300 sense i Physically damage the CPU by removing the heat spreader. I told them i was troubleshooting and it was the only thing left to prove it was the CPU and be hold i seen a crack burnt spot on the Die which i Deemed it to be Physical damage from the start. But this happened when i was working on a case design and forgot to plug in the CPU Fans when i was stress testing the CPU at Stock speed for Temp stability and found the temps getting up to 100C and thermal throttling. i plug the fans in and got it to cold down before the system quit working at mid 70C. Told them after i buy which ever processor, this will be my last Intel platform I buy and make sure that i would not recommend your enthusiast product to anyone. I also ask why did the CPU MAX TDP is set at 100C when usually limit it at a safe temp is 70-80C max to prevent stress on the CPU die from Rapid temperature change. Never got my $300 CPU support that i deserved.i need to say what i had to say, I Pray to God that things would improve before coming back to Intel.Update 3/7/2018 - I would not recommend this for inexperienced users who do not know about the Thermal Problem this will cause. When i Work AMD Processors they shut down if there was temps that exceeded a certain threshold. with Intel core I7-7700k it will thermal throttle under load and did not thermal shut down until the silicon blew a piece off. I just Now bought a AMD Ryzen 7 1800X, due to the problems With Intel cascading one after another. like i said it will be a long time before i ever come back to Intel. I was mainly a AMD Person and wanted to change but i guess this what happens when you change Platform.Update 3/9/2018, Intel did respond back as to why this happen are telling them that there Customer Support does not know how to do there jobs and there engineer do not know how to make safe products. They said that they were not designed to run with out fans( run Hot at 100C), and told me to throw away the broken CPU. I pretty much told them that in other word you only enable thermal throttling at 100C but disable Thermal shutdown? told them what a joke, Why should I buy the top of the line CPU that is Unlock and not have any safety features to make sure that customer don't make stupid mistakes. I guess this is why I never like intel CPU to begin with.If you have Read all this, Just to Sum this all Up, all K series CPU are "Uses at your own risk" and Have nothing short of absolute a water Cooling or Top of the Line Air Cooler heat sink. this is the end of my complete Review.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars1337 marks: I won the Silicon Lottery! Easy 5 Ghz overclock.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2017
Reviews: I won the Silicon Lottery with the purchase of this processor. This processor is running at 5.174 Ghz on all four cores. 5.373 Ghz for 3 cores. Single and dual core clock speed is at 5.572 Ghz. That is with a cache ratio/multiplier of 46 at a 99.5 Mhz bclk. My 3DMark Time Spy score with this CPU and the rest of my rig is 7001. My 7700k + GTX 1070 is as fast as the average 7700k + 1080 rig.My i7-7700k CPU easily hits 5 Ghz. It can hit it in so many ways that finding its peak overclock speed was actually a chore. I've been building PCs and overclocking them since the 90's, and I can honestly say that this is my best buy so far. I don't say that lightly, because I am aware of the Celeron 300A's, but my celly300a didn't OC for crap. Considering that the 7700k is specced for a max turbo of 4.5, I really can't complain for hitting a Ghz higher on two cores, and being able to run all four cores 1 Ghz higher than the 4.2 Ghz this CPU is specced at.Here is my build iff you want to construct a rig like mine and see if you have the same mileage:CPU: i7-7700kCPU Cooler: Corsair H100i V2 (stock fans replaced with 4x Corsair ML120)Mobo: Asus Z270-PlusRAM: 32 Gb (2 x16) Corsair LPX DDR4-3200GPU: EVGA GTX 1070 FTW HybridSSD #1: 500Gb Samsung 960 EvoSSD #2: 512GB Intel 600pCase: Coolermaster N200 Micro ATXPS: Rosewill Hive 550W

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSeeing this make me higher than a 90lbs counterweight can launch a 300lbs projectile.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2017
Reviews: First of all I'd like to say great of a deal this really is. Prior to the Kaby Lake line, the only processor with this grade of performance is the 6900K (Price at time of posting: $1,029) and the 6950X (Price at time of posting: $1,628).Second of all, I'd like to mention the batch I got from Amazon is capable of 5.2ghz on liquid cooling. I was extremely surprised to win the silicon lottery. I honestly expected a lack luster batch from a retailer that doesnt publicize the batch numbers they have in stock.Next, I'd like to put a spotlight on the bad publicity for a minute. Perhaps it's because people expect groundbreaking flagship hardware innovation with each new generation. Moore's law states that the number of transistors on a circuit doubles every year. Similar to the public, Moore has some really damn higg expectations for the future. If a company fails to live up to these expectations, that's a valid reason to be upset with the company. My understanding is that these individuals who were upset about the 15% improvement, are letting their feelings torwards the company get in the way of their views of this product itself.Anyways, in my humble (not) opinion I am very happy with this purchase, and I will keep purchasing Intel chips until either Ryzen benchmarks high enough to make it worth the change, or until ARM takes over the world.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazing Processor, Changed from AMD
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2017
Reviews: I recently had a hard drive failure on my desktop.  Naturally, replacing the failed disk turned into a full on upgrade of my entire computer.  I spent a lot of time researching processors, motherboards, and other components as I had not made a true change to my desktop for a good 6+ years.Initially, I was leaning toward AMD, as I had always done in the past.  However, I decided to swing Intels way for this upgrade, and I couldn’t be happier.  Stepping it up from an old Phenom II processor and a 2gb Radeon R7, to this beast coupled with MSI’s z270 Gaming M6 AC motherboard and their GTX 1080ti 11 GB Gaming X GPU, it has been an amazing difference.  I have yet to find a game (primary use of computer) that can slow it down, and as a “standard user” (ie I don’t really get into the specs in depth), I have seen zero issues.I’ve officially changed from AMD gear to Intel processors and nVidia GPUs and I don’t see going back at any point in the near future.  This processor is worth the extra cost over an AMD chip, but make sure to couple it with components that will make the most of it rather than losing a lot of its power.Go big or go home! 😂

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2019
Reviews: Had just installed a EVGA RTX 2080ti in my PC but was getting bottlenecked in my gaming by my i5 6600K. Playing The Division 2 I would see 100% CPU usage and less than 20% GPU. I didn’t drop a grand on a new GPU to utilize only 20% of it! I also didn’t feel like replacing my MSI Z170A Gaming M7 motherboard right now. Fortunately the current BIOS version of this mobo supports Kaby Lake so I decided to go with the i7 7700k. Installation was very simple. I water cool my CPU with a Corsair h100i gtx and temps playing division 2, apex, and Black Desert Online all at max settings @1440p varies between upper 40s to low 60s while overclocked at 4.7Ghz.  Pump at 3000 fans at 1800.As far as performance-wow what a difference from my i5 6600K. The division 2 runs silky smooth anywhere from 90s to 130 fps. Apex mostly runs at 144 with dips to low 100s depending on the area. BDO runs consistently between 110-120 with dips into the 90s when in heavily populated city areas.Overall extremely happy and should hold me for a year or so until I decide to upgrade my mobo for a ninth generation cpu.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsIntel at it again but not at the performance department.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2017
Reviews: This is a solid 4 core processor with a great overclocking abilities however AMD have teached Intel how it's done with the Ryzen lineup. The price is somewhat ok but the major complaint has to be the shockingly poor quality thermal compound that intel uses in their CPUs and tell using which proven to be a huge drawback to its processor's overclocking  capabilities with thermal throttling and whatnot, I've suffered from that poor TC in my overclocking sessions and had stop OCing after realizing that you can't have a stable OC without deliding and replacing the TC a risky process that i wouldn't recommend anyone doing unless you know what you're doing. I'm happy with my 7700k with stock speeds however the whole thermal throttling thing is definitely a bad mark for intel in my book. I made this review after almost 9 months of everyday use to give an honest and fair review and came to this conclusion if you want a solid gaming experience go with the 7600k or 7700k but for overclocking? Skip the Kabylake for now, for an all rounded CPU go with Ryzen 7 great performance, more cores, great value. If you can push your budget a bit the 8700k is the current champion of all rounded multitasking/gaming machine.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsbut I dont understand why they insist on us keeping their stupid heat sink on
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2017
Reviews: so this is yet another quality cpu from inlet. but I dont understand why  they insist on us keeping their stupid heat sink on. I know from many sources that a delided kabylake performs far cooler than one with original heat-sink on. you search videos on youtube. but i can prove that to you in attached picture. if you see under full load my CPU cores show 80+ c, but my IO tempreture is just 28-30 c. you can see that on link app. H100i just 29.8 and core#1 84c. that means the heat sink is bottlenecking the hell out. it does not core heat get to AIO. they either put a cheap paste on the cpu or their is a lot of air gap. i do not know. they need to redesign this heat-sink. i herd liquid metal thermal copunds are the way to go. its not like they are selling these cpus very cheap they can afford some better heat transfer or they should sell it without heat-sink. becuase no matter how great is your cooler. this cpu is going to run very hot, looks like it is their way of stopping you from overclocking these cpus to the limit. and if you decide to overclock they die fast.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat CPU that runs way too hot
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2017
Reviews: This is a great CPU for both gaming and productivity. I can see a clear difference between this and my i5 6500, especially on a 144hz monitor.If you're not into gaming, or only casually, I recommend going with a similarly priced Ryzen setup, which will be much better at productivity.My main "gripe" with this cheap is that Intel really cheaper out on the internal thermals. The only way around this is to open it up which will void the warranty and is risky. As of right now it runs really hot. Hotter than what I feel is safe for prolonged use. I've ordered a beefier cooler to try to resolve this, but even without an overclock I am pushing 90C from time to time.Pros:-very fast out of the box, especially for gaming-hyperthreading gives it an edge over an i5 in a lot of productivity tasks-plays nice with my "older" B150 motherboard and 2133Mhz RAMCons:-runs way too hot-requires a BIOS update on B150/Z170 boards-not that much faster than an i5 6500 in most games to justify the price difference (if only gaming)

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2017
Reviews: The I7 7700k is a great CPU. It's expensive but worth every penny if you are one with overclocking in mind. I would say that an amd chipset like a ryzen (comparable cost) is perhaps a little more bang for your buck, especially at higher resolution gaming but the intel I7 7700k does this as well and does it at a high level. One huge complaint with this chip is the heat. Now this issue comes only with overclocking. At stock speeds you might get heat jumps of 10c but generally it stays cool enough for this to not matter. If you plan on overclocking (why not) this is were I have seen temps that can become frustrating. A jump in temperatures of 10-15c when your temps are already elevated is not a desired thing. This CPU is better ran with liquid cooling to get its full potential and a lot of people buy the rockitt 88 kit to de lid their CPU to get a better TIM seal. This does void the warranty. Overall a great CPU just keep in mind that you need to take extra precautions with cooling as the I7 7700k is a fire breathing dragon

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsdelidded @5Ghz with cryorig @80c mini-itx
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2017
Reviews: Intel set consumers up for failure. This is an unlocked chip. Mine OCs to 5Ghz no problem, but gets to, and stays at 100C with all the sensor tests I could find to run on it. Running anything even slightly CPU dependent will ramp those temps up, although not for long, they still get there. I've used Prime 95 both 26.6 and the latest version and they both bring the temps to 100C while load is creeping up to 10% in Real Temp.As for coolers so far I've used an EVO 212 and the Master Air Maker 8, which I returned because of the high temps my 7700k was achieving. While 5Ghz is a hefty OC and only 25% of chips are supposed to be stable at this OC, I am seeing numerous Youtube.com videos being produced where enthusiasts buy a $30 3-D printed Integrated Heat Spreader (IHS) removal tool, remove the Thermal Interface Material (TIM) and replace it with something like the  $25 Cool Labs liquid metal applied in place of the stock TIM and replace the IHS. Doing this they are able to achieve 20C lower temps! That would put my CPU in safe range! Is that so much to ask for a $350 CPU? I guess it is 10 years later, when there are no competitors after paying Micheal Dell $1 Billion a year to exclusively use Intel CPUs.Edit: Temps with the DH-15 with 2 fans without noise reduction resistors. Gets the temps below 71c for everyday applications that previously brought it to 91c with the EVO 212 and the Air Maker 8. I will update again when I get a chance to test it.edit: After a TIM swap and a new asus z270i mobo it's working well @ 5ghz no more noctua.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat processor, Amazing after it has been delid
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2017
Reviews: This was my first PC build, and was able to overclock this processor to 5.0Ghz without issue.  At first I was unable to get past 4.8Ghz, but after I adjusted the vcore calibration curve to "turbo" on my Gigabyte Z270X Gaming K5 I was able to achieve it no problem. (this prevents the core voltage from dropping under high load and causing a blue screen)I did delid the processor to improve the temperatures (drastically).  Delidding is a process of removing the metal cap on the CPU and replacing the thermal paste under it.  This can be achieved using a Rockit Cool 88 and a youtube video, sounds terrifying, but trust me it isn't - if you can build a PC, you can delid a processor.  I achieved a 20C drop in temperatures after deliding, this is the only reason I am giving this CPU a 4/5 - the thermal past that intel uses on this processor is JUNK.All in all a beast of a processor, you'll be very happy you purchased it.Attached: Temperatures under 100% load.  Cinebench score

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2017
Reviews: This chip is pretty alright so far at stock, BUT it's a K series chip, meaning you're paying a premium to overclock. On these chips Intel is using some pretty not that good thermal compound between the die and integrated heat spreader, meaning this thing gets hot! It'll also randomly Spike in temps at times (I've seen so far on mine a max spike of 20 degrees C!) Intel's response to this is that you shouldn't overclock even though you are paying the premium for it. From what I've seen the solution to these heat issues is delidding (which means voiding the hell out of your warranty) and replacing that poor thermal paste with some form of liquid metal (grizzly conductonaut is  one that seems to be the best). I haven't gotten a chance to overclock yet, (I need to get a new cooler). I'm currently running mine with Noctua l9x65, which isn't even recommended by noctua for this chip without good airflow and disabling something In bios, and I'm reaching temps between 82-87 C during prime 95 stress testing for 30 ish minutes. During gameplay in fallout4 with a gtx 1060 6gb with some heavy modding I reach about 71 max and fps stays at my 61 fps max cap  in most situations, EVEN in downtown area gunfights.TLDR: This is an alright chip at stock, but intel's premium price and lack of premium support (out right telling everyone not to overclock and poor IHS thermal compound  )  for an unlocked chip makes it hard to recommend. If you don't need the upgrade right now, Id say wait to see if intel's next chip series is more overclocking friendly.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W

I love how much headroom there is for this beast.  i would definitely recommend this chip for a gamer that wants all the fps possible.  Out of the box I was playing Witcher 3 at everything maxed out even hair works at 75 fps.  In PLAYER UNKNOWN BATTLEGROUNDS I get anywhere from 80-110 FPS depending on the area of the map.  In GTA V I am getting about 80 FPS with everything maxed out and all render distances maxed as well.  This chip rocks my dual 24" monitors with one monitor playing a demanding game and the other monitor playing a full screen video on Yout Tube with 5 google pages open and no stutter or lag whatsoever.My compAsus TuF Mark III7-7700K  5GHZEVGA 1080 FTWSamsung 500GB SSD ProEVGA 750 Watt SuoernovaIn Win 303

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2018
Reviews: i7-7700K first off very noticeably faster than my previous i5, I use this in my gaming build which I paired with an ASUS GTX 1080. Both are noticeably very fast out of the box I can play any game I throw at my pc now and have well over 100 fps even in modern games like Destiny 2, Battlefield 1 and even Fallout 4. Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsI really enjoy this processor.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2017
Reviews: This processor really performs. I built my pc before I had my graphics card, mainly to install all my games and software that I use. I used to play League of Legends and CS:GO alot on my old pc, and because it has a older dual core processor and no graphics card, I would get 48 frames on average in League of Legends and about 18 frames on average in CS:GO.  This processor, on the same low settings, will get a solid 180 fps in League of Legends and between 80-120 fps in CS:GO. And that's only at the stock clock, I didn't really stretch my overclock on this card, I only have it overclocked to 5ghz, but I with that I've noticed faster load times in various programs and some fps increase on some games. This processor should be a cheaper option to good performance, compared to current pricing of coffee lake. Would recommend this processor, or the new coffee lake processors, assuming this performance is carried over and the bonus of the extra 2 cores on coffee lake.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2022
Reviews: I purchased this processor and it was the incorrect one for my motherboard.  After realizing the mistake was on my part due to an incorrect compatibility reference, I requested a refund and during the process was informed that the return shipping cost would be deducted from the refund.  Surprisingly, I was refunded the entire purchase price.  I did end up purchasing a more powerful (and compatible) processor from the same vendor and have been very satisfied with my purchase.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat performance but hottt hotT hHoTT!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2017
Reviews: I was able to pull of a 5.0 ghz overclock at 1.373v. I have a 240mm water cooled setup and this thing was hot even at stock temps. I'm like a week into owning this thing and voided my warranty delidding it in order to knock 20c of my temps to bring my max temp at 80c using Prime95 and Realbench @ 5.0 ghz. The jump from 4.5 ghz - 4.6 ghz was + 0.015v and then +0.015v to achieve another 100 mhz so on and so fourth until 4.8 ghz. Then it took + 0.035v to 4.90 ghz and another 0.035v to reach 5.0 ghz.Other people may get chips that run cooler than mine but all of these chips will run way hotter than any CPU you've come across before I'd probably recommend only purchasing this if you have water cooling and I definitely wouldn't recommend overclocking over 5.0 ghz unless you're willing to void your warranty and delid it

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsIt's alright, it still seems mid range for the price though
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2018
Reviews: I can manage mine at a very stable 4.8Ghz on all 4 cores at 1.32V. I can't manage 4.9Ghz on all four cores at all (system goes straight to BSOD over 1.37V), which is disappointing but just the reality of this so called silicone lottery. I've messed with a lot of BIOS to get around the insane voltage but to no avail. I know anything over 1.35V is dangerous, but 1.32V should be fine in the long term.Relevant specs:Gigabyte Aorus Z270 Gaming 5(Don't buy this POS MOBO)Zotac AMP! 1080 TiI7-7700k (obviously)H150i RGB Pro AIO(3 FAN 360mm radiator)Some 850W gold power supplyMX-4 Thermal Paste (full coverage blob method)Overall I expected more but I still got a decent card so I can't complain. I suspect my MOBO is throttling the GPU somehow. I don't understand how I can't put over 1.37V when my temps are well below 50C idle.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWorks well for my needs..
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2017
Reviews: Installed with ease and works as described however:; runs at idle even with a cooler master tower at 37-45 on  depending on room temps and when tested,, goes to 100 C (212) F and throttles back... I am not a gamer and have no intention of gaming as need for other applications but will replace with regular I-7/7700.. Contacting intel does no good just standard response and maybe de-lidding even if voids warranty can be a solution?? Not recommended on all counts..Addition: 5 years later.. I have had no problems after de-lidding hottest it ever got during stress test was 67 C.. I have the 7700 also as backup/replavement I dfon`t O.C, and use mainly for Ham radio,, Astronmomy'Astrophotography etc.. Currently in process up grading with new motherboard and i9/990KF but will still keep 5 year old build as running very well.. Now with Windows 11 microsoft unsupported cpu list this is in,, work fine!! Just do the workaround ;) Best CPU I ever owned..

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsMost Excellent Processor!  OUTSTANDING!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2017
Reviews: This is a fantastic processor.  It is the full "optimization" of Intel's Skylake 14nm fabrication node.  Think of it as Skylake's Devils Canyon.  This processor is an absolute beast when it comes to overclocking.  I expect to start seeing Sandy Bridge era overclocking commonplace again (I mean people hitting 5GHz regularly).  This was all but unattainable with Ivy Bridge, Haswell, and Skylake.  Only the rare special binned chips could hit 5GHz and even then most were barely stable.  This i7 7700k will be a 5GHz monster, and handles it with ease.  Yes, there is a caveat, it seems to run just a tad warmer temp wise than ideal, but really nothing to be concerned about - because if you are buying this you should be investing in a quality AIO cooler anyway, or doing a custom loop that will tame that heat.  This is the processor to get if you are starting a new build, or have anything older than Haswell.  5 stars -highly recommended!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsI impressed myself with this one
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2017
Reviews: Okay, I'll admit, I typically build with AMD. Not to start any flame wars here. AMD has their place. This build called for Intel, and I am more than impressed to say the least! This is easily the fastest computer I've ever built. My customer wanted a VR Gaming Rig, and I delivered. MY goal was to build a capable system, that would outperform anything off the shelf, yet come in under budget, and have the power to handle whatever tasks they may ask of it next. I believe I achieved  that, and this little beauty sits at the heart of that build. I'm very happy with it, and more importantly, my customer is happy. I was able to boot Windows at 5GHz, but Prime95 proved it to be unstable. Perhaps if I had more time to play with it, and tune it, I could have made it stable. Either way, even with a simple motherboard one click overclock, this thing ROCKS.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsFrametimes were noticeably better than what my 4770K gave me
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2018
Reviews: Pros:- This processor is fast. I've had a 4770K and it would only go up to 4.1 GHz. Anything above that and it would crash. This processor is overclocked to 5 GHz and I can tell in all my games that they were smoother. Frametimes were noticeably better than what my 4770K gave me.- Glad that they stopped putting the stock cooler with this CPU. You need a great CPU cooler if you're going to buy a CPU of this caliber anyway. You need to be able to keep it cool so that it won't throttle.Cons:- TIM used was crap. I had to delid this CPU and put liquid metal to drop temps. They could have soldered this chip for better temps, but no. Intel could have really done better with this one, but they decided not to.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsI don't feel comfortable overclocking unless I can get the temps a little ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2017
Reviews: This is the most powerful CPU I have ever owned. I upgraded from a i5 6500 because I render a lot of videos and game. I had an i7 on my 2011 Macbook pro but ever since then all of my CPUs have been i5's. So I had forgotten how hot the i7 CPUs run. I got an H60 water cooler and it kept my temperatures under 70C while gaming and that's without overclocking it. I don't feel comfortable overclocking unless I can get the temps a little lower. If you are planning on overclocking get a bigger water cooler or one with two fans like the H75 rather than the H60.So far the performance has been amazing. It's overkill for my work but it makes things a breeze which is always a pro. When I'm on idle or running really light applications this CPU runs at 27-30C but this is with my H60 water cooler.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsAmazing if yours is can handle the heat.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2017
Reviews: I was an AMD user for years and suddenly decided to give intel a shot. Everything was fine, amazing performance and was pretty happy and impressed. Few months down the road, all of a sudden temperature spikes to 90C while idle. I do my usual checks, Thermal Paste, CPU, CPU Cooler, etc. PC sends cool air in and out but the CPU remains at 90C idle or gaming. Now I am noticing significant lag during gaming sessions.A loss of a star for reliabilitySecondly, I went online to research this and to see if I was not alone, to my surprise I saw hundreds of other users with the same issue as well as various posts about the same subject. What intel said was to stop over clocking...ok great ez but what about people who are not overclocking, what now? I have yet to hear a response about any type of fix, replacement, or anything. I also have a liquid cooler, which Corsair was happy to next day air me a new one with free shipping, pretty sure my cooler is fine. Intel what is up with the temp spikes? Really hurting performance and my overall first time experience using your products, remember I was an AMD fanboy, now I am slightly regretting this change.A loss of a star for lack of support.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat cpu for gaming with little issues
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2019
Reviews: I've owned this cpu for about a year, and its preformed very well. It stays icy at 26-32C on idle or while browsing the web and goes only to 50-75C while gaming with a NZXT Kraken. using an Asus Maximus Hero board i've overclocked it to 5ghz and it still stays at the temps above. This thing has had some crashing issues with certain games though so be warned on getting the chipset lottery. Some games just don't run not sure if I need to update my drivers or something but it seems to not like certain games. The crashing rate is only about .2% of games i've tried tho but it locks up my pc and requires a complete hard shutdown. Hope I can answer any questions you had.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W

Reviews: Now I can mix my music without crashes! *If you have a stock cpu fan I recommend upgrading it.  This cpu runs much hotter than the i5 or even the i7 7700 (no k). Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsI love this thing
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2018
Reviews: I love this thing! I had the i5 6500 and its night and day. I got a lot of inconsistent gameplay at 1080p with the gtx1060 at 75hz. Ever since I switched to this bad boy and overclocked it, I haven't had any problems. I gave this a four star since the temps are insane! My i5 got no hotter than 45c with the 212 Evo and this guy goes over 70c under load! I realize this is Intel's fault for not applying the thermal compound on the di underneath the lid but it's still silly hot. You can de-lid this one if you want to gamble your cpu and money, however its very risky.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W

Reviews: Ordered an i7-7700k processor and had some issues with the tracking information provided. I reached out to the seller and they were quickly able to update me with the information. I received the processor the next day or two and installed it. No issues at all.  Worked as expected. Great customer service!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2019
Reviews: Can't believe caved in and upgraded my i5 7600k to this i7. Only reason was because I didn't want to buy a new motherboard and I still really like mine. I made this upgrade because of how demanding some games are getting especially on the CPU side. BF1 and BFV were the culprits on this one. I have this thing running at stock speeds on a Hyper 212 Evo. Temps looks pretty solid to me! If I ever have to push this bad boy a little further I'll have to look into liquid cooling. I do not recommend buying this CPU anymore since the new i7s are a better value, but i managed to catch this one for MSRP.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsIf Building From Scratch, GO with 8th Gen CPU/300 Series Chipset Board instead of this
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2018
Reviews: Fast CPU for the price, have built 4 pc's  total using this CPU and 1 was and still is perfect, runs great no issues, yet the rest of them have all had random but constant temperature spikes and inconsistencies, and tend to run pretty hot in gaming mode. One I built for a friend who still has and likes alot we OC'd and was able to hit 5.24Ghz on a 240mm AIO cooler, which is amazing, but his as the other including the one I sent back that never saw any OverClocking were just really not cooling very well. I have since gotten the 8th gen 8700k for $100 more and upgraded to the z370 MSI Enthusiast Gaming M5 board and am much happier with it, many people argue that it is not worth the price to upgrade from this to the 6 core newer version, and may be true if you can't sell your 7700k and board, but if you are starting from scratch fully GO WITH THE 8700K/300 series chipset, the boards are very little more in money and the cpu is $100 more but worth every penny and more

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2018
Reviews: 7th Gen Intel i7 KabyLake CPU, great price for a project CPU that will ahem... void your warrantyI took it out of the package, de-lidded, removed old thermal paste, installed new metal compound thermal paste, re-lidded, installed onto my ROG motherboard, and then overclocked.  It runs fast and runs consistently at 28c.  Make sure if you intend to overclock... know this is drastic and a commitment, you must strongly consider the necessary cooling and preparation.. There are many videos on youtube from people who do mods.  However the KabyLake CPU is a outstanding processor at good value, you will be pleased with a much faster and highly responsive system, especially if you are an overclocker!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2017
Reviews: The Core i7 7700k is a fantastic CPU.  It runs at a default clock of 4.2GHz; I haven't overclocked it yet because it preforms so nicely.  A somewhat reasonable price for the CPU and performance. I upgraded from a Core i7 3770 and what a difference did this new CPU make.  It is an amazing performance improvement and the support for DDR4 RAM is great.  Definitely recommend this CPU to anyone looking for an additional performance boost.  There is one downside, though.  It is extremely hot, even idling.  I have a CRYORIG H7 Tower Cooler and it idles at 40C.  Under load it easily reaches 95-100C, which is the limit for this CPU.  I definitely recommend a water cooler.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 2.0 out of 5 starsWindows 7? think again! it's now blacklisted from updating! WOW! forced win 10 use.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2017
Reviews: so i bought this cpu about 4 months prior to writing this review and i loved it.it was happily running on my Windows 7 machine.  sometime about a week or two ago microsoft pushed an update that BLOCKS me from updating my retail purchased version of Win 7 because of unsupported hardware.  what's the hardware...? this cpu.  this cpu that ran perfectly fine for 4 months now blocks me from getting ANY updates from windows.  can you say desperate to force me into upgrading to windows 10??so i actually ordered a windows 10 disk, and it won't even install a driver for my network card.i've built computers for 20 years and this is dead easy to do.  fresh win 10, chipset, intel management engine, (hotfix files are in folder for IEM but don't run, gives an error that it's not supported in win10.) then the onboard LAN.  device shows up in device manager while the driver install is running, but ultimately driver hangs at 100% then says no hardware found and closes / device vanishes from device manager.  support for the z270 motherboard suggested i reinstall windows. sigh.i'm pretty upset that it wasn't explicitly mentioned microsoft is removing the ability to use this on windows 7.THAT SHOULD HAVE BEEN FRONT AND CENTER.  all being said, i have a 1080ti, and nvme 950pro.i wouldn't have upgraded had i known what i do now from an i7 4790k.  huge bummer, huge hassle.don't want to use windows 10.  i've got it on another machine and it has many phantom issue's.BAD cpu if you want to use windows 7.  beware, microsoft is only giving 'critical' updates going forward unless you're on 10  :[

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 2.0 out of 5 starsRecommend buying an AMD Ryzen instead.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2017
Reviews: I am running this processor in a top end build. I LOVE how powerful it is, but I do not understand why intel purposefully manufactured these chips with poor material. The thermal interface material houses so much heat. Chips that are delidded literally run minimum 20C cooler, some even cooler. And that's not an exaggeration.With AMD Ryzen 1700X being $50 more, about $390 compared to 7700k at $340, there is literally no reason to purchase a 7700k. If intel does not change their manufacturing process and provide a superior product that doesn't need to be delidded to actually run properly at a normal temperature, I will never buy intel again.At 4.6 ghz (0.1 ghz above stock 4.5 ghz) at the lowest vcore I could manage to run prime95, real bench, and cinebench stable for over 48 hours, my temperatures spiked to 88-91C and on average while gaming and streaming I run at about 80C. The cpu runs ridiculously hot while barely pushing an overclock on a top end cpu air cooler with good case ventilation. 4.5 ghz runs the chip at 70-75C. This is unacceptable for a top end product and benchmarks place AMD Ryzen far above the 7700k for both practical and theoretical uses. I didn't watercool, but if the product was made better, I shouldn't have to. Intel just lost a customer and will lose many more with its poor judgement in cheaping out on the thermal interface material. For both casual gamers and enthusiasts, an AMD Ryzen is clearly the better choice.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2017
Reviews: I settled on an i7-7700k when deciding it was finally time to upgrade from my 6 year-old PC and couldn't be happier with the purchase. I was nervous about the reports of high temperatures but after two months it has never broken 63 °C. I haven't done any manually overclocking, only enabled Turbo Boost, and have disabled Hyper-Threading until I start running programs that can take advantage of the virtual cores.I have it seated in an ASUS ROG Maximus IX Hero motherboard with a be quiet! Dark Rock Pro 3 cooler and Corsair Vengeance LPX 2×8 GB 3466 MHz memory.My initial motherboard came warped and ended up denting the CPU when I installed it. Amazon replaced both components for no additional cost.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsStill running like a beast since 2017
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2021
Reviews: I produce music professionally so I'm running 20+ instances of Kontakt, Omnisphere, Output, and any other VST you can think of inside my daw, plus recording vocals in Reaper, making videos in After Effects, with 50 tabs open in Chrome and this CPU still handles everything I throw at it 3.5 years later. Cooled by a Noctua NH-U12S 55 fan on a ASRock Z270 Taichi ATX LGA1151 mobo. I want to upgrade because new stuff is fun but honestly I see no reason to.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 2.0 out of 5 starsCore gets really hot when pushed - Returned
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2017
Reviews: I'm not sure what happened with this newest version of the i7, but it gets hot when pushed.  Using a Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO cooler, I couldn't get my i7 7700K to run below 90* C on all 4 cores when pushed with Prime95, even at stock clock (I didn't even try to clock it up due to the heat).  I've built many a PC in my career and I'm sure the cooler was mounted properly and my BIOS firmware was up to date.  Doing some googling, I see others having the same issue due to the TIM under the heat spreader.  Many people are "de-lidding" their 7700K's to replace the TIM (thermal interface material) with higher quality stuff and dropping 20*C under load.  Obviously, that would void the warranty and not a step that I'm willing to take, so this one was returned and I got a 6700K instead.  Using the same cooler, it remains in the high 60's or so (ambient at about 22*C) under load, even when I overclock it to the same speed as the 7700K (4.5 GHz).  The fact that the core temp would fluctuate rapidly and to such a great degree also caused the CPU & case fans to go nuts under normal working conditions - speeding up and slowing down quickly was very annoying.  Not so with the 6700K.  Perhaps I had a bad "sample" and didn't win the silicon lottery, but I'm glad I "downgraded" to the 6700K.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsFirst build, love it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2017
Reviews: This is the processor i chose for my first build. Before i had a an I7-2600K at 3.6ghz in an outdated alienware aurora. The old CPU still runs great, its why i chose intel for my new build.I am no PC guru but i am learning, i wanted the best Quadcore i could find within reason as i only play games and use AutoCAD software.I will likely experiment with OC in the future but for now 4.2ghz is blazingly fast for me. No bottleneck on my 1080 Ti.The CPU idles around 34DEG C and gets up to around 50DEG C i haven't really done anything to put a heavy load on it yet.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsA review from a former 3770k owner
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2018
Reviews: After dealing with bottlenecks and massive amounts of frustration with old tech, I finally decided to upgrade from my old 3770k. The performance boost is still a little overwhelming. Maxed out 300fps on Overwatch, video encoding times dropped by almost half, and the inclusion of optane for my old 1tb HDDs makes it a no brainer now. DDR4 ram is overpriced right now, but the time to get rid of the old X79, 1155, and i7 950 platforms is now. If you have the money, just do it. If not, save up and sell that old stuff. I guarantee that you will not be disappointed.Make gaming great again.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsNot the best choice of CPU going into 2018
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2017
Reviews: I bought this to replace a Skylake i5 in a Z270-based machine, so it was the best I could do without buying a new motherboard. However, I would not recommend it for a brand new build. An 8th gen chip with a Z370 mobo would definitely be a better option.My main complaint against the 7700k is the insane amount of heat it produces. I paired it with a Corsair H100i v2 and expected to be able to achieve a 5GHz overclock, but those dreams were crushed by spikes well over 90C and a terrifying amount of thermal throttle. I couldn't even achieve a stable 4.8GHz clock without crazy thermals, so I ended up settling for 4.6GHz at a 1.255 Vcore. It still runs pretty hot with 36C at idle and 80C subject to Prime95, but at least it's stable and no longer throttles. I've heard that significant thermal improvements can be made by delidding and replacing the stock TIM under the IHS, so I'll look into doing that in the future.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2017
Reviews: I recently purchased this CPU for a high performance system I was building. I wanted the K-model so the processor would be unlocked and my new Asus Hero-9 motherboard would let me over-clock the chip. I was able to clock this processor at 5-ghz with no problems, completely stable. The installation was easy and everything booted up with no issues. This CPU does run hotter than some of the previous chips I've had but at 5-ghz you've got to expect some extra heat. Just make sure to install a good CPU cooler, either quality fan/heatsink or water cooled unit. I thought the price was very reasonable as well. Intel makes great quality CPU chips and you can't go wrong buying this top speed processor!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2017
Reviews: Before the Ryzen release I was planning on purchasing this processor. Moving from an AMD FX-8120 nearly anything would be better, but this has the best specs I was looking for.When Ryzen was announced I was immediately curious how the low end 7 series Ryzen (AMD RYZEN 7 1700) would stack up with the i7-7700k and to my surprise, though the 1700 has more cores, it has a considerably lower clock speed. When the benchmarks came out the i7-7700k still performs single core operations better and for me that is important so I went with it.TL;DR Though Ryzen has more cores, the i7-7700k is still better for single core operations. Glad to see there is some competition this time.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsNice ship, just runs a little toasty.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2017
Reviews: Its a little toasty but not bad.  I ran an i5 7600k on the same rig and this chip runs 10c hotter at load, on same cooling, but does provide smoother frames as I expected vs the i5.  Really only a 15 to 20 frame gain in my favorite game though so in hindsight I'd say just get the i5 7600k for gaming and a cooler chip overall. Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsEven if its 'Used', still works fine.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2019
Reviews: Bought this CPU off the Amazon Warehouse "Used-Like New".  Chip arrived looking good, no thermal paste residue or anything to tell it had been used.  Was backwards in the CPU plastic sleeve though, but no damage to the capacitors.Ran a stress test and it was stable, boosts to its correct clock.7700K matchs well with a Vega 64 and will run just about anything, was like night an day upgrading from an i5 7500.Delivery time was kept true as well, very impressed.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSo far so good 😊
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
Reviews: So far so good, we got this in a few weeks ago.  I had Best Buy install the CPU for me, after our original CPU(same model#)died on us.  My son uses it on our HP Omen desktop for playing Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and Fortnite.  The only thing that we have issues with currently is the fan is really loud, but I don’t believe it to be a CPU problem.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2017
Reviews: When I installed this I didn't initially realize my mobo automatic boost clocker (MSI Gaming M7) was cranked up.  After a while I discovered that it had been running OC'd @ 5.2 ghz the whole time!  Oops!  Now I immediately cranked it down to an easy breezy 4.6 ghz at this time.  While I didn't actually run a stress test on it while it was at 5.2 to check for stability, I was performing some fairly cpu intensive tasks and encountered no issues.  Maybe one day I'll go ahead and turn the dial back up and see what it will stress to.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2017
Reviews: I bought this to replace my Core i5-4690K that was overclocked to 4.5Ghz. This one overclocked to 5.0Ghz at 1.32v on an ASUS Prime Z270-A using a Corsair H115i for cooling. Between the higher clock speed, IPC improvements from Haswell -> Broadwell -> Sky/Kaby Lake, and Hyperthreading it's a LOT faster in multi-threaded applications, and a bit faster in games when paired with a GTX 1080.If you've got the cash to spend and are upgrading from a 4.5Ghz i5 Haswell or slower it's a decent upgrade. If you already have a recent i7 or 6000 series chip hitting that magic 5.0Ghz is awesome, but probably won't provide much of a real world speed increase.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood Upgrade from i3 6100
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2019
Reviews: The i7-7700K is working really great for me, and many things noticeably perform better now.  I left the base clock the same so far, but it's taking advantage of Intel Turbo Boost Technology when it can.I have a GIGABYTE Z170 motherboard, and with a bios update it made it compatible with the Kaby Lake (7XXX) series processors.  I paired this processor with a Cooler Master Hyper 212 Evo for cooling.  Was using an i3-6100 processor before.I'm very happy with this processor.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat CPU but way to hot even on stock voltage
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2017
Reviews: Great CPU but I would recommend getting it delid. This thing runs really hot on stock voltage with the evo 212 cooler I was getting about 85C. while gaming then I was able to get the temps to about 77C with the corsair cooler while gamingAfter delid you can get 5ghz around 68 to 74c range. I sent my cpu off to silicon lottery took less then 5 days to get it delid and tested and returned back to me.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLove It, But Would've Went Ryzen
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2018
Reviews: What to say? I have mine delidded and overclocked to 5GHz on a Corsair H100v2.  Insanely fast, though it's a shame you practically have to delid it to see any decent temperatures.  In the end, while that is Intel's fault, it doesn't reflect on the chip, per-se.It really is a beast, and my only regret is purchasing this a month before Ryzen came out because I didn't believe Ryzen would be what it is and expected another Bulldozer-style release.  Hind-sight is 20/20, and with that, I would have gone Ryzen.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWorks great, runs a little hot but that's normal.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2018
Reviews: I like it very much.  This is the fastest CPU that will fit in my Gigabyte Z170x Gaming 5.  Overclocks just fine from 4.2 GHz to 4.7.  The only thing to note is that the Kaby Lake runs at a significantly higher temperature than other CPUs in this generation: 50C (med) to 70C (heavy), but don't be alarmed, that's normal for this particular processor.  Also, if you're running an NVidia graphics card (using GTX 1060 SSC 6gb), opt to offload the PhysX processing from the GPU to the CPU and you will get even more performance out of it.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsSuper fast CPU that needs a good cooler.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2017
Reviews: This is a top end CPU. It scores well in benchmark tests and runs everything with ease.The only cravat is that it does run quite warm. I have it overclocked to 4.8 and during demanding games it runs at about 70c which is the same as my video card. I have a high end cooling solution and I would expect it to run a bit cooler. It's still far from its thermal limit despite the warm temperatures so I'm not too concerned.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2017
Reviews: Getting an average of 60fps in Players Unknown made me realize it was time to upgrade my CPU to the new i7.I now get 100-144FPS depending on the exterior locations. I am at 66% GPU usage and 38% CPU usage according to MSI Afterburner. Therefore, if I could do this build again I would highly recommend to get a cheap, under $40 aftermarket air cooler and spend the rest of your budget on a GTX 1080ti as my GTX 1080 is now now the bottleneck. Instead I opted for a dual rad thinking I would just overclock. My mistake.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsRight out of the box this was a great CPU running at 4
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2017
Reviews: Right out of the box this was a great CPU running at 4.5GHz. Then in about an hour of trial&error with a few stress tests(in total, probably 10 configuring and 40 minutes of stress tests), I got it running smoothly at 5GHz. I love this thing. My PC and apps are so fast and responsive it's ridiculous. Thanks to watercooling, the hottest I can get this thing is ~65C but that's going way past normal use for unnecessary periods of time. I attached a screenshot of a 10min stress test.P.s. I'm using the Corsair H100i liquid cooling setup.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsGood product, bad lottery picks
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2017
Reviews: The silicon lottery did not bless Amazon, the grouping they received are of the lesser chips. Recommend buying elsewhere unless your fine with stock everything.. But fast shipping, check your batch #'s when you get your processor.1st letter or digit = plant code: (Malaysia)0 = San Jose, Costa Rica1 = Cavite, Philippines3 = Costa Rica6 = Chandler, Arizona7 = Philippines8 = Leixlip, Ireland9 = Penang, MalaysiaL = MalaysiaQ = MalaysiaR = Manila, PhilippinesY = Leixlip, Ireland2nd digit = Year of production: (2007)3rd & 4th digits = week: (7th week )5th digit = Stepping (A or B or C)6th – 8th digits = lot number: (723)10th – 13th digits = serialization code (—)

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2017
Reviews: I have yet to test the limits on this cpu, however it worked out of the box and has done very well at regular tasks. I have it paired with an h100i v2 liquid cooler and it has not exceeded 36*CEdit: I have now tested the limits of this CPU and it exceeds my expectations. Overclocked it and never got over 60*C. Even running music production DAW's or processor-intensive games at their max, it doesn't break a sweat. I haven't seen it use more than 80% of it's total power during everyday use.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2017
Reviews: I rate this product 5 stars due to the raw performance I’m impressed although it is literally almost 0 difference to the previous i7-6700k but with a slight boost, does well with water cooling and stays in the 30’s Celsius with water cooling although I’ve done some research about different voltages with different motherboards can cause the processor to run very hot in the 90’s Celsius, so I’d recommend researching the compatibility between the motherboard your planning to or have bought with the processor before buying this product but overall great CPU as usual

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsWindows 7 lives on. Hotter than h*ck
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2017
Reviews: Runs games well. according to PC bottleneck calculator, it works splendid with anything thru 1080ti down to 1060. I have windows 7, and one open source patch to enable security updates (look it up) and I'm off to the races until my next upgrade.Seems to run hot, eh though it's only 9W more powerful than my previous. If you have a wimpy water-cooler, I'd be ready to push-pull fan it.*EDIT*4.6 GHz overclock (lowest possible increment in gigabyte bios) ran it into dangerously high temp territory... 96C with spikes higher. Severely disappointed, since Intel's only response is to say "We don't advise you to overclock of you don't want to overheat, lel".Absolutely ridiculous. Delid or f off when it comes to overclocking this. Go with ryzen.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsKaby-Lake takes the cake!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2017
Reviews: What can I say that you have not already heard? the i7 7700K is the bomb mainstream CPU. 4.2 - 4.5 with boost out of the box and still over clockable! I have one running at 5.0 all cores no worries! After 6 hours Aida64 max package temp was 66 C. Yes, I am running a 280mm AIO so that does help with the temps. So does using Thermal Grizzly Kryonaut. I used this CPU in my two most recent builds. One for workstation productivity and the other on a gaming rig. Kaby Lake ROCKS!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019
Reviews: As always performance wise intel always delivers, sadly due to the current state of the market with a really high demand of intel processors with not enough supply prices are not ideal, a great processor but budget wise you could do better with an AMD one currently.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest processor I had so far.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2020
Reviews: Is been a couple years since I  bought it and still working great even compare to some of the new models.  Although AMD has some great cpu’s at a cheaper price there is nothing like an intel. By the way I do have a second PC with an AMD processor but I still like my Intel.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2017
Reviews: As everyone has already stated.... Heat issues right out of the box. Chip is great but the TIM that intel used is utter garbage. Unless you delid your cpu to replace that stuff, dont expect to OC too much. Currently to keep my temps reasonable im at 4.6ghz at 1.25v with 85c under stress tests. Real world gaming only takes me into low to mid 70's though. Im certain upon delidding this thing I could easily get 5ghz+ with safe temps. So because of the terrible TIM used by the factories I'll give this a 3 star. It would be an easy 5 star if the chips had never left the factory with such inadequate paste.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsAmazing Beast Processor, Cut Corner Manufacturing (For Shame Intel)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2017
Reviews: I love it, but the IHS is obviously struggling to pull heat off the DIE through the garbage chewing gum Intel stuck between them! Example: From 30 to 70c and back again in seconds on water, every time you open ANYTHING @stock w/most recent BIOS etc... Intel support says 100% Normal. Still rocks games, though to too hot to push the clocks, delidding may be in the works, shouldn't even be necessary.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2018
Reviews: Hopefully last as long as my I7 860. 7+ years. good speed on default clock, minimal lags. i remember having a issue with 90% load when i first purchased it, like day 1 of operation. I was nervous at first. could have been a software issue. Handles all tasks with ease, from high quality gaming to high quality video editing and rendering when paired with a good video card. im using it with a RX480 and it gets the job done everytime, anytask.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsThis sucker gets warm. Jumping from a 3770k to ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2017
Reviews: This sucker gets warm.  Jumping from a 3770k to this, the first thing I noticed was how wildly fast the 'Speed Shift 2' is.  Shifting speeds went from 100 ms to 10~ which is crazy fast.  In general it's a little disappointing to have so little change in 5ish years.  You would think more cores would have become the standard by this point.  We'll see how Ryzen turns out.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat CPU but, make sure you the right PSU for gaming build.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2017

My Radeon RX 480 Red Devil was throttling and the fans (3) that are on the GPU were pulling too much power. Had to under clock the GPU and the fans.  I'm sure once I get the 1000w EVGA g3 installed it will be fine. I have Rosewill 750 which does not deliver enough power.  Make sure you don't make my mistake.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2017

I would suggest a well established (ie known to work well) air cooler, or an aio for this chip. If you are over clocking then definitely take cooling highly into consideration for your build. I still think this chip has viability in the long term for gaming and should give you a great experience when paired with higher end GPUs.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
