Perhaps if you are in the market for a new system and would like to rule out that your processor is capable of a certain frequency, well that’s where these guys can come in very handy. Currently they are selling 4690K / 4790K and even 5960X processors that have been preselected and tested for you. Go check them out, our experiences with them has been nothing other than pleasant and the product does exactly as advertised.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars4.4Ghz on all cores MSI enhanced turbo, 25-30C idle temps, 8 thread monster!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2015
Reviews: This is a fantastic CPU! I wanted to build an ITX gaming rig and this processor should keep my system up to spec for many years into the future, especially with DirectX12 helping CPUs be more useful in games. I'm using an MSI Z97I AC motherboard with this chip. The MSI board lets me use an 'enhanced turbo' feature that makes the Intel Turbo Boost work on all the cores (up to 4.4Ghz). With a Noctua NH-D9L cooler I'm getting idle temps at 25-30C with the fan @ 1000rpm (very quiet) running the 4.4Ghz on all cores. I could overclock to get closer to 5.0Ghz but it is probably not worth it as this chip is already overkill for most apps and games. I'll be looking forward to what AMD is going to do with Zen, but for now this 4790K is the chip to have!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPretty Fast for a LGA 1150 socket Processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2015
Reviews: It's not an extreme series, but it ranks right up there for a LGA1150 socket.  I have another gaming computer running an i7-6 core extreme LGA2011 system and it is freak'in fast.  And side by side (with overclocking on the 4790k), I'm very impressed with the speed (OK, so its a few milliseconds slower - I blinked!).  Only through performance testing or multiple programs opened, can you really see the difference.  If your planning on gaming and can't afford the extreme series and want to save some money, this is the best bang for the buck.  Don't disappoint yourself and get a lower mHz processor.  I know you don't want to hear it, but I told you so (Should-A, Could-A, Would-have)!.Comes with a standard fan for normal clocking and installation, or you can add an h100i to overclock it!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIt is an I7 - You get what you pay for!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2015
Reviews: Skylake might be new but does not mean it is worth upgrading. It is ok if you need a brand new computer but not for an upgrade.  Buying new ram, mobo and cpu is not worth that much money for the small increase in performance.The 4790k will be a hard cpu to beat for gaming. It already has the same thermal design as Skylake and can overclock to make up a loss in its age.My old I7 870 still works like a champ and has outlasted everything else in my old computer. The I7 is great cpu for someone that does not want to upgrade every time a new one comes out because of it's top tier features.Read reviews from actual testings websites and you will see why 4790k is one of the best LGA1150 cpu's for gaming.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsKing of the CPU - Hey Meltdown!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2014
Reviews: The 4790k fixes everything wrong with 4770k for the same price as it's predecessor. You will experience no slowdowns and your computer will fly through literally anything you throw at it. while overclocked, this CPU can beat out intel's lower-end 6 core, socket 2011, Enthusiast CPU's at stock. This processor is also just fun to play with, being a great overclocker due to it's redesigned power management and redisigned TIM. If you have a 4770k, it might not be enough to jump the gun, but if you're looking for an upgrade, this is the one.Edit: Due to the Meltdown fix, CPU speed and I/O speeds have been reduced, (the latter far more than the former). Still, this is not acceptable, and as such I have knocked a star of the review.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsCombined with an SSD and a good graphics card and there is virtually no way to ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2015
Reviews: My goodness this thing is fast. For the last 3 years I've used a laptop with an i7-2760QM. It's a laptop processor, but it's still an i7 so I was getting decent performance. I recently built my own desktop as a development station, and chose this processor as my CPU.The delivery was very quick, it comes with its own cooling fan but you'll definitely want to go ahead and pick up an aftermarket cooler. I bought an H100i to go with it and my temps have been well below 40C even while stress testing.This thing is blazing fast. I tested all of my programs that I originally wrote and tested on my laptop and this thing increases their run-time by anywhere from %40-150. Combined with an SSD and a good graphics card and there is virtually no way to be dissapointed.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsToo hot to handle!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2015
Reviews: You're so fast, i love you too, i7-4790k :D But oh how you burn me up when you run so hot! I was getting 95*c temps under load with this processor until i turned the voltage down to 1.20. Then it was around 80 to 85*c. That's still a little too high for my liking.I'd recommend you pair this with an aftermarket cooler, specifically the Corsair Hydro Series H55. I found it to be a very good cooler that dropped my load temps to 45*c, peaking at around 60*c tops!Just don't make the mistake i made and buy this processor, test it, find that it runs hot, go out and get the cooler, and then have to remove the old stock fan. What a pain in the butt. One stop shopping. Get the hyrdo cooler when you get the processor. Good luck!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsThis processor is overrated.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2015
Reviews: I've seen better from intel. Having a i5 2550k which was fast when it was still up to date  along with and amd fx 8350, which was so so. I had to go into the bios to optimize it otherwise it would be slow.i have ssd 256 GB , 32 GB ram, motherboard is ASUS Z97-A . Why would i have to overclock to be able to do web browsing and word processing for research papers? Not only is it not exactly bargain price but this machine is not used for current high resource demand gaming.That said, i am disappointed and i hope the planned obsolescence model goes for more quality down the line knowing that you will have to replace it in a couple years since it wont be able to load a couple tabs in the browser after all the updates that comes with software. Chrome and Firefox frequently crash . i use around 30-40 tabs in internet browsing sometimes more. The year is 2015 not 1998. If you charge top price for a quad core then you have to make it top quality.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsRuns cool for me
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2015
Reviews: This processor is amazing.  I read some reviews on it that said it runs very hot which gave me some concern; however, with the stock fan, I'm doing light work like browsing the web and hovering around 27C.  Bioshock Infinite gave me a steady 75C on Ultra mode, and Star Citizen runs about 68C.  I did order some Arctic Silver 5 and put some on my the cover of the processor (no deliding needed) before installing the fan, so that might be helping.  Considering the price of this CPU, 10 more bucks seems well worth it.I'm extremely happy with this purchase and would highly recommend it.  I've been playing Star Citizen in the highest graphics mode, hooked up to an Oculus Rift at 1900res, and this processor has been handling it extremely well. Great buy for a gamer.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsDevil's Canyon absolutely rocks.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2014
Reviews: This is an absolutely fantastic enthusiast level processor.  Well done Intel.  I love this thing and I want to marry it!  The only bad thing I can say is this is prob what Haswell should have been from the get go.  This bad boy runs stock at 4GHz!!!!  Super fast and cooler than the i7 4770k with Intel's new secret TIM (idle is 23-25C using a Corsair H80i).  And when I say its fast- I mean lightning bolt fast.  AMAZING.  Crazy fast and runs cool!My MSI Gaming motherboard has an "Enhanced Turbo" feature and forces all four cores to run at 4.4GHz all the time.  And this is all before any actual overclocking.  It's insanity!!!  But in a good way.If you have the means, get a Z97 mobo and this processor.  You won't regret it.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2021
Reviews: Product as described, fits socket and shipping was quick, however the carrier decided to put this $300 cpu right next to my garbage can... other then that no problems thus far

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis thing is a BEAST (in the best way possible)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2015
Reviews: This processor is a beast. I needed a new server setup for the streaming, syncing, live security camera capture, transcoding, software RAID parity calculation, and a bunch of other stuff I recently decided to add. My old dual core would just outright stall and require a hard reboot to come back up. With this processor, I don't think I've ever seen it go above 70% utilization. It's quick, efficient, and if I need to downclock a bit for more efficiency or cooling I can due to the unlocked multiplier.I can only imagine what this would do in a gaming or editing build. It's probably massively overpowered for most people (even most gamers would be hard pressed to need more than an i5 k series chip), but for those that will benefit from it... get it!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2014
Reviews: I love this thing!  Pretty sure I won't need to worry about upgrading my CPU anytime soon.  Install was easy although I didn't even try using the supplied cooler.  I had it sitting under a Corsair Hydro h105 and it stays around 32*C with web browsing, watching HD video, music, and Office use.  When playing Diablo 3, it will hit 50*C.  Tomb Raider on maxed out graphic settings see 60*C and it runs SMOOOOOOTH.  I'm sure temps get higher during some of the more intense scenes but I haven't seen it happen yet.  I have it overclocked at 4.4ghz and run PNY GTX 770 OC with it.  I only have the cooler plus 2 intake+1 exhaust fans moving air in a mid-tower.  I will probably get one more higher RPM fan just for piece of mind though.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGuaranteed will not be the bottleneck
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2016
Reviews: Impressive speed.  Use mine for video editing/compressing, gaming, everything.  Never had this CPU bottleneck anything I've done.If this CPU becomes your bottleneck then my diagnosis is one of three things:  1) Your workload is intensive enough, in which case you most likely know a thing or two about PCs, and therefore should have known better.  2) You are doing stuff that is beyond the league of a common consumer CPU.  3) You are doing video compression (or similar) just like me and are going to see 100% cpu usage by design.  4) Run a virus scan, because you probably have a virus :)Can't go wrong with this one (for an older generation).

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIt is GREAT, except for that cooler.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2015
Reviews: Great CPU, renders videos extremely fast for me. Overall great CPU. THE ONLY THING IS THAT COOLER. I have never said this before as the stock cooler for my previous CPU and APU have been fine (as in not annoying loud in my opinion). But for this one please do yourself a favor and get a aftermarket cooler. I personally have not yet because of financial reasons but when I am rendering videos or playing a Cities Skyline that fan is so loud. And it is really ineffective when the CPU is being stressed at those levels. My PC does not crash but 80c-85c is not cool. During normal gaming it almost never goes over 60c however and sounds fine. But since I render videos for YouTube frequently it does get a bit annoying.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSo fast that I didn't even bother overclocking it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2014
Reviews: I built my previous computer more than 6 years ago, and was due a refresh. So, naturally, I wanted the best bang-for-the-buck processor in my new build. Enter the i7-4790K. Four cores, eight threads, and a base clock speed of 4 GHz make this processor a best buy, IMO. They redesigned the thermal layer in this CPU, so the temperatures remain incredibly manageable while overclocking it. That being said, this processor is so fast that I haven't even bothered OC'ing it, and my setup is more than capable of doing so - it's paired with an ASRock Z97 motherboard, fast RAM, etc.This processor is a no-brainer for anyone looking to upgrade, and if you pair this with a solid state drive, it'll blow your mind how fast everything becomes. Amazon will only let me give it 5 stars, but it truly deserves more.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2022
Reviews: I was a little hesitant about attempting to upgrade my processor on my Dell Inspiron 3847 from an i5 to an i7 but it was extremely easy.  Would have done it earlier if I had known.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2015
Reviews: Outstanding for single thread performance - I only upgrade every few years, and you can really feel the benefit of not only a fast clock speed but also the incremental improvements in instructions per cycle. Compared to my 5 year old dual Xeon X5670 (12 cores, 2.93 Ghz) this is about ~85% faster for single threaded tasks. For multithreaded tasks this quad-core CPU performs as my old computer using 7 cores.  I do not play games, but the built in graphics are sufficient for volume rendering, and the graphics driver support for Linux seems solid. I did not overclock my unit - so I can not comment on that. However, for stock performance this is a blazingly fast CPU. I used a basic Rosewill RCX-ZAIO-92 cooler and this provides reasonable temperatures without generating much noise.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars0 GHz base clock Great potential to overclock Runs cool under a watercooler Cons
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2016
Reviews: I've already written a review for this on Newegg so I'll keep it short.Pros:4 cores with hyperthreading8 MB cache4.0 GHz base clockGreat potential to overclockRuns cool under a watercoolerCons:Price, still $340 after almost 3 years?Slightly slower than SkylakeThoughts:I upgraded from a 4690k to stream and game simultaneously, I see little to no difference in gaming performance from my 4690k to my 4790k. So if you're only gaming don't waste money on an i7. Also, this chip needs way more voltage to reach 4.8GHz than my i5. The i5 only needed 1.26v, this needs 1.35v. I got lucky with my i5 on the silicon lottery.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis is a monster
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2016
Reviews: Technically it's old technology but you could never tell by its performance.  This thing is a monster when it comes to most tasks. Only really have two comlaints if u call it that.  Like all things intel price,  definitely dents the pocket book a little.  The second would be the stock cooler is kinda weak.  Under full load the stock cooler can't keep up.  I definitely recommend an upgraded cooler to be used with this chip.  With no over clock this was getting a little warmer than I would of liked to see.  I would rather them drop a few bucks and ditch the cooler supplied or add a few bucks and give us something better.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars4790K is the way to go if you have money to blow
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2015
Reviews: works great. my Window's power profile and my BIOS overclock has it running from 1.2GHz-4.6Ghz. temps have never passed 55°C with intense 1440p gaming. idles ~37°C.worth the money if you get it on sale ~$320.handles DDR3 2400 RAM with no problem.disappointed that i don't see the huge improvement in games so many tout. my FX8350 @ 4.8GHz got very near the same scores\fps in 3DMark, Tomb Raider, Hitman: Absolution, Dirt3, and others with built-in benchmarks. a slight improvement but not like all the intel fanboys like to cry on forums. i would stick with the FX990\8350 if doing it over.along with my 8GB 290X every game is totally maxed out @ 1080p, mostly maxed @ 1440p. sits right @ 60fps on a 60Hz display.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat Price and Satisfied.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2021
Reviews: I was satisfied with my purchase, it came in through the mail a week early. Only one thing that was a bummer was that the price dropped $20 within two days after I had already bought the CPU. Over all pretty happy though!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat processor, but came used.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2015
Reviews: Great processor, but came used.The processor is great value for money. But it would be remiss of me not to mention that the new unit I paid for from Amazon came used.The first warning sign was that the CPU was placed upside down within its packaging. Then, upon opening the retail box (Factory Seal was already broken), I noticed the CPU had thermal paste on it already and the Fan’s thermal paste was disturbed. Clearly the unit was used before.However, Amazon’s customer service was great. They offered to replace the unit.Overall great product, disappointing experience, but good customer service.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsFantastic Chip! Does run hot without a good heat sink.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2017
Reviews: I have this clocked at 4.7ghz at 1.25v running stable using the Noctua dh-14. I originally had my old hyper 212 evo with it... This card definitely runs hot. I don't recall exactly, but I do remember that some of my first overclocking attempts at 4.5 or 4.6 ghz with the evo ran it up to 95+C, which I then left decided to leave the default settings be. Paired with a good cooler, this card does have good potential, but if you're not going to spend $60+ on an aircooler to overclock it, you might want to look at a different cpu because this chip runs hot.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2015
Reviews: I built a new performance desktop and used this processor.  It has plenty of power so I didn't even bother to overclock it, just leaving it in turbo mode.  I don't have a problem with it over heating either, so I think the prior Haswell heat problems might be fixed with the refresh.  I have been amazed at the speed of it when decoding and encoding video.We use Amazon for most of our purchases and I update my reviews if anything changes with the products. I do this so other Amazon users can get a real feel for the life of the product.  I am not associated with any company and all opinions are my very own.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsNot the best bang for buck. But still a good cpu.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020
Reviews: Was good for gaming but came overclocked out of the box so it ran a bit hot. I fixed that though.  Not sure if it was worth the extra 100$ over the i5 4690k since they both had similar performance but I wanted to "future proof" so I just sided with the i7.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2023
Reviews: It did exactly what was advertised

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat CPU For the Enthusiastic gamer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2015
Reviews: up to this point, the CPU is truly fast an is able to fulfill 60 fps on my gaming rig on my gtx980 with quality maxed out while recording with Fraps. i recommend getting a premium heat sink for this CPU because it is Overclockable and (unlocked) for better turbo-boosting (because its an I7) and quieter cooling. but it does come with a stock air heat sink.3797 on Fire Strike Ultra/ Intel Core i7-4790K/ NVIDIA GeForce GTX 980my processor in benchmarks returned this.Reported stock core clock  4,000 MHzMaximum turbo core clock  4,400 MHzPhysical / logical processors  1 / 8# of cores  4Package  LGA1150TDP  88 W

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis chip converted and AMD supporter
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2015
Reviews: This CPU is proof of intel's dominance! I have been an AMD nerd for years, but recently i was presented with a challenge by a good friend of mine... to do some research and prove that AMD will out preform Intel. I took on this challenge and did a fair amount of research, testing, and questioning. What i found was this chip! This chip was enough to get me to change up my entire build to fit it. The sheer speed and fluidity that this cpu operates with is beautiful. I have had this chip in my rig for a few weeks now and have found nothing that was able to beat my AMD 9750. This is an amazing chip and i would recommend it to everyone.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat, but pricey and runs hot.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2016
Reviews: Stock cooler is absolutely terrible! I mean that too, A-B-S-O-L-U-T-E-L-Y new word T-E-R-R-I-B-L-E. Running the stock setup I saw temps over 65c. With a Corsair h100i GTX I can overclock to a nice 4.7 and never see anything north of 50c (not that I left it overclocked - stock and this cooler is a steady 35c!)If you're a power user this is a great CPU, but even then a lot of video products like Handbrake can utilize a nice GPU in lieu of a nicer CPU. Between the heat issues and price difference over an i5 ($100) I'd make sure I needed the i7. Just something to think about if you're on the fence.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 21, 2012
Reviews: Just built my new rig today, This cpu (With BeQuiet Shadow Rock 4HP Cpu cooler), 16Gb Ram, Gtx 670 FTW, Asrock Z77 Extreme 6 and an OCZ 128gb SSD.This processor is superb so far, I haven't installed the GPU yet, as my PSU's wires are not long enough to reach the damn CPU power plug, so ordered a new PSU...Anyway, this is the thing, the new Intel HD 4000 integrated graphics are absolutely amazing!!! - Really! - Since I won't be using the 670 for a few days I thought I'd try out the integrated graphics on Minecraft...Expecting a choppy 20fps on low settings I made a new map, but to my surprise, it plays everything at 1920x1200 on high at a very reasonable 50fps, I was stunned!Also, the aftermarket cooler I bought, does a great job, keeps the cpu idling at a nice 25c, And a decent 39c when playing Minecraft... And all for 40 quid! I recommend!Anyway, this processor has turned out to be quite the piece! - I don't plan on overclocking but I'm sure that it would do that nicely too!If you have £250 to spend on a high quality reliable and surprising cpu, get this, it's worth it's weight in gold!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on February 15, 2014
Reviews: premetto che vengo da un i7 920 passando attraverso un i5 3470.ero passato a quest'ultimo per ridurre i consumi poichè il pc è sempre acceso, sulla carta le prestazioni dovevano essere identiche ma la realtà si è dimostrata ben diversa, per questo motivo mi sono deciso ad un nuovo upgrade con questo i7, il miosistema ha ritrovato la sua reattività e le prestazioni desiderate, già col moltiplicatore a default il pc ha ottime prestazioni che migliorao ulteriormente aumentando il clock con facilità fin oltre i 4,5GHz.il processore consuma davvero poco (tra gli 8 e i 60W) e le temperature rimangono sempre basse.a chi lo consiglio? fondamentalmente ai privati, agli appassionati che già possiedono un pc su piattaforma 1155 e desiderano un computer potente e reattivo, capace di svolgere qualsiasi compito senza mostrare fatica pur con un occhio di riguardo al prezzo ed ai ai consumi.per chi ha le stesse esigenze e dovesse partire da zero forse conviene passare direttamente ad haswell, mentre per quanto riguarda i professionisti mi orienterei maggiormente sul socket 2011

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in France on July 20, 2013
Reviews: Actuellement un des meilleurs processeurs du marché pour son prix, et la 4ème génération Haswell est inutile pour le peu de performance en plus, contentez-vous d'un i5 3570k déjà très puissant ou de cet i7 parfait pour les jeux, l'encodage vidéo, etc...Le mien est OC à 4,2 GHz, il peut monter plus haut mais ça me suffit largement et c'est très stable. Pour les températures, avec un be quiet! Dark Rock Pro 2 que je n'entends même pas quand il tourne à fond, je monte à 45°C grand maximum en jeu environ et en charge plus lourde 55°C, pensez à jeter le ventirad fourni, une belle bouse qui ne vaut rien et envoie l'air chaud aux alentours du processeur (RAM, étage d'alimentation, etc...).Sinon je le recommande, bien que pour du jeu uniquement l'i5 3570k suffise largement.Couplé avec une Asus P8Z77-V Pro, aucun soucis, overclocking sans soucis, vraiment aucun problème.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on December 15, 2012
Reviews: Nach einigen Problemen, weil zwei verschiedene MSI Z77 Boards im Auslieferungszustand nichts mit der i7 CPU anfangen konnten und erst ein BIOS Update benötigten, habe ich jetzt folgende Kombination laufen:CPU Intel Core i7-3770KThermalright HR-02 MACHO CPU-KühlerMainboard MSI Z77A GD8016 GB RAM ( 4 x 4 GB Corsair CC9 Venegeance LP Module)SAMSUNG SSD 250 GB (SSD 840)und eine 2 TB Platte als Datengrabim Zalmann Z9 GehäuseDer Rechner der absolute Wahnsinn.Drei Sekunden nach der Anmeldung ist der Desktop bedienbar - Photoshop und Office (große Excel Sheets) Bildbearbeitung  - alles fliegt nur so was zuvor nur krauchte.- dabei ist meine alte Maschine auch nicht soooo schlecht gewesen.(i5/661 mit 3,3 GHz und 8GB RAM auf MSI GD 55 Board und recht schneller SATA HDDPer OC Genie "One Button Overclocking" schafft die CPU problemlos 4,4 GHz und wird dank des Thermalright Kühlers auch unter Vollast nicht heißer als 65 Grad (UEFI Anzeige)Die integrierte HD4000 Grafik reicht für den Alltagsbetrieb auf hohem Niveau aus - ich muss es wissen da meine neue Graka ( GTX 660 )  noch nicht eingetrudelt ist.Mehr Grafikpower benötige ich nicht, da ich kaum spiele.Ohne Übertaktung mit SSD und dem Thermalright Kühler ist das System unhörbar.und - so nebenbei bemerkt - die acht Kerne im Task Manager zu sehen, ist einfach mal ein geiles Gefühl.Im normalen Alltagsbetrieb - da muss man sich nichts vormachen - ist die CPU restlos überdimensioniert und wartet einfach nur sehr sehr schnell.Aber da ich sie von einem Amazon Shop  "gebraucht - wie neu" für 275 € bekommen habe, war der Unterschied zum i5/3570 oder der i7 3770 (ohne K) für mich vertretbarZur Qualität des Intel Kühlers kann ich nichts schreiben - die Intel Turbinen benutze ich schon seit Jahren nicht mehr.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Spain on November 15, 2013
Reviews: Es cierto que este es un procesador bastante caro,Pero sin duda alguna vale la pena invertir algo mas cuando de calidad se trata.Sus 4 nucleos a 3.5Gh hacen que tanto las aplicaciones como los juegos mas exigentes tengan unos tiempos de carga casi inexistentes. A la hora de editar tanto video como foto,solo es superado por la nueva generacion.la tecnologia de intel turbo hace que el procesador pase a una frecuencia 3.9Gh cuando se ve sobrecargado,reduciendose drasticamente cundo el ordenador esta en mdo "idle" con lo cual no solo obtenemos un rendimiento bestial si no que tambien economizamos gracias a su sistema de ahorro inteligente.tambien cabe destacar que su consumo puede regularse desde 35w hasta los 77w lo cual a la larga se traduce en un ahorro significativo frente a los procesadores de AMD si es cierto que estos ultimos son bastante mas baratos, su consumo en procesadores de gamas inferiores a esta ya se dispara hasta los 125wyo personalmente estoy muy contento con el.La unica pega que le encuentro esta en la temperatura,es cierto que llega a subir bastante,llegando a los 50-70ºlo cual es normal si tenemos en cuenta la potencia que tiene.y es cierto que sabiendo esto INTEL deberia incluir mejores disipadores.Pero con un buen sistema de refrigeracion y una buena pasta termica no da mayor problema.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Spain on March 21, 2013
Reviews: Brutal rendimiento, arranca super rapido, mueve todo con una soltura increible... Cabe decir que ciertamente vengo de un QuadCore y a lo que windows se refiere no noto una super diferencia, pero obviamente para juegos y tal es brutal, incluso ripeando peliculas no hay color, es brutal. Quizás su elevado precio tire un poco para atrás y no es tan descabellado buscar el 8 nucleos FX de AMD, pero la verdad es que por meritos propios Intel me inspira mucha más confianza.Temperaturas muy bajas, en reposo unos 20-21 grados en global de los 4 nucleos físicos y un rendimiento muy bueno.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on May 18, 2013
Reviews: Questo si che si può definire "Potenza allo stato puro".E' Incredibilmente fantastico, non teme alcuna sfida di calcolo. Sotto pressione sfodera tutta la sua grinta e affronta ogni ostacolo con una velocità pazzesca. Eccellente per editing e conversioni Audio/Video.Ovviamente consiglio "caldamente" (!) un dissipatore molto prestante per poter far stare i suoi 4 "BestiaCore" al fresco anche sotto stress in piena estate. Con un Noctua NH-U12P sta tra i 32 (idle) e i 60° (full-load).Inutile dire che come voto gli darei 6 Stelline di Platino.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on December 6, 2012
Reviews: Hab mir den Prozessor als ersatz für einen i3 2120 geholt auf einem Z77 extreme6 Mainboard von Asrock.Der Prozessor ist wirklich sehr schnell läuft bei mir problemlos auf 4,8 Ghz weiter wollte ich nicht da er darüber sehr viel Spannung braucht egal.Die Temperaturen sind nicht wie jeder schreibt so schlimm außer vllt mit dem Stock cooler welcher auch wirklich nicht für oc gedacht ist. Habe ein Screenshot raufgelasen von meinen Temps unter Prime95 @stock speed (siehe bild 50°) unter Oc bekomm ich so um die 65-70 je nach dem wieviel spannung ich reinstecke und mit wieviel rmp die lüfter drehen in dem Test liefen die lüfter glaub ich auf 1000rmp.Screen mit Temps usw:[...]

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 27, 2013
Reviews: Please let me start by point out I do some intense gaming and intense video editing as well as he light load stuff like word documents ect for college,As a computer student, I knew what I was going to need to give me the 'horse power' in all round applications. And the I7 3770K is great for this. Whilst only having 4 physical cores, it can be hyper-threaded into 8 cores. I had previously read that this wasnt as good as an 8 physical cored processor -as your probably have guessed, but I went ahead with my purchase.Instillation was relatively simple, but I was still neverous at placing the brackets back over - I didint want to damage a pin on a £250 CPU. But everything installed great! Please note, this does require 2x 6 pin power for the PSU.After instillation I done what any other self confessed geek would do; I jumped straight into my benchmark software. Firstly, I tried the Intel Burn Test -which isn't actually made by intel. This little piece of software seen all 8 threads jump up to 100% load and reached around 68 Degrees Celsius. On a after market Corsair H60 Cooler.I then used 3D Mark 11 and Vantage, unfortunately I do not have these results to share but the end result wasn't stunning but it was highly respectable.But I guess it more of a work load based thing. So I opened up my Sony Vegas Pro 12 (64 Bit) and started doing some video editing. The results were brillant! I edit in 1920x1080p full HD and the CPU was utilizing all threads for the work @ around 50-60%. I then rendered the video and the cores reached the expect 60-80% work load and raised to 50 Degrees Celsius. My 10 minute video was done in 7 minutes! I was astonished! I was previously using an AM3 AMD Phenom x4 955 BE and that took up to and hour for a similar piece!But for the gamers out there, I highly recommend this! It will be coming down in price and games will start to use those all importent threads within the next couple of years. Especially since the next gen consoles have up to 8 cores! You're really wanting a system that will run games brillantly. As I said, video editing wise this is dandy but in-games it's actually great! I play things like Shogun 2 and the recent Total War installments and the thing runs them great - I dont have any stats sorry,but It copes with any issues in 4v4 land battles at 50-60 FPS. Please note, I use a dedicated video card (GTX 570 2.5 GB).Overall,I love this CPU! It idles at around 30 Degrees for me and is clocked perfectly-I haven't tried O.C yet. But Im confident in doing so in the future. If you do alot like the things above, Get this! You'll not regret it!My Specs:Mo/Bo: ASUS Maximus V GeneRAM: 8 GB : 1333 MhzGPU: EVGA GTX 570 HD 2.5 GBCPU: I7 3770K @ 3.5 GhzPSU: X-Case 900 WattCase: X-Case S1

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in France on August 19, 2013
Reviews: Étant fanatique de matériel informatique, je suis passé de l'excellent 2500K à ce 3770K (l'i7 de référence dans la gamme Ivy Bridge) et je ne suis pas déçu.Monté avec une Asus P8Z77-V PRO, un Noctua NH-U12P SE2, 16 Go Gskill et un M4 128 Go, il donne des performances exceptionnelles. Il n'y a absolument rien qui lui résiste, c'est un plaisir d'utiliser l’ordinateur au quotidien.Au niveau overclocking il s'avère être bon élève, j'ai monté le mien à 4.5 GHz stable mais il a tendance à chauffer un tout petit plus que mon ancien 2500K à la même fréquence.Le ventirad d'origine est vraiment léger, il vaut mieux en acheter un plus performant.Les jeux vidéos ne tirent pas parti de la présence de plus de 4 cœurs, donc si c'est uniquement pour jouer un 3570K donnera les mêmes performances pour 100€ de moins.Quand à la commande sur Amazon c'est impeccable comme d'habitude, livraison gratuite et très rapide. Colis très bien emballé.Je recommande vivement ce processeur.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 28, 2013
Reviews: Pro's:Fast - HD Video, massive audio productions, gaming - not a problem. You could probably even do them all at the same time with sufficient screens (and skill!!)Extra power on tap - If you have temperature headroom, your CPU will boost itself to 3.9Ghz. The stock cooler is adequate for that sort of thing, but I replaced it with a H60 just to be safer long term.Efficient - Coupled with my Asus Z77 WS board with its advanced power tech, this CPU has got to be the most economical I have had the pleasure of owning. I am running my full system (3770k, 2 HDD, 1 SSD, 16GB DDR3 , GTX660ti) with safe headroom from a good quality 550w PSU.Con's:Cost - Fair enough its substantially cheaper here on amazon that other component retailers, but circa £240 is still a lot when you consider for most applications this chip gives you nothing over a 3570k.Also a few issues with Avid Pro Tools 10 and the turbo boost/HT tech. Pro Tools is much happier with static clock speeds from what I can tell. Some virtual instruments have hiccups with hyper threading, most noticeably NI Kontakt 5 - which is only optimised for 1,2,3 or 4 cores. When it can see 8 it just isnt happy!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Spain on March 10, 2013
Reviews: He recibido esta CPU y comparada con mi anterior quad 9550 he de decir que ha cambiado notablemente la potencia bruta del equipo. Un overclock fácil, haciendo posible subirlo sin problemas a los 4,2 ghz, además de ser una cpu bastante fresquita ( eso si, utiliza una disipación decente y no los disipadores de serie ). Chapeau por Intel. Si os sirve de comparación, he procesado una película de formato Avi a Mkv y estos son los resultados.  Q9550 = 38 minutos aprox. I7 3770K = 17 minutos.  Nada más que decir.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on October 30, 2014
Reviews: Processore magnifico, la serie K si presta molto bene agli Overclock molto stabile io ho accoppiato questo processore con una MB MSI Z77A-G43 ed una scehda video MSI GTX970 TFV 4GD5, memoria 32 GB Corsair CMZ16GX3M2A1600C10 Vengeance. Il processore a prestazioni ottime, tremperature basse sopratutto con un sistema a liquido si abbassano ulteriormente. Io con questa CPU ci faccio fotoritocco con software noti, e gioco a titoli come GTA V, BF4.Consigliato.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in France on February 27, 2013
Reviews: Acheté pour refaire entièrement ma configuration. Toutes les autres pièces ont été aussi été achetées chez Amazon.Carte mère MSI 911-7752-001 Z77A-G45Boitier Zalman Z9Alimentation Antec High Current Gamer HCG-620Carte graphique : Sapphire 11196-16-20G  AMD Radeon HD 7950 925 MhzMémoire Kingston KHX1600C9D3K2/8GX DDR3 1600 HyperX Kit2 XMPSSD Samsung - SSD Série 840 - MZ-7TD120KWWindows 8 64 bits.Les résultats sont immédiats et édifiants:Indices de performances Windows.Processeur 8.2Mémoire vive 8.2Graphiques 8.1Graphiques de jeu 8.1Disque dur principal 7.9Seul le SSD "bloque" , si on peut dire, l'indice à 7.9 !Les jeux vidéo dont BF3 sont en tout en ultra en 1920x1080Ce processeur en a vraiment sous la pédale et semble se jouer de toutes les épreuves, il est à l'origine de ma configuration.Pour ma part je n'aurais pas investi avec un autre processeur que celui ci.Le radiateur de processeur livré avec le Core I-7 me suffit largement.C'est un magnifique chef d'orchestre et toutes les pièces avec lequel vous l’associerez vous dirons merci. A environ 300 euros il n'y a pas mieux sur le marché.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on January 30, 2023
Reviews: Alles top

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in France on August 1, 2012
Reviews: Afin de remplacer ma configuration (Q9300 et asus maximus formula), j'ai opté pour le i7 3770K couplé à une asus P8Z77-V Deluxe.Après quelques tests sur différentes applications gourmandes en CPU (modélisations météo, encodage, derniers jeu, logiciels de calcul...), je ne suis vraiment pas déçu, les performances sont vraiment au rendez-vous.Seul bémol, le ventilateur livré par intel (d'où une étoile en moins). Lors des tests, je suis monté à 100°C. Je l'ai donc remplacé par un noctua et là que du bonheur : 30°C en IDLE et un max à 56°C avec les mêmes tests précédents.Je n'ai pas encore testé l'OC.Je pense être tranquille un moment avec ce processeur.Au sujet d'AMAZON, c'était ma première commande et je ne suis pas déçu, commandé le jeudi à 13h, reçu le lendemain. Colis impeccable !Je recommande ce processeur et AMAZON.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on July 9, 2013
Reviews: wenn Sie diese Rezension lesen, wird der CPU sicher schon "veraltet" sein. Die neuen Haswell kommen ja bald. Aber eigentlich sind die CPUs schnell genug, um Spiele zu zocken.Paar Eckdaten:Intel Core i7-3770k (Dritte Generation)Sockel 1155Geschwindigkeit: 3,5 GHz / 3,9 TurboBoostKerne: 4Vorsicht ist angebracht, bei der Wahl des Prozessors. Mehr GHz oder Mehr Kerne bedeuten nicht unbedingt, dass die Programme schneller laufen. Ein Programm profitiert nur dann von mehr kernen, wenn es dafür optimiert worden ist, ist er es nicht, dann gibt es nur dann einen Vorteil, wenn man viele Prozesse gleichzeitig laufen will. Dies ist bei Spielen in der Regel nicht so. Wenn man auf die Systemvorraussetzungen von Spielen guckt sieht man i.d.R. DualCore 2,4-3,2 GHz. Spiele profitieren also nicht unbedingt von den 4 Kernen, wenn man nicht unbedingt viele Hintergrundprozesse hat. Bei den Systemvorraussetzungen wird der Resourcenverbrauch des Betriebssystems schon mit eingerechnet. Wahrscheinlich auch eines Virenscanners.Mal ein Rechenbeispiel:Ich schreibe ein Programm optimiert für Single Core. Dieses Programm berechnet mathematische Formeln. Auf einem Vierkern CPU a 2,4 GHz wird dieses Programm langsamer laufen als auf einem DualCore 3 GHz (OS und Hintergrundprozesse verwenden den 2ten Kern). Ein Programm was aber die Kerne ausnutzen kann wird auf den Vierkerner besser laufen. Man kann Single-Core Prozesse nicht Multicore machen.Dieser CPU wird lange noch aktuell bleiben, denn für Spiele ist die GPU (also Grafikkarte wesentlich wichtiger sein). Deshalb finde ich Gaming Laptops auch nicht berauschend, da man dort i.d.R. die Grafikkarte nicht wechseln kann und somit das komplette Gerät wechselt, obwohl nur die Grafikkarte neu benötigt würde.Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on June 4, 2013
Reviews: Negli ultimi anni l'evoluzione informatica è stata abbastanza ridicola, questo processore è figlio di questa scarsa evoluzione ma presenta comunque il miglior rapporto prezzo-prestazioni che si può trovare sul mercato. Certamente non vale la pena spendere di più per processori con ancora più core ma senza reale aumento di prestazioni. Questo oggetto può arrivare tranquillamente a 4,6 ghz senza alcun problema.Consiglio l'acquisto anche ora che stanno uscendo le nuove architetture Haswell che, a parte ottimizzazioni nella grafica integrata e in altre amenità, non portano alcun reale vantaggio (anzi...)

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 7, 2012
Reviews: This processor is amazing. I am very happy with the new specs and built in graphics handling. Coupled with my ASUS sabertooth Z77 this combination is amazing. The downside is the bundled cooler/fan. I cannot stress how important it is to swap it out ASAP with an alternative. With a CM Hyper 212  evo instead I am getting over 10° cooler chip on idle more even please do this immediately. The fan caused errors on initial boot and sometimes simply stalled causing great stress and worry about leaving the machine on alone. Since swapping out the cooler I have had no troubles whatsoever. Which makes me think INTELO are daft to sell a magnificent chip bundled with an inferior almost useless cooler. I cant even use it as a paperweight.. !!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Spain on May 21, 2013
Reviews: Vengo de un AMD Phenom II x 6 1100t BE 3.3Ghz, del cual ya estaba muy contento, pero me decidí a probar los nuevos Intel. Lo tengo hace ya un par de semanas y la verdad es que supera al AMD, sobretodo en facilidad y estabilidad en el overclock. También cabe destacar que el precio es bastante más elevado que el AMD pero, de hecho, lo compré en amazon porque es el sitio en donde más barato lo encontré.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on March 17, 2022
Reviews: Hab die CPU gekauft um meine alte i5-3470 auszutauschen, leider hat sich heraus gestellt, dass das Mainboard defekt war. Daher kann ich zum Produkt selbst nicht viel sagen. Die Lieferung war pünktlich und der Artikel war gut verpackt. Optisch war die CPU in einem sehr guten Zustand. Zur Funktionsfähigkeit kann ich wie gesagt nichts sagen.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on November 8, 2020
Reviews: il pc su cui è stata usato va, ma ogni tanto soffre di bug inspiegabili. Non conveniente fare controprova con CPU nuova, resta il dubbio che a volte la CPU usata faccia cilecca.  Restare sempre valido il detto popolare: "chi più spende meno spende". Ma il gioco non valeva la candela. Resta come muletto di scorta.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Spain on July 9, 2013
Reviews: Esta generación Ivy Bridge viene con el "defecto" conocido por todos y reconocido por Intel de que se calienta en exceso bajo cierta carga de trabajo, no carga extrema, basta con abrir algún software medio potente y aumentar la temperatura sin lógica alguna.Intel ha reconocido que la pasta térmica usada para transmitir el calor entre el micro y el encapsulado IHS (los metálico dónde aplicamos la pasta térmica que lo unirá al disipador) es de "mala calidad", consecuencia, pues que en idle el procesador se mantiene en temperaturas "lógicas" 36-42º, pero cuando lo estresas llega a subir hasta 85 y 90º, algo jamás visto en sus antecesores (todo esto probado con Prolimatech Megahalems + 2 ventiladores Noctua).En uso común de carga de trabajo importante o incluso con juegos como Crysis 3, es fácil verle subir y situarse entre los 50-55º (todo esto con un disipador enorme).El procesador es potente, muy bueno, pero hay que conocer este "pequeño" defecto. No obstante recomiendo encarecidamente NO usar el disipador de stock. Incluso si se es un poco manitas cambiar la pasta del IHS pero perdereis la garantía.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in France on August 23, 2019
Reviews: Que dire sur ce processeur si ce nest qu'il est le meilleur et ultime processeur compatible avec la plateforme Ivi Bridge ? l’intérêt c'est que 6 ans plus tard il reste un excellent processeur tout a fait capable de rivaliser avec les meilleures machines actuelles. En réalité les nouveau procs ne sont que des évolutions de cette plateforme sandybridge/ivibridge qui a apporté une vrai révolution et donné une avance technologique considérable de Intel sur AMD.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 23, 2014
Reviews: This Ivy Bridge Core i7 is a superb processor with incredible performance, it will be amongst the top CPUs in any benchmark, I got mine to replace my Ivy Bridge i5 3550 when I upgraded my gaming PC. The i7 is not really that necessary for a gaming machines and the performance increase from my previous CPU is tiny, 5-10 FPS at the very best usually. I went for this i7 to give a measure of future proofing though, this CPU should be more than enough to handle whatever game is thrown at it over the next few years.For normal desktop tasks users will appreciate the improvements in the HD graphics 4000 on board graphics, without a discrete GPU this will play HD videos with ease and handle any and all browser, social media and undemanding indie games. It will even play some  AAA and more demanding 3D games at low and medium settings, just do not expect it to knock your socks off.For tasks like video encoding this i7 has a noticeable performance advantage over the Sandy Bridge 2600K and the Ivy Bridge 3570K, in summery if you want/need an Intel Ivy Bridge chip this is everything you could ask for.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 5, 2024
Reviews: Good product, works well, as described. I think it could have been packaged better as it could have easily arrived damaged.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on November 5, 2014
Reviews: Habe es seit ca. 2 monaten. Funktioniert recht gut. Jedoch würde sich vom Preis mehr lohnen direkt die 4. Generation zu holen

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in France on May 4, 2013
Reviews: Déposé au fond d'un grand carton avec d'autres composants informatiques beaucoup plus lourds et/ou massifs, protection illusoire par remplissage partiel de papier froissé.Problème récurrent au service expédition de Amazon.fr,d’où une étoile en moins.Remarques répétitives à ce sujet, toujours ignorée du service clientèle.Seconde étoile en moins et perte du client.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on November 30, 2020
Reviews: Non mi è piaciuto che sul prodotto in vendita ci dia l'immagine della scatole originale, compreso ventola di raffreddamento e poi in realtà trattasi di articolo ricondizionato.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Spain on July 14, 2013
Reviews: Me decanté por la version "k" de este procesador y muy satisfecho de haberlo hecho, lo tengo trabajando con overclock a un tope de 5.0 ghz, y es una maravilla, lo que un core 2 duo me hace en 5 horas, me lo hace este en apenas 10 minutos, una barbaridad en cuanto calentamiento, prestaciones...

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 23, 2013
Reviews: This replaced my very good core i7- 920 (LGA1366). I had the old CPU running at 3.6 GHz with 9 GB triple-channel DDR3 RAM. This one I have at up to 4.3 GHz with 8 GB Dual-channel DDR3 RAM. Although, on paper, this is achieving higher speeds, but I really almost can't notice a difference between this and the old system.My settings are..BCLK/PEG freq at 105 and my core ratio limit (multiplier) is set to 41 giving me CPU boosts up to 4300 MHz and it idles at 1680 MHz.CPU: DRAM speed ratio at 100:133, memory freq at DDR3 1680 MHz with memory timings at Auto and DRAM voltage at 1.5 v.I am used to setting vCore value as I am told it helps system stability so I set CPU voltage at 1.190 v.I have not seen CPU temp above 40C and it usually idles at 36C with Intel's own stock fan cooler (in the old system, my idle temp used to be 45C and up to 58C and this is the really only noticeable difference from the old system). My system is stable, but I might tweek things a bit more later. Can't comment on the graphics as have a graphics card.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 27, 2012
Reviews: Overclocked it to 4.3Ghz and got it stable. I think its enough for me at the moment.Gigabyte Sniper M3 motherboardSettings: automatic voltageCPU cooler Noctua NH-D14 does a job keeping temps around 65 degrees C running CPU stress software Prime95 just about 40mins.I should mention I have a decent case Corsair 500R which helps to cool the systemPerformance - no complains.Graphics card - Gigabyte GeForce GTX-580 3GBOverclocking CPU significantly  gives more FPS when gaming but not dramatically.The difference could feel playing Crysis 2 (updated with improved graphics)  at the maximum graphics settings Ultra High.Before overclocking CPU, Crysis 2 was hardly playable at Ultra High settings. Now is much better but still in some stages I get picture lags so set up graphics at Very High and now everything goes smooth.Anyway, graphics card does the hardest job if you play such heavy games and if you really want to get a performance you should invest in GPU as well.No matter how good 3770K is, but GPU must be even better otherwise you waste your money.Overall system runs really fast. SSD and decent RAM is a "must have" in such systems.If have funds for a good system, then go for it.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 22, 2013
Reviews: Bought this after deciding to build myself a new monster PC with as much top hardware as i could.Firstly, it comes in a nice little box with a stock cooler heatsint and fan and an instruction manual. Very simple. Come build day after dropping it in, I decided not to use the stock cooler because I'd heard these babies can run hot under load and that stock cooler doesn't look upto much, so I decided to buy a Corsair H60i water cooler to run the cooling side of things while I'm powergaming or whatever.Finally got to my new windows and the performance of this thing (at stock speeds even) is still staggering, I've been on the PC all night doing things and it hasen't broken a sweat once. Very impressed. Having the 'K' version is also an added bonus that if in the future it does start getting tierd for whatever reason (can't see it), then you can open the taps for more horses. Sweet.Temps: Right now it's chilling at 27C with the Corsir H60i...It's maximum I've seen so far was 38C although I haven't been really pushing it yet so can't give any top-end temps. But yeah it runs sweet.Very happy with the purchace.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 12, 2014
Reviews: Following an upgrade from an i5 2500k I can't say that any significant performance increase during normal daily tasks is discernible. However, that is to be expected as I don't perform too many tasks that really stretch the CPU's ability. Windows experience index increased from 7.5 to 7.7; according to performance charts based on calculation rates, this ostensibly minor difference actually translates into a speed increase of around 30%, so do take Microsoft's arbitrary grading system with a pinch of salt.Next day delivery was provided by Amazon despite having been purchased at around 6pm, so I cannot fault the service.4/5 due to value from Intel - could be better in my humble opinion. Also when I am spending over £200 on a processor, it might be nice to have packaging befitting the price as it is rather drab and the same as much cheaper models.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 21, 2012
Reviews: The Intel i7 3770K is a fantastic processor, I wanted to build a workstation PC for 3D graphics, but I couldn't afford a proper Intel Xeon CPU, so I opted for this instead. I was a little apprehensive about using an i7 instead of a Xeon for professional level work, but so far I have been pleasantly surprised. Admittedly it isn't as fast as a Xeon, it was never going to be, but its not as far off as I had first thought.I haven't tried overclocking this yet, but it idles at 1600mhz for most tasks, it only every changes when I start animating or modelling in 3D applications. The Intel Turbo Boost feature confuses me slightly, the CPU never seems to run at its described 3.5ghz, always shooting up to its 'Turbo Boost' levels of 3.9ghz, which I thought would have been reserved for only the most intense of operations.Ultimately, you can't go far wrong with this CPU, unless you work for Pixar and need the most powerful machine known to man, this will be more than good enough for anybody's needs, especially if you don't want to fork out for the i7 extreme or Xeon CPU's.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in France on December 18, 2013
Reviews: Super processeur qui vient en remplacement d'un Sandy Bridge i5 2500K (OC à 4.2 Ghz pour 1.21 de vcore) qui était tout simplement insuffisant pour Battlefield 4 (et dans une moindre proportion BF3) !Je passe donc d'un i5 2500K en permanence à 100% de charge sur BF4 (qui bridait ma gtx 780 classified) à celui-ci qui à fréquence "stock" c'est à dire d'origine ne dépasse pas 65% de charge sur le même jeu. Vraiment épatant.Si j'avais su j'aurais acheté à l'époque un i7 2600K ! Ne faites pas la même erreur !En conclusion un super processeur vraiment au top, et au passage ne croyez pas ceux qui vous disent qu'un i5 est suffisant pour le jeu, ça a longtemps été vrai mais ça ne l'est plus tant les nouveaux jeux sont à la fois gourmand en ressource CPU et dans le même temps optimisés pour 6 à 8 coeurs (du fait des architectures consoles). Dès lors un i7 s'impose pour profiter de l'hyper-threading.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 23, 2013
Reviews: Recently decided to build my first computer, and after of a couple of weeks or so of comparing parts I decided to splash out for the Core I7 3770K. after a month of using the CPU, I can safely say that I'm not disappointed, a vast step up from my previous computer core - core 2 duo at 2.4 GHz which was no sloth. You pay for a High end processor for that extra performance, and that's exactly what you get! It's able to perform most the tasks that I throw at it with ease. I mainly use my computer for Gaming, and to run the  next gen games. e.g Battlefield 4, Assassins creed: Black Flag and also games like Bioshock Infinite. Works like a charm. But it also handles everyday  tasks like Watching videos, Word processing, and just navigating through folders fluently. Great for General purpose. What more can I say, Just a great processor. Would definitely recommend.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 28, 2016
Reviews: This is now very outdated, which is to be expected of course with these kind of things.However, I am more than satisfied, this is part of a build I put together about in about 2012 with an ASUS sabertooth motherboard and 8gb ram and the whole system still runs like lightning, I don't see myself needing to upgrade any time in the near future either but I dont see games etc.. becoming much more hardware hungry. I play lots of MMORPG and other online multiplayer games and do some occasional basic video editing (Have asus nvidia gtx 670 GPU).Seriously though, combine this with the biggest ssd you can afford. I struggle for space on my 240gb ssd because once you go ssd hdd are just a pain in the butt slow.Cant complain about this product for my fairly general requirements.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in France on January 18, 2023
Reviews: alors rien à reprocher peut être un petite effort sur l'emballage mais le CPU fonctionner parfaitement aucune griffer aucun coup dessus nickel, merci au vendeur si je dois racheté un CPU je passerais par lui sans soucis !

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 19, 2012
Reviews: I paired this chip with an Asus P8Z68-V PRO/GEN3 motherboard which came out about £15 cheaper than an equivalent ASUS Z77 motherboard.  If you do this be warned you will most likely have to flash your mobo as the original BIOS did not support Ivybridge.So far I am happy, my cpu reports clock speeds of 3.6ghz and i haven't started overclocking yet.. I'm still going with the stock fan and will probably overclock minimally at first.I went with the Ivybridge for the gains I will get from Video processing.. I plan to see what performance I get out of this rig (with 8g crucial RAM) and then consider the options of:(1) GPU with CUDA(2) better cooling and overclocking(3) more ramOf course buying the 3770k means I get to overclock, which i wouldn't for the cheaper, locked, chip.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 28, 2014
Reviews: I probably don't need such a fast CPU but it's nice to know I can run, well - everything! And Windows never seems to bog down no matter what I'm doing or how many things I have open (although that of course is also due to having 8GB RAM)What was most surprising about this processor was the amazing temperatures. Even on the stock fan it was rarely getting very hot. With a Hyper 412S I can run it at low RPM even when overclocked (and fully stable) at 4.5ghz. to me that is incredible!Worth the money and with a CPU Passmark in excess of 10,000 it will be a few years till the budget chips can come anywhere close to this one - a worthwhile investment for the all-round power user.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on March 28, 2022
Reviews: Keine Mängel bis dahin entdeckt, ob der Prozessor lange hält ist frsgwürdig. Falls der versagt, wird es sich ebenfalls in der Rezension widerspiegeln. Mit nvidia gtx 1050ti packt viele top-Spiele mit stabilen 60 FPS, allerdings summt die Kühlung etwas lauter als erwartet, aber damit kann man noch auskommen.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in France on June 24, 2018
Reviews: Je pensais avoir fait un commentaire sur ce superbe processeur acheté il y a déjà 5 ans, mais non ! A tout ceux qui se poseraient la question est ce que ce processeur vaut le coup en occasion, je dit oui ! Pour ma part j'en ai changé car je fait beaucoup de travail sur vidéo et les cœurs supplémentaires aident vraiment. Mais dans la vie de tous les jours, pour le gaming, surfer sur internet et autre ce processeur reste vraiment une référence ! Bien sur il faut compter sur les nouveautés chez AMD et Intel, mais d'occasion entre 90 & 120€ je considère que ça reste un excellent processeur.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 7, 2012
Reviews: This is by far the best processor I've ever used.  I really can't complain about anything, currently have it at 4.6Ghz and turbo enabled.  The integrated HD4000 graphics are surprisingly good and with an XFX R7870BE the combination maxes out every game with good fps.  This is also great for 3D rendering and is super quick. The only down side I can think of is it scores 7.8 on Windows Experience Index, this doesn't mean anything apart from bragging rights.  All in all it's a fantastic processor.If you are only using it for gaming or are on a tight budget then I would suggest the 3570k, the gaming performance is similar between these two processors.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 28, 2013
Reviews: I have this CPU installed in an Asus Maximus V motherboard and the performance is outstanding. The CPU is very easy to overclock, but also performs extremely well out of the box using its turbo mode when the need arises.What I like most about this model is the low power consumption and low operating temperature compared to the processing speed. I couldn't find any other processor in the market within the same price bracket that gave me better value and performance.Intel have done an awesome job with this CPU and all of my games fly on it. I have added two Geforce 670 4GB GPUs in SLI and the whole system works like a dream!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 15, 2012
Reviews: There are many new features that this chip set brings, like PCI 3.0, HD 4000 graphics (Which can be utilized with LucidMVP)and correct me if I am wrong, but native USB 3.0 support. Its a five star processor, because its excellent, simple as that.One problem however, the temperatures. Intel, what were you thinking putting rubbish thermal paste on the CPU die itself? People have taken it into their own hands, pried off the CPU heat sink and replaced it themselves because the chip set runs so hot!Apart from that, the speed of it is astounding. However, I would go with a sandy bridge if you are wishing to overclock.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in France on October 16, 2021
Reviews: J'avais un i 3 3èmes génération je ne pouvais pas jouer à bf 5 avec une carte graphique amd radeon 1 giga après avoir changé mon processeur je peut i jouer je suis ravis, je changerait ma carte graphique un peut plus tard vue les prix qui sont exorbitant en ce moment

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 2, 2012
Reviews: if you do a little research you will know that this is the newer generation to sandy bridge...and that chip was no slouch!! very fast chip stays cool under normal load...i use my PC for music production and i have this coupled with 16gb ram and ssd and my PC handles it with ease..my cousin has the chip down from this one and he has it overclocked to 4.3ghz running corsair vengeance 8gb and gtx 570 gpu all overclocked on air! and hes running about 38-50 degrees..remember these chips are DESIGNED to be overclocked. good strong chip will be overclocking soon running battlefield 3, cysis 2 withcher 2 and gta4...should be good! 5/5

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 11, 2012
Reviews: I got this chip along with a wartercooling system and an ASUS sabertooth z77 for my new computer,was very easy to install, no problems found yet, over clocked to 4.5GHz and still running stably at low tempsmight see if I can make it go higher in the future, but for the moment works well for everything I use my pc for... games.. work.. programming etc.Great buyonly complaint I can find is that the packaging was slightly damaged in transport, but that's not really an issue as the product was perfectly fine and I didn't really expect to get perfect packaging with the super saver

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on February 10, 2014
Reviews: Ein richtig guter Prozessor. Durch die k Version ist er sehr leicht übertaktbar.Anwendungen wie Battlefield 3 schafft er mit ca. 30-50% Auslastung (alles auf Ultra).Falls jemand Videos bearbeiten möchte: Drei Videos gleichzeitig bearbeiten (auf Iphone 4 Auflösung) bringt ihnauf ca. 80%.Der beigelegte Intel Kühler ist leise und kühlt relativ gut (ohne OC).Ich hab die CPU nun seit mehreren Monaten und mir ist nur ein negativer Aspekt aufgefallen: Die Temperatur.Bei intensiven Spielen wird er bis zu 65-70°C warm!Das ist zwar nicht die Welt, aber das einzig Negative das ich finden konnte :).Insgesamt kann sagen, es ist ein wirklich guter Prozessor, der aber auch seinen Preis hat!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on October 6, 2014
Reviews: Ich habe den Prozessor jetzt gute 10 Monate und bin hell auf begeistert!!Ich betreibe ihn auf einem ASrock fatal1ty Performance zusammen mit 8GB Corsair Dominator Platinum RAM und einer kräftigen Geforce GTX 770 Phantom. Als CPU kühlung verwende ich eine Enermax Liquid Kühlung mit 120mm Radioator.Die maximale Temperatur im Idle beträgt 21°c. Unter vollast mit dem Prime-Tool kommt er auf Maximal 48°c.Wer gerne taktet sollte auf jedenfall zum 3770K greifen denn dank offenen Multiplikator steht dem OC Fanatiker nichts im Wege.Anspruchsvolle Anwendungen meistert er locker ohne voll ausgelastet zu sein und das wird noch einige zeit so bleiben!Klare Kaufempfehlung eines Anspruchsvollen Gamers!!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in France on September 24, 2013
Reviews: J'ai changé mon i7-920 pour ce processeur, étant plus que ravi de mon précedent achat qui m'a tenu 4 ans quand même, ce qui est plus qu'honnorable pour un PC de gamer (avec une GTX460 et 6Go de ram 12600).Intel toujours au top depuis les core 2 duo.J'espère juste ne pas avoir à changer ma config avant 4 ans encore !Le seul petit reproche à la limite, c'est le bruit du ventillo fourni dans la boite, c'est lui qu'on entend le plus dans ma tour.Mais bon, personnellement ça ne me gène pas du tout donc 5/5.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 12, 2013
Reviews: I’ve chosen 3770K over Intel’s 4th generation processor (Core i7 4770K) as I was concerned with the latter’s oveclocking abilities. 4770K runs much hotter and there is also a big chance it will not go over 4.2GHz. It is also marginally faster at the same clock speed.The other reason to chose 3770K over the newer one was the slightly lower price for the motherboard and the CPU itself.I was not disappointed and the processor passed an 8 hour Prime95 stability test at 4.5 GHz and 1,176V. The temperatures were in the upper 60’s C with my SilverArrow cooler which is perfectly acceptable.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on November 24, 2022
Reviews: Ich habe es zum nachrüsten genommen. Alles so wie es sein sollte.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 22, 2013
Reviews: This CPu has been fantastic from the day I installed it. Runs on an asus mobo with 16gb ram and an ssd. Installed Windows 7 in under 15 minutes. This combination allows me to run the cpu with just the power that I need. Runs at 1.6 ghz when low power is req'd and will boost up to 4.7 ghz when necessary. Graphics are great for movie watching and light gaming but will need to be upgraded if you are a serious gamer (6.7 wei score for graphics) 350mhz at idle but will run at 1450 when needed

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on October 15, 2012
Reviews: Ein richtig guter Prozessor. Durch die k Version ist er sehr leicht übertaktbar.Anwendungen wie Battlefield 3 schafft er mit ca. 30-50% Auslastung (alles auf Ultra).Falls jemand Videos bearbeiten möchte: Drei Videos gleichzeitig bearbeiten (auf Iphone 4 Auflösung) bringt ihnauf ca. 80%.Der beigelegte Intel Kühler ist leise und kühlt relativ gut (ohne OC).Ich hab die CPU nun seit mehreren Monaten und mir ist nur ein negativer Aspekt aufgefallen: Die Temperatur.Bei intensiven Spielen wird er bis zu 65-70°C warm!Das ist zwar nicht die Welt, aber das einzig Negative das ich finden konnte :).Insgesamt kann sagen, es ist ein wirklich guter Prozessor, der aber auch seinen Preis hat!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 11, 2014
Reviews: I bought this to replace an i5 chip in my computer. Took old one out, put new one in, all recognised by my motherboard without issue. All the speed test programs I downloaded tell me my machine is faster. This is only really noticeable on more intense work, games and video rendering, as I expected. I am very satisfied.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on August 8, 2013
Reviews: Über die Qualität des Prozessors lässt sich nicht viel sagen. Sie ist einfach top! Aber:Die bereits aufgetragene Wärmeleitpaste auf den Kühler kann man vergessen. Der Prozessor hat bei mir, ohne dass irgendwelche Spiele oder größere Programme laufen, eine Temperatur von ca. 45°C - 50°C, was bei der Durchschnittstemperatur der übrigen Komponenten von ca. 35°C einfach zu viel ist.Bei Spielen ging er dann sogar auf 90° bzw. einmal auch auf fast 100°C rauf. Der Kühler selber sitzt fest und funktioniert einwandfrei. Daran kann also der Fehler nicht liegen.Meine Empfehlung: Wärmeleitpaste entfernen und eine flüssige extra kaufen.Deshalb leider nur 4 Sterne

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 31, 2013
Reviews: One off the best processors on the market it beats any AMD of its type and for the price its just amazing. Ive had this for 6 months now and had no problems with it. The ability to overclock so highs great even though it doesnt need it! This is far greater then the AMD FX-8350 but if you want a buget processor the AMD is a good option but for the best performance the I7 is the one for you. Intels has done it again!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Spain on September 12, 2013
Reviews: Este procesador es un auténtico avión, es el más apropiado para próximas tecnologías, me decidí por él, ya que cuenta con tecnología hyperthreading, es decir, 4 núcleos físicos más otros 4 virtuales, consiguiendo ahorro energético respecto a los FX de Athlon y preparado para los juegos de la nueva generación de consolas (ps4 y xboxone), las cuales disponen de 8 núcleos.Realmente muy contento y satisfecho con la compra, al igual muy satisfecho con el servicio proporcionado por Amazon. Envío en un día y empaquetado perfectamente.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 4, 2013
Reviews: Very powerful.I bought this to "future proof my new gaming rig". I dont intend to overclock yet, but will kn a years time. If you dont intend to overclock, go for i7 23770 as its locked, and youll save around £20-30. However this is very powerful and the stock cooler will be adequate for the stock speed, 3.5ghz in this case, 0.1 ghz higher than standard 3770.Do some research, I reccomend new egg on youtube, as I learnt a lot!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on February 9, 2013
Reviews: habe mir diesen prozessor gekauft als ich meinen pc stark aufrüsten wollte (vom alten blieb nur noch das gehäuse :D )hatte davor nur einen i3 aber der i7 3770k zeigt natürlich sofort seine leistung, auch im thema temperatur. wurde in meinem gehäuse sehr heiss, was dazu führte das ich beim starten eines spiels einen automatischen pc restart bekam. durch anschaffen zusätzlicher lüfter und einen NOCTUA CPU-Kuehler NH-C14 Heatpipes 140mm Luefter wurde das problem gelöst. Jetzt geht der pc ab mit ner ASUS Radeon HD 7970 und Samsung 840 Series Basic interne SSD-Festplatte 500GB

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on November 23, 2012
Reviews: Very expensive, but you get what you pay for - the performance is exceptional.One criticism of Amazon : I ordered this & it wasn't sent with the rest of the PC components.  This was however rectified within 24 hours.Take care if you're using the supplied cooler : spread the cooler paste evenly across the contact surface - don't just take it out of the box & slap it on top of the CPU and hope for the best.However, in most circumstances, you'll be needing a high-performance cooler - definitely recommended.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 10, 2013
Reviews: I bought this for my first PC build and I've little to compare it with because I'm more used to Mac. It was easy to install, and everything is running fine and very fast. I got a water-cooling system so the fan that comes with the CPU is not required. Seems a big waste. It's a pity that I couldn't have ordered just the CPU without the fan, but I don't think that warrants losing a star.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 14, 2015
Reviews: Bought this Intel i7 processor a few years ago for my then newly built PC. I am very pleased with this purchase as it is still performing well and I haven't had any problems with it so far.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 16, 2012
