Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars... add to what already has been written about this wonderful CPU, but I can only echo the comments ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2015
Reviews: Not much here to be able to add to what already has been written about this wonderful CPU, but I can only echo the comments of others. This CPU is a real powerhouse both in speed and in processing capability. As this CPU runs pretty hot when fully loaded, anyone who uses this CPU to it's full capability will simply need to get another cooling solution beyond what is supplied in the Intel box, or you will experience thermal throttling due to the high temperatures generated. While this CPU can be easily overclocked by a Z97 Motherboard, it really does not have a lot of headroom for extreme overclocking. The current speed of 4.0 to 4.4 GHz is very fast as is. A really significant overclock to 4.8 GHz or better will require a serious investment in custom water cooling, or you have a very rare CPU. As for me, the CPU is fantastic at 4.4 GHz, and not sure I have a need to get any more speed out of it. I am using an old Enzotech Extreme CPU air cooler, testing with AIDA 64 Extreme to stress the CPU, and I am getting about 68" C average temperature out of the CPU at full load, at 1.18 Volts Core. Ummmm.....maybe I will tweak it up a bit. Happy Computing...!!!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2014
Reviews: Pros: Super fast in both multi-threaded and single-threaded tasks. Idles extremely cool. Strangely cool in fact, but in a good way.Cons: Not quite the OC'er Intel wanted us to think it was. But has 4.0 stock & 4.4GHz boost, so that's ok. Runs warm when OC'ed.I have to say that overall I am extremely pleased with my i7 4790k purchase and it's performance. It is so incredibly fast, and is actually just a hair shy of a $500 i7 3930k in most tasks which says a lot. That really is a big deal for a $300 proc.The 4790k idles strangely cool, in the low 20's (C) with my Corsair H80i, and is about 8-10C cooler than an i7 4770k at idle all things being equal. And it stays around 45-48C under work load such as gaming, etc. It is a real beast of a processor.However, overclocking is not as great as we thought it would be. I think Intel's early claims of a new improved TIM and voltage regulation was an exaggeration, and it still doesn't come close to Sandy Bridge's fluxless solder IHS. It may be better than the Haswell version 1.0, I'll give you that - but it's still not "that great." I forsee some serious delidding going on over the next few months on DC and much-much testing.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThe best value you could possibly hope for
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2016
Reviews: I love this thing. I upgraded from an AMD FX-8350 in the summer of 2015. The frame jump was so high that I didn't even realize that I hadn't enable the SLI for the second GTX 970 that I bought along with it. When it sits almost idle, doing small things, it floats around 4.0-4.1GHz. BUT, when you put it under stress(like playing any game or benchmarking it), it jumps up to a stable 4.3GHz. I even saw it sit at 4.4GHz on one benchmark. And the included cooler did a good job of keeping the temp stable when I ran three benchmarks in a row on the 3DMark software too. The stock cooler is actually extremely quiet, also. I love this processor and recommend that you just eat the upfront cost. For the performance it gives, it's entirely worth the money. Combine this with a GTX 970 and you can just about max out Crysis 3 and Fallout 4 at 1080p. Just about. I am very satisfied with my purchase and I don't even plan on upgrading to the 6th gen 6700K whatsoever. I'll just put in another GPU. The performance difference is extremely minimal, and with the cost of the LGA1151 and DDR4 stuff, this is the better value.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsNumber crunching at 100% Turbo boost load
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2015
Reviews: I am successfully running the i7-4790K 24/7 at 100% load on all 4 cores in Turbo Boost (4.4 GHz) while number crunching for the World Community Grid (WCG).  The Intel heat sink and fan are inadequate with core temperatures hitting 100 deg C immediately under full load.  Wattage was successfully reduced by lowering CPU Vcore to 1.150 Volts and  VRIN to 1.710 Volts.  The BIOS of my Gigabyte Z97X-UD3H-BK motherboard allowed setting these voltages lower which was the first step taken to reduce CPU Core temperatures.Chosen to replace the i7-4790K stock heat sink is a Cooler Master Geminll S524 Version 2 CPU Air Cooler with 120 mm Silencio FP fan (RR-G5V2-20PK-R1).  With it, typical core temperatures dropped to 70 – 72 degrees centigrade with maximum variation 67 – 74 deg C under continuous full Turbo Boost load.The software application generating the load is the BOINC client running on Ubuntu Linux 14.04 LS.  Ubuntu installed from CD as easily in my rig as MS Windows  The BOINC client and BOINC manager are best installed using the Linux Synaptic tool.  WCG BOINC preferences allow up to 100% of CPU capacity to be used by the Grid project(s).  Performance measurement and temperature use the i7z tool.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSo fast! Oh so very fast!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2015
Reviews: Oh my god, so fastOverclocked it up to a super stable 4.9GHz, and it just cruises through everything. Combined with a fast SSD and enough RAM, this CPU just cuts through tasks like they are half as intense as they really are. The part about a fast ssd and enough ram is important though, because this CPU likely is never the limiting factor in any process or game, it destroys its part of most tasks. Paired with a 970 it crushes every game I play at 1080p, probably would go for a 980 or 980ti to maintain 60+ framerates at 1440p or above.This is pretty much the pinnacle of performance as far as 4 core processors go, for now, doesn't seem like Skylake 6000 series processors are too much faster.I could have easily gone for an i5-4690K instead, but my laptop had an i7 and gosh darn it, my badass PC would have hyperthreading as well. Besides, as time goes on, more and more applications will take advantage of the performance boost that hyperthreading offers, and since I intend to use this CPU for probably at the very least 3 years (5 more likely), having that extra capability is worth it to me.So fast! O.O

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGood but Not Great
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2014
Reviews: I was surprised that it had a small fan for a core i7 processor but i've been using it for some weeks now and it looks like everything's  working ok, also it came with thermal paste on the cpu which is a plus. I currently run Need For Speed Hot Pursuit on it with all settings high and I'm using only my on board graphics card and it plays beautifully no lag no stuttering with game play whatsoever,... It doesn't feel like it's living up to it's name though when i run Flight Simulator X, (if you don't now about Flight Simulator X it's a flight simulator, but it's a really good game that can test your pc limits),... Some areas of the world with a lot of scenery still has low fps but keep in mind i still don't have a graphics card besides the on board one, so maybe that's why! I'm not very technical about computers but in a nutshell I believe it deserves 4 stars because it is far better than anything i've ever had but not as good as i thought it would be! For $300 USD

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
Reviews: Was not in an Intel box, fan was new and chip works fine, but had residual thermal paste on chip.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThe stock fan cools fine, even when playing high-end games like Far Cry4 ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2015
Reviews: I don't OC, but this processor can be overclocked reliably to at least 4.4GHz and above.  The stock fan cools fine, even when playing high-end games like Far Cry4 and CoD Ghosts; Advanced Warfare, etc.  It does not go above about 60C, and cools rapidly to about 28-35C @idle.  I bought this i7 because of it's stock speed, and because I won't OC it, and want fast stock equipment that is reliable. Also, it is one of the reasons my Windows Experience Index has climbed to 7.8--even though the processor is the lowest score I have. I am running a 2666MHz FSB and RAM on a Z97 platform with a SSD and a GTX970, and expect it to be very front-running for years to come. I looked long and hard for the right processor, and believe I have found it!  Though it is "only" a quad-core, it doesn't lack any performance I can see in a usage environment.  There will always be higher performance numbers--but This proc. didn't cost a grand either.  Some say it gets hot; not so with stock settings.  Gotta get water cooling or a larger heatsink/fan if you want to play numbers, instead of enjoying it's stock big-block power for gaming and other applications.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent CPU even in 2017
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2017
Reviews: Even in early 2017 I was still happy with my purchase of a new Haswell generation i7-4790K. In most metrics it is equal to or outperforms its successor the i7-6700K. The 7700K may now have the edge but like the 6700K is lga1151 and would require updating my current motherboard and ram which is much more expense for little perceived benefit. I decided to purchase this new directly from Amazon because many, used on ebay, regularly go for $250+. Without knowing what the previous owner did to the cpu I'd rather pay $50 more for the assurance that I have a new product with Amazon's excellent customer service behind it. I overclocked only a little but have more satisfactory temperatures at stock configuration of 4ghz base, 4.4ghz turbo which is plenty of power. If you are building an all new system go for the i7-7700k as it will be supported on newer motherboards with newer options like USB-C etc. If you already have a lga1150 motherboard and want to move up from an i3 or I5 this will be cheaper than adopting a whole new motherboard platform and you won't be disappointed.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsYou get what you pay for
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2015
Reviews: Intel i7-4790K will always be good from now and for the next three years or more. Is it worth 300 USD? Let me say that price is relevant to cost of aggravations. Suffice it for me to say that no aggravation and long term satisfaction is worth something, so yes, in my opinion the i7-4790K processor is worth the cost, even if you do not plan to overclock it. Why would you buy this over the lesser yet nearly equivalent i5-4690K? If you have the need for multithreaded simultaneous operations, this processor is hands down light years faster than an i5-4690K. If you are surfing the web or playing games with your system then you probably do not need this processor and the i5-4690K is a much better economical option.Why would I buy a K rated processor over a standard version if I do not plan to overclock it? Simply because they are better processors. When processors are tested, they must pass a myriad of tests before they are marked and shipped. Every processor is guaranteed to operate within the window of specifications, so when you buy one that will outperform the window of specifications, it simply tested better overall.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIf you can afford it, its worth getting over the i5 hands down.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2015
Reviews: HO-LY S***! This thing is fast.I used this cpu for my elite gaming computer build. On paper this thing is supposed to give "up to" 4.1GHz out of the box, mine gave me exactly 4.0GHz. I'm not complaining, but lets be real, if 80-90% of your customers get 4.0GHz or less out of the box, just say that instead of giving me unrealistic expectations.I bought a nice cpu cooler(evo 212) and overclocked this bitch to 4.4GHz. It took me about 5 minutes and it was surprisingly easy to do. The temps are easily managed(28c idle maybe upper 30's when in "full boom") and gaming is a breeze. I can game hard for hours and watch HD vids at the same time and my cpu won't go past 30% capacity. This is easily the best processor I have ever owned.I would suggest one thing to people who are going to buy this. The stock cooler is a cheap piece of s***. If you are willing to spend ~$340 for this thing, its worth investing in a nice cooler. They aren't expensive and they quite noticeably improve performance and temps.I just became an Intel-processor customer for life.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIntel Core i7-4790K Haswell Quad-Core 4.0GHz
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2014
Reviews: I purchased this as part of a new desktop build using a Z97 chipset AsRock Extreme6 motherboard in a Corsair case. I picked this particular CPU for its combination of features (performance, power efficient, VT-x) over the AMD FX line (comparable features but not nearly as power efficient), Intel i7-5820K (more cores but lower performance per core), and a few other options. I probably would have been alright saving a few dollars and gone for the standard i7-4790 since I haven't really experimented with overclocking the CPU, but I have that option later if I have the time or inclination later. Paired with a Samsung SSD and 32 gbs of Crucial RAM, it tends to fly on most tasks.One note of warning: I started off using the stock Intel CPU cooler that it came with. I did some 1080p media transcoding using Handbrake and it pushed the CPU temperature up to a very scary 90 degrees Celsius. I stopped the job as soon as I saw it, and ordered a (series) of water coolers. With the Corsair H60 idle temperature is now under 25 degrees and maxes out at 56 degrees with a series of video encodes. I would definitely recommend getting a different CPU cooler.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2014
Reviews: This is first i7 I have ever owned. And man its faster than anything I have ever owned. I was choosing between the i5 4690k or this i7 4790k and my uses were for Gaming and Video/Music editing and to be honest I think I would of been disappointed with the i5 cause this i7 can handle so many programs at once its ridiculous at most I run 8 major programs and it does not stutter or slowdown. Also I do wish I got more memory for it cause I only got 2 8gb and I do fill all 8gb with those programs so that's the only thing holding mine back. Also temps for me are pretty dang low I have a h105 water cooler and the temps stay at 27c to 29c at idel and max load 66 to 68c and that's when my room is cold in the morning. When I have my room at 88f it idels at 33c and max load stays the same so I think its really good especially in my situation that I don't have central ac or any form of ac for that matter. Any ways If you choose this CPU you wont regret it and it will last a very long time.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazing performance, worth every penny!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2016
Reviews: It had been quite a while since I built a new desktop rig, and all I can say is.. holy crap, this thing is amazing. I have been an AMD guy all my life, but I loved the performance of my 3rd gen i7 laptop so much, I decided to move to intel for my desktop. This thing clocked in at just over 12,000 on the benchmark after I built it! It runs unbelievably fast and surprisingly cool using the stock air cooler. While writing this review, the temp is sitting at 38C... in other words, under a light load, it runs basically the same temperature as my body! Now, it does quickly get hot under avery heavy  load (80-100 while using Handbrake for x.264 encoding), but all in all, not bad. I will likely get an aftermarket cooler in the future, but I found that if I limit CPU speed in windows to 95%, it seems to do a great job of keeping the temp <85 and doesn't affect the performance much at all. I only do this because >85 really makes me nervous. All in all, I love it!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
Reviews: Amazing

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2020
Reviews: What overheating issue...... I've read a lot of reviews about overheating issues with this chip, I've experienced none of them. Now, I would NOT recommend using the heat sink that is supplied with the cpu. Maybe that's the issue many people were having.I have a pretty basic setup that I use for work and education. I'm have an IN-WIN slim formfactor m-ATX chassis, Asus mobo, and a Samsung SSD. I replaced the exhaust fan that came with the chassis for an 80mm Noctua and I'm using the Noctua NH-L9x65, 65mm Premium Low-Profile CPU Cooler. CPU hasn't gone above 89 degrees.I have two of these boxes, one for my VMware lab and the other for my Cisco network lab. Not one issue. I would suggest to those people having heat issues to look for better cooling/chassis options.Asus mobo B85M-G32GB RAMSamsung pro 512GB SSD

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis processor could be the best upgrade hardware value you can obtain right now!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2015
Reviews: This is supposed to be about as fast as you can get with the current generation of processors. With the low price that Amazon Prim was offering, I had no excuse not to get the best. I picked it up with a medium grade Gigabyte MB and WOW.  I had pulled my aging first generation i5-760 along with it's gigabyte MB and honestly expected quite a boost in every category between the two. What I didn't expect was just how large a difference it was in real world application.Every aspect of day to day computing was multitudes faster than it had been. Everything  from booting, opening applications, heavy multi-tasking, etc. was so much faster that I often found myself trying to find things to accomplish to fill in down time ... something I can't remember ever having with my old system.It has greatly increased my ability to substantially increase  my intelligence with the added Youtube and Chive time I know have.The one lesson I truly learned with this exerciser was that obtaining the best is not always the most expensive route to take.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020
Reviews: I started with an i5 cpu 4 core, and this is a visible and noticeable upgrade from that! I can now run nearly all my games at far better qualities than just minimums since upgrading to this and have far better framerates overall. You'll still need to upgrade any Graphics cards if yours is out of date, but for gaming, home, and streaming uses (like netflix or YouTube or even VR), this card works great!Pricey, for sure. And definitely not something for budget setups. But it definitely helps and has a visible difference. Personally, I'd say it's a good deal if it goes under $260, and to not pay anything over $360, but otherwise, it's a great CPU that's a definitive upgrade for any system!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSo much power, OC isn't even necessary!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2015
Reviews: Sooo good.. I couldn't wait to get this CPU in my new rig. Installation on an ASUS Maximus VII Hero couldn't have been easier. I had no issues at all with installation and it's thoroughly enjoying the exceptional cooling it's receiving from it's Corsair Hydro H100i extreme. I haven't been able to get this little guy to pass 40 degrees, even while gaming. I picked this up for my new rig in order to "future proof" the system. I did this with my last rig and it lasted me 8 years, still running games from the last 2 years on max settings. I'm so glad I went with this CPU as it's fulfilling all my needs without even approaching OC. Someday I'm sure some games with be released that will push it to the limit, but for now I can sit back and enjoy the delicious power without having to bat an eyelash at the CPU temps. Will definitely be picking up another one of these when I build my husband's rig next month!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest chip for LGA1150 socket
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2018
Reviews: I got this to upgrade from my i5 4690.  I did not want to spend the money to upgrade my motherboard (and then RAM), and this is the highest tier CPU for the LGA 1150 chipset.  The product arrived factory sealed.  It's as easy to install as any Intel CPU.  Even though it is marketed as running at 4.0, it defaults to 4.2 without manual overclocking.  Whether or not that was a default choice by my motherboard to kick it up or not, I can't say.I'm still running the Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO (air cooling), and the chip hasn't gone over 60 during any of my normal use - gaming and VR.  It touches 62-64 at times during stress testing, which is still well below anything that would be worrisome.  So you can get some mild overclocking on the chip without converting to liquid cooling.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsReally gets the job done
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2016
Reviews: Really gets the job done. I'm a power user, with, typically, Outlook, Word, Excel, several browser windows, plus some serious database applications of my own, all running at the same time, and my old laptop REALLY bogged down. This processor, combined with an SSD boot drive, makes life SO much more pleasant. I've checked the Windows resource meter and I'm not even beginning to bog it down.Because I wasn't sure whether I needed it or not, I went with most internet recommendations and bought an aftermarket fan/heat sink that is much better than what comes with the processor. I don't overclock and I am now very confident that I did not in fact need that extra cooling. I think what came with the processor would have been fine and unless you are overclocking and really stressing the CPU I doubt you will either. If you do it's very easy to add one when needed.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsJoin the PC Master Race, we have cookies.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2015
Reviews: This CPU is insane. The 8 threads definitely makes a difference in multitasking, (There's plenty of YouTube videos on that). I put this in my gaming rig and it runs games even GTA V on very high settings with my GTX 760. I am NOT an Intel fanboy, my previous CPU to this was an AMD but I gotta say Intel took the cake in this build. But I will say, you don't need this for gaming, the Intel Pentium anniversary edition (a dual core non hyper threaded chip) runs games very similar to this CPU. Games usually don't utilize 4 core and certainly not 8 threads. If you want a CPU that's quad core and this is out of your budget check out the i5 4690k it runs games and the EXACT fps as this one (again YouTube videos on that as well)To summarize this is a very strong very fast chip. Great for gaming and multitasking. Pretty decent on video editing because of the hyperthreading.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis is the face of power!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2016
Reviews: Oh my, what happened to your face???  This is the face of POWAH!Blazing fast speeds for an awesome price.  It's not very often you get this much bang for your buck.  I put this in my new PC build and it's awesome.  My motherboard uses OC genie and it overclocks this processor at 4.4GHz, and with the Zalman heat sink this rarely goes over 40C for all 4 processors.  Both I would recommend highly if your system can support it.  The only cons I can think of is that it uses a lot of power to run, and that the stock heat sink that comes with it does not look like it could support an overclocked processor.  All in all, if you are looking for a CPU upgrade and this bad boy will fit your motherboard, and the Zalman CPU Cooler CNPS9500AT fits in your case, it's worth the upgrade.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K

I really havn't even been close to using its potential yet.  Have not over clocked it yet.  Temps are around 41C idle in my Raven RVZ01 with a Noctua L9i cooler on top of it. Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood for overclocked gaming and/or 3D workstations
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2014
Reviews: Most current chip for 1150 socket is great. Also called Devil's Canyon, the chip is easy to overclock with Asus' Duel Intelligent software -- it's best to overclock with this software, rather than from within the bios-- that comes with the 97-a board (you don't need to use this board, but it is cheap and easy to overclock). Cost effective for the amount of processing you get, especially if you are working with 3D modeling programs that utilize the CPU more that the GPU such as Revit. You can get away with not having a discrete GPU since this chip has graphic capability built in, but I am assuming that most people would be getting this chip for gaming or working in 3D design/rendering, so discrete GPU would be a must.Runs well, no major issues, fast, easy to install, pretty straight forward. Additionally, if you want to overclock, go with something Corsair H100i instead of the in box heat sink unit.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars"Up to 4.40 GHz", but actually runs stock at 4.00 GHz. Still works great though! Very fast processing
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2015
Reviews: I would have given this product 5 stars, but I am disappointed with the way that it's advertised. The headline says "up  to 4.40 GHz", but what does that really mean? I have to assume that means you can overclock it to 4.40 GHz safely, but running stock in my PC, it runs at only 4.00 GHz. It should have read more like "4.00 GHz, OC to 4.40 GHz". I learned my lesson this time, fool me once, shame on you. I would ask that the product be more accurately portrayed, but otherwise, the product works amazingly well. I upgraded from a 3.2 GHz Quad Core Intel Chip, and the performance increase is very noticeable. Everything on my PC now happens when I click without a big lag time like before.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsA brief review and benchmark
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2016
Reviews: (The CPU has been in use for nearly half of a year as of this review)I purchased the 4790K for a PC build I was doing for myself. I have build several "gaming" computers at this point so I have a bit of experience. The product arrived fully functional and was installed into an MSI Z97 SLI Krait Edition motherboard.This processor never misses a beat. I use the computer for primarily gaming but also for CAD and related engineering uses. For these purposes the CPU stays cool and under-utilized on the stock CPU cooler. I have some benchmarks bellow.Cinebench R15852 Multi-Core173 Single-CoreOverall, I am very happy with this CPU and will be soon overclocking it. If you are just gaming or enthusiast video editing or something along those lines, this CPU is more than enough.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSo i feel perfectly fine pusing it to the limit
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2014
Reviews: OC mine to 4.7 ghzsuperfast processingI need 1.36 volts to get 47x multiplier and 100 bclk but if I downclock it  to 4.65 ghz (46x multiplier and 101 bclk I can keep voltage around 1.31 --The thing is, I paid intel $25 extra for overclocking insurance so if I burn out my CPU by applying too much voltage OCing I am covered under warranty. So i feel perfectly fine pusing it to the limit. I am stable on prime 95 (dont use 28, use prime ver 26.? because it works better with Haswell--the newest prime is bad for haswell, causing temps to rise too much with even minor OC). Google which version is the exact one to use, it slips my mind at this moment.Of course, throw out the stock heat sink when it arrives. I am using a corsair h100i and it works magic. If your case cant handle it then use the h80i.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWorked great easy installation and everything worked flawlessly plug and play ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2016
Reviews: Product Itself: Worked great easy installation and everything worked flawlessly plug and play have purchased this over a year ago.Opinion:A regular 4790K will cost you roughly 320 EUR, say 339 USD. A binned 4.8 MHz model is in the 375 USD range and the 5 GHz models will pass 400 USD. As such a binned processor is more expensive, but does come with that very nice guaranteed clock frequency. Perhaps if you are in the market for a new system and would like to rule out that your processor is capable of a certain frequency, well that’s where these guys can come in very handy. Currently they are selling 4690K / 4790K and even 5960X processors that have been preselected and tested for you. Go check them out, our experiences with them has been nothing other than pleasant and the product does exactly as advertised.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars4.4Ghz on all cores MSI enhanced turbo, 25-30C idle temps, 8 thread monster!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2015
Reviews: This is a fantastic CPU! I wanted to build an ITX gaming rig and this processor should keep my system up to spec for many years into the future, especially with DirectX12 helping CPUs be more useful in games. I'm using an MSI Z97I AC motherboard with this chip. The MSI board lets me use an 'enhanced turbo' feature that makes the Intel Turbo Boost work on all the cores (up to 4.4Ghz). With a Noctua NH-D9L cooler I'm getting idle temps at 25-30C with the fan @ 1000rpm (very quiet) running the 4.4Ghz on all cores. I could overclock to get closer to 5.0Ghz but it is probably not worth it as this chip is already overkill for most apps and games. I'll be looking forward to what AMD is going to do with Zen, but for now this 4790K is the chip to have!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPretty Fast for a LGA 1150 socket Processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2015
Reviews: It's not an extreme series, but it ranks right up there for a LGA1150 socket.  I have another gaming computer running an i7-6 core extreme LGA2011 system and it is freak'in fast.  And side by side (with overclocking on the 4790k), I'm very impressed with the speed (OK, so its a few milliseconds slower - I blinked!).  Only through performance testing or multiple programs opened, can you really see the difference.  If your planning on gaming and can't afford the extreme series and want to save some money, this is the best bang for the buck.  Don't disappoint yourself and get a lower mHz processor.  I know you don't want to hear it, but I told you so (Should-A, Could-A, Would-have)!.Comes with a standard fan for normal clocking and installation, or you can add an h100i to overclock it!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIt is an I7 - You get what you pay for!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2015
Reviews: Skylake might be new but does not mean it is worth upgrading. It is ok if you need a brand new computer but not for an upgrade.  Buying new ram, mobo and cpu is not worth that much money for the small increase in performance.The 4790k will be a hard cpu to beat for gaming. It already has the same thermal design as Skylake and can overclock to make up a loss in its age.My old I7 870 still works like a champ and has outlasted everything else in my old computer. The I7 is great cpu for someone that does not want to upgrade every time a new one comes out because of it's top tier features.Read reviews from actual testings websites and you will see why 4790k is one of the best LGA1150 cpu's for gaming.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsKing of the CPU - Hey Meltdown!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2014
Reviews: The 4790k fixes everything wrong with 4770k for the same price as it's predecessor. You will experience no slowdowns and your computer will fly through literally anything you throw at it. while overclocked, this CPU can beat out intel's lower-end 6 core, socket 2011, Enthusiast CPU's at stock. This processor is also just fun to play with, being a great overclocker due to it's redesigned power management and redisigned TIM. If you have a 4770k, it might not be enough to jump the gun, but if you're looking for an upgrade, this is the one.Edit: Due to the Meltdown fix, CPU speed and I/O speeds have been reduced, (the latter far more than the former). Still, this is not acceptable, and as such I have knocked a star of the review.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsCombined with an SSD and a good graphics card and there is virtually no way to ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2015
Reviews: My goodness this thing is fast. For the last 3 years I've used a laptop with an i7-2760QM. It's a laptop processor, but it's still an i7 so I was getting decent performance. I recently built my own desktop as a development station, and chose this processor as my CPU.The delivery was very quick, it comes with its own cooling fan but you'll definitely want to go ahead and pick up an aftermarket cooler. I bought an H100i to go with it and my temps have been well below 40C even while stress testing.This thing is blazing fast. I tested all of my programs that I originally wrote and tested on my laptop and this thing increases their run-time by anywhere from %40-150. Combined with an SSD and a good graphics card and there is virtually no way to be dissapointed.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsToo hot to handle!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2015
Reviews: You're so fast, i love you too, i7-4790k :D But oh how you burn me up when you run so hot! I was getting 95*c temps under load with this processor until i turned the voltage down to 1.20. Then it was around 80 to 85*c. That's still a little too high for my liking.I'd recommend you pair this with an aftermarket cooler, specifically the Corsair Hydro Series H55. I found it to be a very good cooler that dropped my load temps to 45*c, peaking at around 60*c tops!Just don't make the mistake i made and buy this processor, test it, find that it runs hot, go out and get the cooler, and then have to remove the old stock fan. What a pain in the butt. One stop shopping. Get the hyrdo cooler when you get the processor. Good luck!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsThis processor is overrated.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2015
Reviews: I've seen better from intel. Having a i5 2550k which was fast when it was still up to date  along with and amd fx 8350, which was so so. I had to go into the bios to optimize it otherwise it would be slow.i have ssd 256 GB , 32 GB ram, motherboard is ASUS Z97-A . Why would i have to overclock to be able to do web browsing and word processing for research papers? Not only is it not exactly bargain price but this machine is not used for current high resource demand gaming.That said, i am disappointed and i hope the planned obsolescence model goes for more quality down the line knowing that you will have to replace it in a couple years since it wont be able to load a couple tabs in the browser after all the updates that comes with software. Chrome and Firefox frequently crash . i use around 30-40 tabs in internet browsing sometimes more. The year is 2015 not 1998. If you charge top price for a quad core then you have to make it top quality.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsRuns cool for me
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2015
Reviews: This processor is amazing.  I read some reviews on it that said it runs very hot which gave me some concern; however, with the stock fan, I'm doing light work like browsing the web and hovering around 27C.  Bioshock Infinite gave me a steady 75C on Ultra mode, and Star Citizen runs about 68C.  I did order some Arctic Silver 5 and put some on my the cover of the processor (no deliding needed) before installing the fan, so that might be helping.  Considering the price of this CPU, 10 more bucks seems well worth it.I'm extremely happy with this purchase and would highly recommend it.  I've been playing Star Citizen in the highest graphics mode, hooked up to an Oculus Rift at 1900res, and this processor has been handling it extremely well. Great buy for a gamer.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsDevil's Canyon absolutely rocks.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2014
Reviews: This is an absolutely fantastic enthusiast level processor.  Well done Intel.  I love this thing and I want to marry it!  The only bad thing I can say is this is prob what Haswell should have been from the get go.  This bad boy runs stock at 4GHz!!!!  Super fast and cooler than the i7 4770k with Intel's new secret TIM (idle is 23-25C using a Corsair H80i).  And when I say its fast- I mean lightning bolt fast.  AMAZING.  Crazy fast and runs cool!My MSI Gaming motherboard has an "Enhanced Turbo" feature and forces all four cores to run at 4.4GHz all the time.  And this is all before any actual overclocking.  It's insanity!!!  But in a good way.If you have the means, get a Z97 mobo and this processor.  You won't regret it.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis thing is a BEAST (in the best way possible)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2015
Reviews: This processor is a beast. I needed a new server setup for the streaming, syncing, live security camera capture, transcoding, software RAID parity calculation, and a bunch of other stuff I recently decided to add. My old dual core would just outright stall and require a hard reboot to come back up. With this processor, I don't think I've ever seen it go above 70% utilization. It's quick, efficient, and if I need to downclock a bit for more efficiency or cooling I can due to the unlocked multiplier.I can only imagine what this would do in a gaming or editing build. It's probably massively overpowered for most people (even most gamers would be hard pressed to need more than an i5 k series chip), but for those that will benefit from it... get it!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2014
Reviews: I love this thing!  Pretty sure I won't need to worry about upgrading my CPU anytime soon.  Install was easy although I didn't even try using the supplied cooler.  I had it sitting under a Corsair Hydro h105 and it stays around 32*C with web browsing, watching HD video, music, and Office use.  When playing Diablo 3, it will hit 50*C.  Tomb Raider on maxed out graphic settings see 60*C and it runs SMOOOOOOTH.  I'm sure temps get higher during some of the more intense scenes but I haven't seen it happen yet.  I have it overclocked at 4.4ghz and run PNY GTX 770 OC with it.  I only have the cooler plus 2 intake+1 exhaust fans moving air in a mid-tower.  I will probably get one more higher RPM fan just for piece of mind though.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGuaranteed will not be the bottleneck
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2016
Reviews: Impressive speed.  Use mine for video editing/compressing, gaming, everything.  Never had this CPU bottleneck anything I've done.If this CPU becomes your bottleneck then my diagnosis is one of three things:  1) Your workload is intensive enough, in which case you most likely know a thing or two about PCs, and therefore should have known better.  2) You are doing stuff that is beyond the league of a common consumer CPU.  3) You are doing video compression (or similar) just like me and are going to see 100% cpu usage by design.  4) Run a virus scan, because you probably have a virus :)Can't go wrong with this one (for an older generation).

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIt is GREAT, except for that cooler.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2015
Reviews: Great CPU, renders videos extremely fast for me. Overall great CPU. THE ONLY THING IS THAT COOLER. I have never said this before as the stock cooler for my previous CPU and APU have been fine (as in not annoying loud in my opinion). But for this one please do yourself a favor and get a aftermarket cooler. I personally have not yet because of financial reasons but when I am rendering videos or playing a Cities Skyline that fan is so loud. And it is really ineffective when the CPU is being stressed at those levels. My PC does not crash but 80c-85c is not cool. During normal gaming it almost never goes over 60c however and sounds fine. But since I render videos for YouTube frequently it does get a bit annoying.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSo fast that I didn't even bother overclocking it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2014
Reviews: I built my previous computer more than 6 years ago, and was due a refresh. So, naturally, I wanted the best bang-for-the-buck processor in my new build. Enter the i7-4790K. Four cores, eight threads, and a base clock speed of 4 GHz make this processor a best buy, IMO. They redesigned the thermal layer in this CPU, so the temperatures remain incredibly manageable while overclocking it. That being said, this processor is so fast that I haven't even bothered OC'ing it, and my setup is more than capable of doing so - it's paired with an ASRock Z97 motherboard, fast RAM, etc.This processor is a no-brainer for anyone looking to upgrade, and if you pair this with a solid state drive, it'll blow your mind how fast everything becomes. Amazon will only let me give it 5 stars, but it truly deserves more.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2022
Reviews: I was a little hesitant about attempting to upgrade my processor on my Dell Inspiron 3847 from an i5 to an i7 but it was extremely easy.  Would have done it earlier if I had known.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2015
Reviews: Outstanding for single thread performance - I only upgrade every few years, and you can really feel the benefit of not only a fast clock speed but also the incremental improvements in instructions per cycle. Compared to my 5 year old dual Xeon X5670 (12 cores, 2.93 Ghz) this is about ~85% faster for single threaded tasks. For multithreaded tasks this quad-core CPU performs as my old computer using 7 cores.  I do not play games, but the built in graphics are sufficient for volume rendering, and the graphics driver support for Linux seems solid. I did not overclock my unit - so I can not comment on that. However, for stock performance this is a blazingly fast CPU. I used a basic Rosewill RCX-ZAIO-92 cooler and this provides reasonable temperatures without generating much noise.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars0 GHz base clock Great potential to overclock Runs cool under a watercooler Cons
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2016
Reviews: I've already written a review for this on Newegg so I'll keep it short.Pros:4 cores with hyperthreading8 MB cache4.0 GHz base clockGreat potential to overclockRuns cool under a watercoolerCons:Price, still $340 after almost 3 years?Slightly slower than SkylakeThoughts:I upgraded from a 4690k to stream and game simultaneously, I see little to no difference in gaming performance from my 4690k to my 4790k. So if you're only gaming don't waste money on an i7. Also, this chip needs way more voltage to reach 4.8GHz than my i5. The i5 only needed 1.26v, this needs 1.35v. I got lucky with my i5 on the silicon lottery.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis is a monster

Like all things intel price,  definitely dents the pocket book a little.  The second would be the stock cooler is kinda weak.  Under full load the stock cooler can't keep up.  I definitely recommend an upgraded cooler to be used with this chip.  With no over clock this was getting a little warmer than I would of liked to see.  I would rather them drop a few bucks and ditch the cooler supplied or add a few bucks and give us something better.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars4790K is the way to go if you have money to blow

Reviews: works great. my Window's power profile and my BIOS overclock has it running from 1.2GHz-4.6Ghz. temps have never passed 55°C with intense 1440p gaming. idles ~37°C.worth the money if you get it on sale ~$320.handles DDR3 2400 RAM with no problem.disappointed that i don't see the huge improvement in games so many tout. my FX8350 @ 4.8GHz got very near the same scores\fps in 3DMark, Tomb Raider, Hitman: Absolution, Dirt3, and others with built-in benchmarks. a slight improvement but not like all the intel fanboys like to cry on forums. i would stick with the FX990\8350 if doing it over.along with my 8GB 290X every game is totally maxed out @ 1080p, mostly maxed @ 1440p. sits right @ 60fps on a 60Hz display.

I don't recall exactly, but I do remember that some of my first overclocking attempts at 4.5 or 4.6 ghz with the evo ran it up to 95+C, which I then left decided to leave the default settings be. Paired with a good cooler, this card does have good potential, but if you're not going to spend $60+ on an aircooler to overclock it, you might want to look at a different cpu because this chip runs hot.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K

I have been amazed at the speed of it when decoding and encoding video.We use Amazon for most of our purchases and I update my reviews if anything changes with the products. Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis chip converted and AMD supporter

Product Title: Intel Core i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz) BX80646I74790K

Product Title: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad-Core Processor 3.5 GHz 8 MB Cache LGA 1155
Review Title: 1.0 out of 5 starsThe cpu will not post with more than one stick of ram
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2022
Reviews: This is the 4th time I've tried to leave this review...No post with more than 1 stick of ram.System build-I7 3770k (previously i5 2500)Gigabyte z77 ud5h moboGigabyte hd 7970My brother wanted a gaming pc, I had a shelf of parts from customers computers they donated. Either cause the system was old or the motherboard/gpu needed logic board repair that i don't have enough experience in to offer as a repair service. So I used a known good motherboard from an old computer and a cpu out of a Dell system with a compatible cpu and built the system around my old gpu that I had managed to revive.He wanted to upgrade it and either stream or record his games. I never had issues with the gpu he has so I figured the cpu/ram could use an upgrade as the one I gave him couldn't overclock. My system has a xeon x5675 so I knew that the cpu difference would give my system an unfair advantage. That and the larger cpu cache size. So I looked around found a cheap i7 3770k on Amazon and got him some more ram as well as a scythe Mugan 5 cpu cooler so we could do some minor overclocking.However after installing the new cpu and cooler. The system would not post.Checked firmware. No further bios update available.Reset bios to factory settings, maybe there was something I missed or didn't pay attention to. Still didn't help.Swapped cpu cooler back to stock intell. NothingTook out all ram leaving one after reinstalling the scythe cooler. System boots up and posts. Clears windows no problem.It continued to post regardless of which slot I used for the single stick of ram. And regardless of which stick of ram I used.Now im thinking maybe its something stupid like a screw stuck behind the mobo in the case. So I continued all further testing out of the case.No change. System will not boot with more than one stick of ram regardless of which slot that one stick is in.I've been doing this a while so I went back to the old i5 to verify that the mobo was still good. And the system goes back to normal with the i5 installed. No ram issues even with max memory supported installed in dual channel on 4 slots.I figure I overlooked something with motherboard compatibility so I ordered a different motherboard I have experience with the i7 3770k working on as it was a friends computer. Lmao come tho think of it its an identical build with the same gpu.After swapping out the motherboard the system still persisted to have the issue again, only with the i7 and not the i5. I look at the i7 pin pads. And notice the 5 that are responsible for the memory controller circuit seem worn through like someone messed with the screw on the motherboard and over tightened the lga socket. But we have never messed with either and neither mobo has a stiff lever beyond what is normal for this socket.I checked the i5 and the pad damage is not there.I have tried 3 times since this purchase to get a refund or a replacement to no avail.
