Reviews: The i5-12400 is at a nice spot on the value/performance curve for a homelabber.  Anything lower and you only get four cores. Anything higher and you have to deal with the P-core/E-core dichotomy. The included heatsink/fan combo isn't much to look at but it gets the job done.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12400 Desktop Processor 18M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz LGA 1700 Socket
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 May 2023
Reviews: I wasn't expecting much out of this CPU but it runs 3D CAD software better than my old i7-6700k and completely blows it out of the water with rendering and tool path generation.  For the price it's dang near perfect.  It's about 20% slower at generating tool paths than an i5-12600k but way faster than the previous generation CPUs.  It's definitely a jump forward from the i5-11400 and about equivalent of an i5-11600k or a 10th gen i7

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12400 Desktop Processor 18M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz LGA 1700 Socket
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 December 2022
Reviews: You get more cores than an i3 based cpu. If you want to save a lot, you could go with a 12100f, but I think you get a lot of value with this cpu. You get the faster pcie lanes and more of them compared to the 10th and 11th gen cpus. And you can use a single fan low profile heatsink and fan with this and get around 75c temperatures during cpu stress tests. When the 13400 comes out though, this might not be worth it depending on the price it comes out with, but for now you get a great value and great performance.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12400 Desktop Processor 18M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz LGA 1700 Socket

Reviews: Muy buen procesador.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12400 Desktop Processor 18M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz LGA 1700 Socket
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 20 February 2022
Reviews: Great 6 core chip for just about everything. Very good gaming performance. Will not bottleneck your GPU. Even if you have a 3080\3070 Ti, or a 6800\ 6800XT this CPU will deliver great performance. I have bought 2 so far and I even paired them with a budget ASRock B660 motherboard and still performed at highest speeds with  135W PL2. This CPU will definitely last a good 5 years since it has great IPC performance and is compatible with DDR5 RAM. All this for approx $180-220 is a bargain. If you don't need to overclock or don't want to spend a great deal of money this is the CPU for you. Will provide much better performance per dollar on a long term basis than the 12100-12300 4 cores CPUs.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12400 Desktop Processor 18M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz LGA 1700 Socket

Reviews: Le processeur Intel Core i3-12100F est idéal pour du gaming midrange en raison de son excellent rapport performances/prix. Avec ses quatre cœurs et huit threads, il offre une bonne puissance de traitement pour exécuter les jeux modernes sans problème. De plus, sa fréquence de base élevée et sa prise en charge de la mémoire DDR4 jusqu'à 3200 MHz contribuent à des performances fluides dans la plupart des jeux. En combinant ce processeur avec une carte graphique de milieu de gamme, vous pouvez obtenir une expérience de jeu très satisfaisante sans avoir à dépenser une fortune sur le matériel.

Reviews: Il processore Intel Core i3-12100F è una scelta interessante per chi cerca prestazioni solide senza spendere troppo. Ecco alcuni dettagli sulla CPU:Prestazioni: Il Core i3-12100F è un chip quad-core che può gestire i giochi se abbinato a una GPU dedicata. È più adatto per attività come la navigazione su internet, il lavoro, lo studio e le videochiamate. Nonostante sia una soluzione economica, offre prestazioni affidabili.Efficienza energetica: Questo processore è progettato per offrire un buon equilibrio tra potenza e consumo energetico. Anche alzando i limiti, si vedranno miglioramenti modesti ma notevoli nelle prestazioni, senza compromettere l’efficienza energeticaPrezzo accessibile: Con un costo di circa 100-110 euro, l’i3-12100F rappresenta un’opzione conveniente per chi desidera giocare in Full HD senza esaurire il budget.In sintesi, se state cercando un processore economico ma capace, l’Intel Core i3-12100F potrebbe essere la scelta giusta.

Product Title: Intel Core i3 12100F 12th Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor 4 CPU with 12MB Cache and up to 4.30 GHz Clock Speed LGA 1700 Socket
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on 5 May 2024
Reviews: mi sono imbattuto nel processore Intel Core i3-12100F e sono rimasto piacevolmente sorpreso dalla sua potenza e versatilità.Prima di tutto, devo sottolineare la fluidità delle prestazioni.Grazie alla sua architettura moderna e ai quattro core fisici, il i3-12100F gestisce senza problemi tutte le attività quotidiane, dalle sessioni di navigazione web alle sessioni di gioco più impegnative.Ho notato un netto miglioramento nelle prestazioni rispetto al mio vecchio processore, specialmente in applicazioni multithreading.Una delle cose che ho apprezzato di più è stata l'affidabilità.Il i3-12100F si è dimostrato stabile anche sotto carichi di lavoro intensi, senza surriscaldamenti e senza compromettere le prestazioni.Questo mi ha dato la tranquillità necessaria per concentrarmi sul mio lavoro senza dover preoccuparmi di improvvisi rallentamenti o crash del sistema inoltre, devo menzionare la sua efficienza energetica.

Product Title: Intel Core i3 12100F 12th Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor 4 CPU with 12MB Cache and up to 4.30 GHz Clock Speed LGA 1700 Socket
Review Date: Reviewed in France on 14 January 2024
Reviews: Ce processeur propose un rapport prix / performance incroyable. Il est aussi puissant que mon ancien 11700KF en simple coeur, et 20% plus lent seulement en multi-coeurs ! J'obtienais 2236/10151 avant (SC/MC) et maintenant 2231/8153 sur Geekbench 6. J'ai été très étonné, à l'usage je n'ai presque pas vu la différence en passant du 11700KF/Z590 au 12100F/Z790, excepté pour les travaux multi-tâches professionnels lourds. A ce prix là c'est vraiment impressionnant.

Product Title: Intel Core i3 12100F 12th Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor 4 CPU with 12MB Cache and up to 4.30 GHz Clock Speed LGA 1700 Socket

Product Title: Intel Core i3 12100F 12th Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor 4 CPU with 12MB Cache and up to 4.30 GHz Clock Speed LGA 1700 Socket
Review Date: Reviewed in France on 6 October 2022
Reviews: Cette 12ème génération de processeurs Intel est décidément excellente !Depuis 20 ans, je n'avais acheté que du AMD, mais à le lecture de nombreux tests qui avaient mis en avant les qualités du 12100F, j'avais donc décidé de franchir le pas.Au départ, je voulais un processeur à la fois suffisamment puissant dans les jeux, et qui ne chauffe pas (et donc qui ne consomme pas). Déjà parce qu'il était destiné à être placé dans un HTPC, ayant par essence un airflow un peu compliqué, et ensuite car je souhaitais optimiser le rapport performances/énergie.Je pense que c'est mission accomplie. En lecture de films, ou pendant l'écoute de musique, le processeur Intel et la carte graphique (GTX 1660 TI)  ne dépassent pas chacun les 35°c, et grimpent respectivement à 47°c et 62°c lors des sessions de jeux.Je précise que le 12100F est refroidi par un ventirad Low Profile Noctua NHL-12S, appuyé par un ventilateur Arctic P12, et est fixé au socket par un cadre d'ajustement, sensé éviter les déformations de la surface du processeur, de marque Thermalright.En terme de puissance, ce processeur peut-être associé à n'importe quelle carte graphique sans limiter le potentiel de cette dernière, sauf peut-être celles au-dessus des très puissantes AMD RX 6900 XT et des RTX 3080 TI.En applicatif en revanche, l'Intel pêchera un peu sans pour autant être ridicule. Sachez qu'elle a autant de répondant qu'un haut de gamme d'il y a 4 ans.Pour résumer, au regard du prix, le 12100F est ce qu'il se fait de mieux pour un ordinateur destiné à un usage polyvalent et économique.

Product Title: Intel Core i3 12100F 12th Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor 4 CPU with 12MB Cache and up to 4.30 GHz Clock Speed LGA 1700 Socket
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on 15 August 2022
Reviews: Una CPU veramente eccellente. Se ovviamente si cerca un prodotto entrylevel. Dalle recensioni ha prestazioni da fascia superiore di qualche anno fa, la CPU ha 4 core con HT quindi gestisce 8Th.L'ho acquistata per un secondo PC in un case micro-ATX con una sola 92mm posteriore in estrazione. Come prestazioni e reattività la CPU è veramente niente male navigazione, riproduzione. Ho fatto qualche bench tipo CPUZ e va un pò di più del mio R5 1600 in multi (6c/12t) e molto di più in ST.In buona sostanza se cercate una CPU per uso navigazione, riproduzione, produttività leggera, gaming (magari retrogaming su giochi DX11) è il prodotto giusto. Se fate gaming su giochi moderni (DX12) e con obiettivo di refresh sostenuti (anche minimi) allora meglio un 12400 o superiore (parlando di Intel).Ho fatto dei test con Intelburntest e la CPU resta a 4,089GHz su tutti i core con T di 75° in inverno e 82° a Luglio. Premetto che uso il dissi stock ho solo cambiato la pasta termica (arctic MX4).  La ventola tende a girare un po' veloce per tenere la T sotto controllo, comunque non è rumorosissima anzi. Diciamo che secondo me il dissi è un pò al limite però tiene la CPU a bada. Fosse un i5 (sei core) consiglierei una soluzione aftermarket.

Product Title: Intel Core i3 12100F 12th Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor 4 CPU with 12MB Cache and up to 4.30 GHz Clock Speed LGA 1700 Socket
Review Date: Reviewed in France on 12 June 2023
Reviews: Excellent processeur qui est supérieur à un i7 de génération 8.Efficace en jeu, mais moins performant sur certains logiciels professionnels, notamment les logiciels dédiés au rendu.Toutefois le venti-rad proposé en série est limite. Monte à plus 3000 rpm à pleine charge ce qui occasionne pas mal de bruit.Le processeur atteint les 80 degrés en phase de stress test, ce qui est correct, mais pas optimum ( il y a 20 degrés de marge avant l arret de sécurité, toutefois même en jeu le processeur atteint rarement les 60%).Investir dans un venti-rad ne sera pas un luxe.Dans le cas où vous utiliseriez quand même de le venti-rad de série, pensez à prendre de la pâte thermique. Intel est assez radin et le peu qui est déposé sur le socle du venti-rad est largement insuffisant.

Et le bruit insupportable du ventilateur qui, en jeu, est direct très haut dans les tours pour "descendre" , péniblement, la températureJe commande un vrai ventirad....J'ai finalement pris un Cooler Master, le jour et la nuit.. Reviews: Excellent processeur pour le gaming au budget restreint.Très sous-estimé, le i3-12100 est la petite "GTI" des processeurs.C'est Le meilleur rapport qualité/prix pour de l'entrée de gamme.Excellent rapport conso/chauffe/perf.Les performances sont les mêmes que ses homologues en i5/i7 et r5/r7 lorsque coupée avec un GPU milieu de gamme.Elle n'a rien a envier, sauf si vous avez une centaine d'euros à mettre en plus sur un i5-12400 ou un r5-5600

Product Title: Intel Core i3 12100F 12th Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor 4 CPU with 12MB Cache and up to 4.30 GHz Clock Speed LGA 1700 Socket
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on 2 September 2022
Reviews: Sorprendente i3, poca spesa e tanta resa. Ho assemblato un pc da zero partendo da lui, un grande salto in avanti dal mio vecchio Phenom II x4. Tanti lamentano che sia un i3, collo di bottiglia futuro e bla bla bla. Se volete spendere di più fatelo, ma questo regge tranquillamente ogni titolo attuale, costa poco ed è nuovo. Rapporto qualità-prezzo eccezionale.

Product Title: Intel Core i3 12100F 12th Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor 4 CPU with 12MB Cache and up to 4.30 GHz Clock Speed LGA 1700 Socket

Purtroppo se si passa ad editing video o streaming a livello medio alti, comincia a rallentare, ma dopotutto è pur sempre un i3, progettato per un uso casalingo.

Reviews: Great budget gaming cpu and actually at the moment better value for money than  the equivalent ryzen. Honestly go with amd or Intel whatever beats whatever at price performance for your budget, but intel beats amd here on budget for once.

Product Title: Intel Core i3-10100F 10th Generation LGA1200 Desktop Processor 4, 4 Cores 8 Threads up to 4.30GHz 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in Canada on 3 October 2022
Reviews: great budget CPU for gaming and streaming Fast and zippy does very well with a MSI MPG Z490 Wifi motherboard (just set memory too 3200MHZ in Bios) and M.2 NVME 1TB Timetech , 16gb 3000MHZ ram DDR4 Gskill Aegis and i paired it with a RTX 2060 6GB and it does not bottleneck or disappoint at all in this setup i get a steady 165-175FPS all high settings in Fortnite chapter 3 1080P HD- 3D setting too 80% and 120-165FPS in all high settings in Call of duty WarZone !!! this CPU is GREAT, it is better then a Ryzen 7 1700X or R5 2200G bye far the extra cores dont match the i3 10100F,s better instruction set and higher core clock out of box the 6MB cache only hinders this i3 for video editing but not streaming too twitch or youtube . if you want too future proof for later get a Z590 motherboard too upgrade too 11th gen later when you can afford it and gain all the benefits PCIexpress 4.0 .. this CPU makes all the previous gen 4 core 8 thread cpuz obsolete like the i7 7700 and below and devalued as this is faster and better and has a upgrade path for only 95$ !!! you guys had too upgrade platforms someday and well this is so affordable you should do it now .. the F Sku at the end of i3 10100F means their is no onboard graphics thus you need a GPU or graphics card which Gamers and enthusiasts will anyways

Product Title: Intel Core i3-10100F 10th Generation LGA1200 Desktop Processor 4, 4 Cores 8 Threads up to 4.30GHz 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in Canada on 19 January 2023
Reviews: Used this for a cheap upgrade for the family PC which sees light gaming, web browsing and school use (MS office).Pros:1) Price/value;2) low 65w TDP meant I didn't have to upgrade the power supply;3) Decent desk top performance;Cons:1) Only 4 Cores (still adequate for normal desk top use);2) The 10100f doesn't have built-in graphics.Note: The requirement for a discrete graphics card isn't really a con, as any cheap/used graphics card will be better than the Intel graphics on the normal i3 10100. Just be aware of this requirement before purchasing.

Product Title: Intel Core i3-10100F 10th Generation LGA1200 Desktop Processor 4, 4 Cores 8 Threads up to 4.30GHz 6MB Cache

Reviews: Para trabajo de oficina, escuela o profesional es excelente, barato, bajo consumo de energía, muy rápido y silencioso, para juegos AAA en calidad ultra tiene cuello de botella, lo probé con 3080ti y hay mucha diferencia en fluidez con un i5 de 10 u 11° generación

Product Title: Intel Core i3-10100F 10th Generation LGA1200 Desktop Processor 4, 4 Cores 8 Threads up to 4.30GHz 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in Canada on 30 August 2022
Reviews: This processor is a great budget-friendly processor for gamers that want to create their own custom PCs.I bought this processor back in November 2021 and it arrived a week from ordering it. The packaging was solid (I believed that the processor's box would be well cushioned if dropped accidentally). Although, the box of the processor was a little scuffed; as if it was overly used. This concerned me until I tested the processor along with its heat-sink fan. I used this processor for University, programming, and gaming.Like I said, the processor comes with a fan and pre-applied thermal paste with it. Overall, this is an authentic Intel processor and would recommend to my friends in case they want to start with a budget-friendly PC component.

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 6 August 2022
Reviews: This offer allowed me to build a super low budget PC which beats the i7-4770 it replaced in every single aspect. More performance, less power draw, less noise, better thermals. Don't buy an old used i7-4770 which will still go for $50 or more when you can buy this CPU new with fresh thermal paste and CPU cooler already included.The only issue you might face is finding a good offer for a motherboard but if you manage to do so you'll be ready for future upgrades. Mind you, you will need a dedicated graphics card or you might want to look for the non-"f" version.My order was shipped very fast and arrived in an original sealed box in immaculate condition which makes me a happy customer.

Product Title: Intel Core i3-10100F 10th Generation LGA1200 Desktop Processor 4, 4 Cores 8 Threads up to 4.30GHz 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in Japan on 11 May 2021
Reviews: Intel 第11世代CPUのLGA1200 Core i3 10100Fです。「F」とつくモデルは内蔵グラフィック機能が廃止されておりグラフィックボードがないと映像を出力できないので注意が必要です。その代わり「無印」のモデルより価格が少し安くなっています。ただ注意点として画面が映らなくなってしまうような不具合が起きた時に内蔵出力が無い事によって不具合の原因究明が難しくなるデメリットがあります。そのため故障した時の事も考える場合は「無印」、とにかく値段の安さを取るなら「F」付きがオススメです。この値段の安さでなんと第7世代 Core i7 7700と同等の性能を持っています。当時35000円ほどしていたCore i7 7700がたった3年で10000円のCPUと同等の性能になってしまうので、第10世代の進化は素晴らしいです。超ハイスペックを目指さない限りはこのCPUで余裕です。

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on 26 March 2024
Reviews: Processore davvero fenomenale, sbloccato e probabilmente in grado di fornire prestazioni ancora superiori.Tutto molto bello se non fosse che almeno in questo esemplare non c'è stato verso di far funzionare la prima corsia PciE 16X e quindi risultato è stato completamente inutile, sicuramente per il gaming. Ho provato su tre schede madri differenti, b760 e z690, in tutti i casi e settaggi del bios non è stato possibile utilizzare il primo slot.Mentre gli altri slot venivano utilizzati correttamente e, ad esempio, nel secondo slot pciE la scheda video veniva riconosciuta, ma finzionava solo a gen3 X8. Capirete però che usare una scheda video da magari 600€ a un quarto della sua potenzialità è inaccettabile.Ottima Amazon come sempre nell'effettuare il reso. Sfortuna, ogni tanto capita.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in Japan on 2 January 2024
Reviews: 届いてないのに配送済みの表示(手渡し済み？...されていない)が出た時には驚かされたが、その後配送中に変わりかなり遅れたが無事配達された。これに限らずD15Sの17XX対応マウントキットが一時行方不明になるなどパーツが揃うまでひと月近くかかり、構成の変更も真剣に考えた。難産であったが出来上がったPCは青、黒画面、フリーズ連発悪夢のASUSZ790-PD4CSM+i5-13600K構成に比較して最初から安定、青画面はOC+シネベンチR23実行時のみ(◎)。PC構成はMB ASROCK Z690 PRO RS+CPU（これ）+メモリ CFD DDR4 3200 16G×2+CPUクーラーD15Sプラス12㎝ファン(流用ｓ)、以下省略。シネベンチR23の電力無制限(最高5G㎐)、長時間65W*短時間120W*ピーク温度62℃でのそれぞれの数値は、ASUS Z790+i5-13600K構成 23000*18000、これ 18000*13000程度、それぞれ78*72％位の性能となる。性能的には見るべき所はないが電力無制限時遥かに静かで、これは使用したMBメーカーの考え方、PCケース、CPUクーラーの違いが大きいようだ。ダイニングで使用するには十分な性能で不満はないが、認証が通らず11Pro.(パッケージ版)を買う羽目になったのが少し痛い。現在13600K 47000円程度、これの78％だと36600円、72％で33840円位の価格でCP値がイーブン。購入時31028円、所在確認の電話代で数百円使用していたとしても当時はコスパが良かったが、現在の販売価格なら無理をしても13600Kを選んだ方が後悔しないし、自分も他のCPUをチョイスしていると思う。画像のφ120ファン(93.97CFM)は前方より後方に置いた方がCPU温度が低く画像の配置になった。2023/01/03 追記4k画面の画像数値が読めないのでFHDの物に差し替え。

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 May 2024
Reviews: The 12600K CPU has been an outstanding upgrade from my previous setup, delivering a remarkable boost in performance. I've been particularly impressed by its cool operation, maintaining a stable 64 degrees even during rigorous stress tests and extended gaming sessions. The CPU comfortably reaches 5.1 GHz without any stability issues, and it seems there's still plenty of room for further overclocking if needed. If you're looking for a CPU that offers solid performance, low heat, and great value, the 12600K is a fantastic choice. Highly recommended for both gaming and general productivity!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in Mexico on 4 September 2023
Reviews: En general es un buen producto pero su manejo de temperaturas no me gusta, por un lado puedes tener un núcleo a 50°c mientras otro está a 34°c y otro a 29°c y tener saltos "raros" desde igual 29 a 45°c; y eso descontrola un poco el manejo del ventidador del disipador; esto es usando una motherboard nueva gigabyte B760m ds3h AX y refrigeración líquida Corsair Hydro H60, vengo de usar un AMD FX 8350 (que se calentaba mucho y por eso me acostumbre a la refrigeración líquida y con ese FX siempre tenía temperaturas en repodo de unos 25°c sin saltos raros y con el mismo H60 y TDP de 125W), cabe destacar que sabiendo del problema de pandeo que tiene esta serie (LGA 1700) he instalado desde el principio una placa de presion termalright para que ese problema no ocurra; hasta ahora todo funciona bien nunca ha pasado de los 60°c pero esos saltos de temperatura en diferentes partes del procesador siguen sin gustarme.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 July 2024
Reviews: EDIT: Fixed the previous issues. Was a software issue, not a hardware issue.NEW REVIEW (5 Stars):I'm a video editor, and I usually only upgrade once every 5-7 years, and this thing more than DOUBLES the performance of my old i5 7600K 4C/4T CPU from 2017.  6P/4E cores for under $200. Wow. I was able to pick this thing up for $150 on Black Friday in 2023 and it's worth every penny.Paired it with a Deepcool AK400 cooler which I picked up for around $30 and it keeps temps around 70-75 while running Cinebench and other similar benchmarks (it's worth noting, however, that I haven't overclocked it).This with a $300 RTX 3060 from MSI with 12GB of VRAM and I have a beast of a 4K Premiere Pro workhorse that should keep me happy for another 5-7 years.A quick note if you use Premiere Pro and aren't aware:If you use Premiere Pro, you absolutely NEED the K series of intel chips. Do NOT cheap out and get an intel chip without an iGPU! The integrated graphics chips in the K series have decoders specifically designed for h264 footage to decode that footage in Premiere Pro, allowing for buttery-smooth playback on your timeline with little to no dropped frames.According to benchmarks, without the iGPU, you can see as much as a 20-30% drop in such tasks! Do yourself a favor and spend an extra $20-$30 to get that iGPU for decoding! (You'll still need a good dedicated GPU to handle GPU-intensive effects.Hope this helps.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 December 2023
Reviews: Purchased for $150 for Cyber Monday 2023 and it's been excellent. In Cyberpunk 2077, with Ray Tracing on and a mix of ultra/high settings, I've reached 60-120 FPS (usually hovering between 70-90) with a Gigabyte Eagle 4060. I've hit 500+ FPS in League of Legends, and with V-Sync on, I've had no noticeable drop from 165 FPS. On sale, this is an excellent processor and an INCREDIBLE upgrade from my previous 9400f which was and still is a very capable processor. Temps are very stable with a Peerless Assassin cooler; I don't believe I've reached or exceeded 60 degrees Celsius. I haven't overclocked yet - if I even will, because current performance is excellent - but I've read that this processor overclocks a fair amount.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 6 July 2024
Reviews: I've never in my life bought a processor that did not include the cooling fan ... until today.  This processor does not have one in the box.  I reread the description and I do not see any indication that a fan is not included.  After googling it, I found an obscure Intel site that says -K processors do not have fans.  They mention it like it's common knowledge.  Amazon had a same day delivery for another $33.  I'd say make sure you read the description, but it wouldn't've helped here.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W

Reviews: Bought this for my second computer, and can say it is the budget king at the moment. It does not overclock very well though compared to a 13600k. I tested this CPU with a 3080, and 4080 and can say it gets the job done, but at 1080p I saw bottlenecking with both graphics cards.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 November 2023
Reviews: Decided to finally upgrade from my 6 or 7 year old Asus X99 platform and 980ti sli (yes that old) to an Asus Tuf Z790/12600k/Tuf 4080 OC gamers edition. My old 5820k was creating a HUGE bottleneck issue for my GPU, which I installed about a month prior. What a difference I must say. Now that I'm finally out of the stone age, I'm in awe as to how much things have changed in the PC gaming world. This current build smokes everything I throw at it so far. Which admittedly has only been a few games and benchmarks. I paired the processor and GPU with water blocks from an AIO Corsair system for my CPU, and a separate Granzon custom loop for the GPU. All I can say is wow. Fast boot times, 150 plus fps in some games like The Division 2 with medium settings at 1440p. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this processor/Z790 motherboard/GPU combo. Are there better options for better performance or there? Absolutely. But for the money, I believe that the average gamer would be hard pressed to find any significant issues with that platform. I was skeptical at first, as this is the first I5 processor I ever purchased for a PC, but as I stated previously, I am quite satisfied with my decision to take a leap of faith. Again, I highly recommend this processor. Can't beat the performance at this price point with a stick.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 October 2023
Reviews: El procesador Intel Core i5-12600K ha superado todas mis expectativas y ha llevado mi experiencia informática a un nuevo nivel. Como un entusiasta de la tecnología, siempre estoy ansioso por probar las últimas y mejores piezas de hardware, y este chip no me ha decepcionado en absoluto.El rendimiento de esta CPU es simplemente impresionante. Con sus 10 núcleos y 16 hilos, es capaz de manejar las tareas más exigentes con facilidad. Ya sea jugando a juegos de última generación, editando videos en 4K o realizando tareas de productividad intensivas, el i5-12600K demuestra un rendimiento suave y rápido en cada situación.La tecnología Intel Thread Director es un gran avance, ya que mejora la administración de hilos y la eficiencia energética, lo que se traduce en un mejor rendimiento en aplicaciones multi-hilo y una menor temperatura de funcionamiento. Además, el soporte para DDR5 RAM agrega un impulso adicional a la velocidad y la capacidad de respuesta del sistema.El overclocking es una delicia con este procesador. Con un multiplicador desbloqueado y una gestión térmica eficiente, pude aumentar fácilmente la velocidad de reloj y obtener un rendimiento aún mejor. Esto es un sueño hecho realidad para los entusiastas que buscan exprimir cada gota de rendimiento de su sistema.En resumen, el Intel Core i5-12600K es una bestia de rendimiento que ofrece una experiencia de usuario excepcional. Si buscas un procesador de última generación para juegos, creación de contenido o cualquier tarea exigente, esta CPU es una elección sobresaliente. Estoy encantado con su rendimiento y no puedo esperar para ver lo que puedo lograr con él en el futuro. ¡Altamente recomendado!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 21 December 2023
Reviews: This processor with the rebuild of our desktop build has been very loyal and powerful. Mixed with a DeepCool AK620 and non overclocked I finally figure out the formula too achieve 4K ultra Gaming on most games that I play on a regular basis. I play numerous of strategy games but I do also play Grand Theft Auto (as an escape...) American truck simulator as of late and Roblox. The processing performance has been excellent. I hope that one day I can overclock one of these processors without having to worry about frequencies and voltages. Basically said it's it's 12th generation processor and that's been recent in the past two to three years. It is on the mid-range of the spectrum for Intel i5, but really just seems to automate on its own and it actively will try to lower utilization numbers once it's processed what it has to process. I can go through a hundred tabs an hour and not have to worry about internal latency. It's good

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 December 2023
Reviews: Bought for a Mini-ITX Build for my daughter when it was on sale for $149.99, felt like a nice value for Q4 2023.  Didn't overclock this one, but could as it runs at just 48 degrees Celsius under load from Cinebench R23 with the (just-barely-fits-in-the-case) ThermalRight Peerless Assassin 120 SE ARBG.  Side note: for anybody building a PC, that Peerless Assassin is the CPU air cooling champion at ~$40.  This 12600k processor is more power hungry than some of it's AMD competitors, but having recently purchased an AMD 7800x3d for my own computer that's requiring a bit more work to optimize and get running properly, this 12600k was perfect.  Intel stuff in my experience just tends to run good.

Reviews: I used this CPU in a recent build for a secondary  computer that I will game on at a secondary residence. It performs very well even in demanding flight simulation applications. The onboard video is a nice feature to have if you remove the video GPU to swap it out , etc and you still have the ability to enter the UEFI/BIOS, Windows 10/11, etc. The K suffix denotes that the CPU can be slightly overclocked if you wish to do that. Good price on a great 12th gen Intel CPU. Works great when paired with both my Nvidia and AMD GPU's. No compatibility issues have arisen.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 July 2022
Reviews: I recently built an 15 12600k system and it has plenty of ups and downs. I don't see any of the downs being the fault of the chip or Intel. Most of the issues I have experienced with the new system (and there have been many), have to do with the motherboard or ddr5. I upgraded from a i7 4770k I had on a 24/7 4.8ghz overclock for 7 years. The new I5 is CLEARLY faster in both single and multi threaded performance. Like many I experience many errors in the windows 11 event viewer usually something to do with an efficiency core. At the end of the day I don't see any real world effects on performance, and even microsoft says to ignore these errors.I have traditionally chosen intel because of their on board graphics support. I've had a graphics card go out in the past and having on board video allows you to at least use your system as a system while you figure out what has happened. If amd ever decides to see the value in having on board video from an administrator perspective; I may have to reconsider them.I am happy with the upgrade to the new chip and support for the new technology will only get better. I would recommend the I5 12600k to anyone looking for a reasonably priced new chip that will allow their systems to handle most tasks with ease for the foreseeable future.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 December 2023
Reviews: Just built a new machine with an MSI board and did not want to spend too much.  This CPU has decent performance and was over $100 less than the next generation up.  My board will accept 12, 13 and 14 gen CPU's so maybe I will update in a few years.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 28 August 2022
Reviews: I’m so glad I decided to step up from the 12600T I was planning on using to the 12600K, which is the cheapest Intel CPU that has the efficiency cores. I was nervous at first, because my plan was to build a low-ish power, 100% passively-cooled, internal GPU, no moving parts PC for use in my bedroom, where my previous computers were annoyingly loud. I used a Noctua NH-P1 passive cooler and a Seasonic PX-500 fanless PSU, and my system is not only 100% silent, it turns in impressive benchmark numbers and never gets close to throttling temperatures even after sustained Cinebench runs.I run my system at -130 mV, with no overclocking, and CPU power consumption peaks at about 100 W, while idle CPU power consumption is less than 2W. My heatsink never gets too hot to touch with my bare hand in daily use. The only thing preventing my system from being a high performance gaming PC is the lack of dedicated GPU, but the internal GPU is more than enough for me to run four simultaneous instances of BlueStacks 5 to play my favorite mobile game, and fast enough to run Diablo III and EVE Online with medium settings.The Core i5-12600K is roughly competitive in performance and price with the AMD Ryzen 7 5700X.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 March 2023
Reviews: Just got it for my NZXT gaming PC custom build & seems to work great. Install was easy & doesn't have the annoying fragile socket pins older CPUs used to have. You just place it on the socket close the bracket install your cooler & it should be good to go. I seem to have very good frame rate stability & seems to be able to handle most games even without a GPU. If a game used to be on console it'll likely work with this CPU & perform better than gaming console CPUs. I used to use a basic mini PC with an older i7 6700T but with this in my gaming PC is have next to no issue running HD graphics in games like GTA 5. And its amazing for the price. Was going to go with an i7 13700K this ended up costing half the price of the i7 & an i7 may be a bit overkill for most of the games I plan on playing on my PC anyway. Only downside is the newer Intel graphics settings apps suck.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in Canada on 7 April 2024

Product Title: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked Socket LGA 1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 August 2023
Reviews: Cumple con todo lo que promete, entiendo es una buena inversión, pues el mismo lo puedo usar tanto para gaming como para trabajo, excelente desempeño. Para una persona normal ita como yo esta súper, pues también he usado el 12700 y son muy parecidos en cuanto a rendimiento, a pesar de que el 12700 tiene más núcleos y que su consumo es menor, he sentido más estabilidad en el 12600k. Nota no hago OC. Siempre uso eso en stock.Lo tengo acompañado de rtx3080 y 64gb de RAM a 3600mhz y tengo otro que ya llevo desde que salió esta generación con 32gb de ram a 4400mhz y son una pasada para mi. Uno con Refrigeracion nzxt z53 y el otro con noctua nhd15s y se manejan súper las temperaturas en ambos casos.

Reviews: good

Product Title: Intel Core i7-13700K Desktop Processor 16 cores (8 P-cores + 8 E-cores) 30M Cache, up to 5.4 GHz Socket LGA 1700
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 8 March 2024
Reviews: I bought this to replace my 10850k after I realized how much it was holding back my 4090.  I bought an ASRock z790 PG lightning /d4 board to go with it so I could use my existing DDR4 ram.  The difference was night and day!  I have an ID-Cooling 280mm AIO (cheapest I could find on Amazon) with a contact frame and kyronaut thermal grizzly extreme paste and does not thermal throttle on Cinebench R23 unless I run 3 or 4 passes back to back.  I am thrilled with how well this CPU runs.I was able to bump my DDR4 up to 4200mhz in gear 1 (timings cl20/26/26/26/48) after a bios update from ASRock and this thing is rock solid and crazy fast!  I get an average of 30500 in cinebench r23 and it will overclock as far as you want - I have taken it to 5.7 and it runs fine, it just thermal throttles quickly at that speed.  I'm pretty sure I could overclock this beast to the moon if I threw a lot more money into a custom cooling loop, but it is plenty fast as is.  I have no regrets about not bumping up to the 13900k, I do gaming and code compiling and it is a dream for both of those workloads.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-13700K Desktop Processor 16 cores (8 P-cores + 8 E-cores) 30M Cache, up to 5.4 GHz Socket LGA 1700
Review Date: Reviewed in Canada on 13 June 2024
Reviews: Upgraded to the 13700k from the 11900k and the jump in performance was nothing short of massive. This 13th gen i7 K is officially Intel's fourth fastest CPU on paper but in real life it's the fastest of them all in terms of stability as the the three slated above it (13900k,14700k and 14900k) are all plagued with issues that Intel won't discuss but admits to, albeit grudgingly. Until a fix-all patch is released, the 13700k is the best choice for gamers and content creators who won't be bothered with unpredictable bugs and BSOD fests. What good is it having a Ferrari but with an engine that's goes offline 20 times a day?  May as well go with a Porsche that works. At that level of performance these high-end CPU's more or less all perform equal (or would if they all worked properly), but it's easy to understand the frustration of owners whose 30-day window for return to Amazon is closed.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-13700K Desktop Processor 16 cores (8 P-cores + 8 E-cores) 30M Cache, up to 5.4 GHz Socket LGA 1700

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThe CPU has a triangle on it that you match up with the array on the motherboard which is nice for a first timer like myself
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2016
Reviews: I bought this CPU for my first PC build I am very thrilled. I bought this CPU for its capabilities. Moving on, CPU is well- protected and the fan is protected and tightly packed in the small Intel box.The CPU has a triangle on it that you match up with the array on the motherboard which is nice for a first timer like myself. Moreover, than cooler has seemingly flimsy or odd clips that hold it to the motherboard, but they are solidly planted once it snaps and rotates into the holes of the motherboard. Again, a nice stock cooler in my opinion (of limited knowledge) even though almost all featured PC builds cram buying an after market cooler down your throat. The cooler is fine for what it is,  a stock cooler that comes with thermal paste and is designed by Intel for Intel.Lastly, at idle the temperature is a consistent 29 degrees Celsius. This CPU easily handles 3D builder, Auto CAD, other modeling programs, and gaming titles such as Skyrim, Dishonored, Fallout, CS GO, GTA IV are all getting very high frame rates in highest settings in coordination with my MSI GTX 960 4GB OC.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsCould have done it better
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2016
Reviews: I'm assuming it's great. The inexpensive motherboard failed, but I've got a better one on the way now. I foolishly ordered the motherboard before the CPU, so wasn't able to test it within the 30 day period after ordering. The problem was that the CPU is so expensive I could only purchase it by itself. I should have assumed that the CPU was solid and waited on the purchase of the motherboard for a more timely handling of the computer build and testing. Having to buy computer parts a little at a time, doesn't always work out so well and I didn't want to have to break it up into three separate orders, but of course that's exactly the way it's working out anyway. I pay as I go, which doesn't do much for my credit rating and high interest credit cards are not a viable choice either. I just need to rebuild my old desktop from 2007 and gradually get it into another case as possible. The motherboard that's coming, will handle an upgrade to an i7 6700k, down the road, so that's encouraging at least. Mean time this i5 6500 will do just fine I'm sure.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsRuns Super Cool for HTPC
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2016
Reviews: I installed this in an aging HTPC that I use as my main entertainment hub as well as play a few video games and edit pictures in Lightroom.  This is pretty much my main computer. It replaced an AMD 9750 that always ran super hot and was a dog.  I got tired of trying to keep that thing cool so I was sold on the low TDP of this chip which I didn't need to overclock and the newest architecture.  I hooked this up with an MSI gaming 3 motherboard and 16GB of Corsair 3200Mhz memory.  The system is like night and day.  It runs super cool with the stock cooler in my HTPC case.  I ran Prime95 for awhile and it topped out around 60C.  I have not done any gaming yet but I can run every program I could find, VLC video, youtube, Plex, virus scan, tons of chrome browser tabs open...etc all at the same time with no problems.  I'm interested to see how Lightroom does as it is a pretty CPU intensive program.  I'm happy.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIMO Best Gaming option.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2016
Reviews: Great processor! This is probably the best price-to-performance ratio processor available on the market right now. It plays right along with other processors just fine and makes an EXCELLENT gaming processor.For those wondering, I have been testing this processor's onboard graphics (involuntarily, unfortunately, as I'm waiting for my GPU to arrive), and I'm shocked by the gaming performance that I've been able to get out of it. here's a couple games for reference:Black Ops III at 1080p, rendered slightly lower, on medium graphics settings - 38fps avg (not amazing, but most certainly playable)Borderlands 2 at 1080p, high-settings - 48fps or higher.World of Tanks on Medium with HD Texture pack option - 42fps avg. Again, not amazing, but most certainly playable any day of the week.Needless to say, I'm thoroughly impressed with this CPU and in a pinch, it can be used to game on its own if you're looking to save up after initial purchase for a new GPU later on. I have an older "gaming" ish laptop that has a GT 650m, and this plays games just as well as it does.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBought for my first build with 0 regrets
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2017
Reviews: Bought this for my first ever build after two months of using the PC, I have ran into no issues with this. Just another great product from Intel.I pared this CPU up with:HyperX Fury Black 16GB kit (2x8GB)Windows 10Samsung 850 EVO 250GB SSDSeagate 1TB BarraCuda HDDASUS h170 Pro Gaming motherboardMSI GTX 1060 6GBSure I probably should have got one of the new Kaby Lake processors but I didn't feel the need to spend an extra $20-50 for a newer CPU.My new build has been running great and stable for two solid months now, hope it continues. Cheers.UPDATE: After one year of having this setup with no hiccups I'm really happy with my purchase and the build I used this CPU in. It was my first PC build ever and I'm ecstatic with how it turned out.UPDATE #2: It's going on three years now since I built this system and it is still going strong. I have no complaints.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIf you're on a budget, get this.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2016
Reviews: I am a gaming coming from AMD, I got tired of how my games ran so I finally bought a new system.I chose this CPU after seeing reviews and videos of how well it performs, and honestly this is the best CPU by price performance on the market.This CPU runs anything I throw at it 60FPS 1080P with my Asus Strix GTX 970 on high or ultra settings. I am using the stock cooler; and it runs very quiet. Probably the most quiet I have ever heard a stock CPU cooler run. I am using a ITX board and paired this with 16gb of ram and it's a monster. The Witcher 3 and Rise of the Tomb Raider on high run fantastic with this CPU, non stop 60 FPS.I have no complaints about it at all. For $200 this was a very solid deal, you maybe able to get it when it's $190 or less and that's a steal. This CPU is utterly fantastic.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2015
Reviews: Just built myself a new system consisting of:-This processor-MSI Computer ATX DDR4 Motherboard H170A PC MATE-Crucial Ballistix Sport 8GB Kit (4GBx2) DDR4 2400 MT/s (PC4-19200) DIMM 288-Pin Memory BLS2K4G4D240FSA/BLS2C4G4D240FSA-Plextor 128GB M5S Series Solid State Drive 2.5 PX-128M5S(brought this over from my old system)-an older 500w Antec Earthwatts power supply that I had laying around-Corsair Carbide Series 100R Silent Edition Quiet Mid Tower Case CC-9011077-WW-Windows 10 ProSo far this system has been great, rock solid and no problems whatsoever. Using the stock cooler and the fan that came installed in the case, this system runs too quietly to be heard from eight feet away.I have not had the money to add a video card quite yet, but I was pleasantly surprised to find that the onboard video can handle games from a couple of years ago quite well (Bioshock Infinite played very well, for example).

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThe sweet spot in CPU performance/cost/power consumption
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2016
Reviews: Fast.  Fast.  Fast.  I didn't want to overclock and didn't see the need for hyper-threading so this I5-6500 seemed to be the best there is for the money.  (The I5-6600 is perhaps 3% faster but the $20 increase in cost isn't worth it IMO).  Anyway, this processor has scorching speed at very low power usage.  I ran a benchmark and it placed this processor in the 94th percentile which is super considering that most of the comparables were from gamers benchmarking their gaming rigs.  I am using the Intel supplied heat sink and fan and it doesn't seem to need anything more. This is truly the sweet spot for CPU performance/cost/power consumption.  I am betting that this processor will last me for the next 5 to 7 years.  Sorry Intel.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2016
Reviews: I decided to build a computer (Austin Evans' Positron 2.0) and unfortunately my graphics card came bent! I was still able to complete the build and load an OS and load Steam and other things. I decided to start downloading games from my library because my internet is slow and had nothing else to do. As a test I started TF2 and to my surprise the game got maxed out at 1080p at 85 FPS! Not that Team Fortress is much of a benchmark, source being the godly engine that it is, but it blew me away. I got this processor because it was good bang for buck and didn't expect much of it but I am more than happy with my purchase. CSGO is also handled nicely to hold me over until my r9 390 comes in the mail.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsIntel Has Never Let Me Down
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2016
Reviews: Not the fastest processor out there, but plenty fast for basic gaming, photo editing, and tons of less intensive applications.  Buying a processor, just like most computer hardware, is about getting the most performance for the money.  As of late 2015 and early 2016, this processor provides about the most bang for the buck of any out there.  It does come with a stock heat sink, but I opted for a 3rd party solution.  Packaging was typically excellent, and installation was a snap.  I have chosen not to overclock it since I don't have time to mess around with my computers as much any more.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache

Reviews: This is an all around great CPU I bought this two years ago now and have not run into any issues I'm also using stock fan since this is not a k and not overclackable  this is a good investment if you're looking for a reliable midrange cpu, but with pics like the new ryzen line up it's kinda outdated for the price right now if you're going for highest clock speeds and number of cores

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIntel takes the lead with their new Skylakes!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2015
Reviews: I purchased this processor for my first noob gaming rig.After about a week of use, I can say that my previous 10 years of using laptops were useless compared to a desktop processor.I have used laptops with every generation of Intel including the skylake 6300, and I am just blown away with this processor.My Build:THIS processorDDR4 2x4GBDDR4 Gigabyte MBR9 280xAll the parts I am using are stock, most specifically the fan. Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2016
Reviews: I love this processor. It came with a stock heatsink and fan as well as cpu compound. Packaging was clean and easy to open. Now as far as functionality , I have to say my computer is very snappy. I do not play games but I do surf the web and send large files to my friends. I do music editing and this processor made all the difference in the world. i considered buying the 6600k but for the money I saved, it was well worth the purchase. I will update in the future about any issues or non issues I have.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat CPU for gaming
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2017
Reviews: Great CPU for gaming! Can handle the loads very well but if you plan on streaming and gaming at the same time I would recommend getting an i7! I can stream and game with some games just fine but when it comes to certain games that hog CPU power like Overwatch you would want to go for the i7 hands down!

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Product, Highly Recommend!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2017
Reviews: I have an i5 / 3570K in another gaming PC and was just going to get the 4760K version since it can be overclocked too.  BUT...I realized the 3570K I only overclocked it one (it was really snappy) but most of the time it was at the stock Hz.  I decided to save the cash and opt for the i5 / 6500 instead and I'm happy I did.  This one is snappy enough and edit video, music, etc.  It gets the job done.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2016
Reviews: Ok I was a little surprised by this CPU. I had to use integrated graphics for a little while and it performed really well. Aside from the great processing power, I mostly want to talk about the integrated graphics. If you are trying to play League of Legends (70 fps max graphics) or CSGO (playable fps) then this works just fine. I was even able to play Fallout 4 on low graphics, which still was awesome since that game is so demanding for graphics processing power. Best bang for your buck overall.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019
Reviews: Installed the processor in a Shuttle XH170V which uses a mini-ITX form factor and the intel H170 chipset.  The processor is cooled using just a heat sink since there is no room for a fan.  I ran a burn-in test for 24 hours without any errors.  The processor temperature never got above 60c.  Very pleased with the purchase.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPerfect for Small Systems
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2016
Reviews: This skylake part is one of the best bang for the buck processor around. The lower power consumption makes this perfect for a small system where airflow is limited. I used this in fractal design's node 304 and with Noctua's L12 cpu cooler. Under full stress, the cpu stayed around 60C.In normal daily use with an SSD installed, windows is perfectly smooth. In terms of gaming performance (I tested using a 980ti), unless the game is intensely reliant on cpu (civilization, wow etc), this processor is only 3-5 frames behind stock 6700k.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2016
Reviews: Can't compare this to other newer processors, but WOW, what a difference compared to my old Intel dual core E5200. Running on a Gigabyte Z170 board with 16gigs of cheap ram, this cpu almost makes me tear up with happy feelings. It may not be the fastest, but it works fine for me with just the stock cooler. I can run games on high settings, even with my old HD6850 video card. Price vs performance (atm), I couldn't think of a better value if you're looking to upgrade. Esp. from an older system like mine.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat product for all needs.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2017
Reviews: This cpu is awesome, I use this for my gaming setup and while it's not the best in the market, for it's price point this purchase was the best for me.This product works flawlessly, it's very fast and realiable, I game with this and it seems to work fine even under the stress of the newest games at 4k, It's never failed my gaming or general browsing needs. If you're on a budget and need a good cpu, I recommend this one.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsWorked great but it wasn't able to run Forza Horizan 3 ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2017
Reviews: Worked great but it wasn't able to runForza Horizan 3 on my pc with stuttering ran most games in 60-70 % usage. These days clock speeds need to be higher than this. I'd say get 6600k / 7700k at minimum its a big difference due to overclocking or get any Ryzen

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2016
Reviews: My mind is blown. Bought this cpu for gaming (Arma 3, Squad) and couldn't be happier. My old CPU was an AMD, struggled to run these games at 30fps, and I could hear the fan on the other side of my room. I can't hear this thing sitting a foot away from it and my fps has shot up to a steady near 60 for Arma and 80+ for Squad. Beautiful. If you're thinking of switching from AMD and on a budget, this is the way to go.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsComes with a fan
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2018
Reviews: It comes with a fan; don't be fooled into buying a fan you don't need like I did!  Lightly loaded with that stock fan, the CPU temp runs a nice, cool 30C.If you need to run Windows 7, you need a Series 6 CPU.  I paired this with a GIGABYTE GA-Z270X-Ultra Gaming board.Very happy with my purchases.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsVery Fast and Budget Friendly
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2015
Reviews: Massive upgrade for me from a core 2 duo. Handles Fallout 4 with ease keeping me above 50 fps using a 4GB R7 370 overclocked. I was surprised to see how small the heat sink and fan is, I'm sure it does the job but I have an aftermarket and wont be using it anyways. The CPU box was factory sealed and exactly as advertised. I cant believe how cool this chip stays, I'm sure there is tons of room to overclock but I don't really need to.Excellent value!

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Budget Gaming Chip
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2016
Reviews: I see why this processor is rated as one of the best bang for the buck gaming chips.  It's an outstanding performer for your budge gamer.  I run mine with a Corsair water cooler.  I overclock it just slightly to 3.5 Ghz.  I did a CPU burn load test and loaded all 4 cores to 100% for 15 minutes and the CPU held up just fine never going above 38 C.  It's been running smoothly now for over 7 months.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2020
Reviews: I paired this with an intel 7600p m2 ssd for my boot drive and 16gb of 3000Mhz ram.  This PC is super fast!  I cannot tell a difference from the i5 versus my 9700k i7 in the majority of computing tasks.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsFirst intel processor since Core Duo back in 2007.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2015
Reviews: First off-  this processor kicks ass and handles everything well.  Performs way more stable when doing normal tasks unlike AMD, which I used in my last build.  Gaming is fluid with my gtx 960, and is well worth the money.  Never buying any processor not made by intel again.EDIT: I overlocked it to 4 ghz using the MSI Z170 M3 motherboard. On 1.2v runs games stable, and fast.  Get 70 FPS with my GTX 960 on ultra settings on overwatch.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsRuns strong, No Issues on my MicroAtx Board
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2017
Reviews: It runs just about anything a throw at it paired with a GTX 1080 Reference card, and 16gb of 2400MHz ram. i have not seen any issues with it and am almost glad i had to return the 7400 that i had to replace with this.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2017
Reviews: I've never been much of one for trying to overclock my processors, so I opted to go with the locked version of this i5. It doesn't disappoint, and paired with an SSD, 16GB of RAM ,and a GTX 1060 it handles everything I throw at it without breaking a sweat. I use it primarily for playing games (Fallout 4, Witcher 3, etc.), but it also does very well with VM's and compiling code.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2016
Reviews: I received a defective processor. However, to be fair, this is the only defective product I have ever encountered with my experience with Intel. Performs really well for the money. If you're willing to spend a bit more, I recommend the 6700K instead. But this is no doubt a good processor.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsthis is my 1st time doing a build with an ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2016
Reviews: this is my 1st time doing a build with an i5. it was for a gaming pc. runs much cooler than an i7, resulting in a very quiet pc. handles every game i throw at at. i'm using 8g of ram (4g stick x2). i say this is the ideal cpu for gaming pc's. also i am not overclocking, & really don't feel the need to. i play mainly mmos. u can't go wrong with this cpu.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat performance with no issues.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2017
Reviews: I have had this cpu for three months now and have now issued. It is used for gaming and coding and performs flawlessly. Of course I plan to get an i7 eventually but this will do. If over clocking , try to get a K series chip because bios updates have lock out over clocking for all non k chips.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBang for the buck is pretty much as good as it gets with this model
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2016
Reviews: Bang for the buck is pretty much as good as it gets with this model.  Not much more to say that hasn't already been said.  It's fast, runs cool, and is well-priced.  My only regret is not springing for an even faster model given the video processing I need to do, but for everything else it screams.  (Primary use for the system is post-processing photos in Lightroom.)

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat cpu for budget gaming/school rig
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2016
Reviews: Used this cpu to build my girlfriend a desktop for school use and some gaming. Paired with 8gb ram, a 250gb Samsung evo 850 and this pc is great. The iGPU (Intel Integrated Graphics 530) are really amazing, even without a dedicated gpu she can play some high end games at low settings and can play games like league and WoW with ease and high settings.Great cpu, runs cool, low power, cant complain.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest bang for your buck.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2017
Reviews: Awesome CPU for the price. Comes with a stock fan. Amazingly power. If you are looking to overclock, look at the model that ends in a K. Running with a GTX 1060, 16Gb Ram. I can play Overwatch, World of Warcraft and Witcher 3 all on the highest settings no problem. This processor falls into the "sweet spot" for power / cost.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsWorked just fine for gaming (I upgraded to the I7-8700K) and a ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2018
Reviews: Decent CPU, I paired it with a Asus Z170-K motherboard. Worked just fine for gaming (I upgraded to the I7-8700K) and a buddy has it in his system now

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starssuper great cpu and easy install.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2015
Reviews: .1ghz slower and $30 cheaper than i5 6600. so i bought this one, and it is great! i have a h170 motherboard, and i love this cpu. my pc is great, everything is fast and snappy. the install could not have been simpler. Anyone could install this cpu and its heatsink and fan. to install the heatsink all you do is push the pins in place and they snap and omg i was already done.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGood choice for non-gamers
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2016
Reviews: This is a CPU that should meet the needs of most home and business users with power to spare.  If you are intending to use your PC for gaming purposes, spend a few extra bucks and get the i5 6600K, which can be overclocked.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2016
Reviews: I've heard good things about this processor.  I just finished building a computer around it yesterday and after I got everything fired up and running it appears to be running great.  It wasn't immediately clear to me when I purchased it, but the CPU does come with a basic heat sink.  Very easy to install as long as you're careful.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis CPU is doing a wonderful job at handling everything at once
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2017
Reviews: I bought a mini ITX motherboard for a NAS build. I needed enough CPU power to handle multiple stream transcoding, file management, server duties, etc ... This CPU is doing a wonderful job at handling everything at once. It is being cooled with a closed loop liquid cooling block. Can't go wrong with an Intel i5 Skylake!

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat processor for the money!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2016
Reviews: Easy to install, works out great in my gaming rig.  I even used the fan and thermal paste it came with, no issues on that end.  I am able to do all my regular computing, play modern games, multitask, etc.  A really nice processor for a budget build.  I would recommend this to anyone looking to build a nice mid-range gaming PC

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsCame with a cooler
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2017
Reviews: I got  this OEM i5 6500 that was supposed not to have a cpu cooler, but when it came it had a cooler, that was so strange, but whatever. Bought it for 192$ in black Friday. Works great  for games like battlefield 1, rise of the tomb raider and other AAA games paired with my RX480

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsAwesome cpu, one of the best value per dollar
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2016
Reviews: Awesome cpu, one of the best value per dollar. Fast as anything. Don't have my gpu here yet and the integrated graphics works good. Am able to play games with the settings on low and medium. could play simple games on high.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat processor for gaming!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2016
Reviews: I upgraded to this processor from a Pentium 2127U, and since then I've never looked back. This thing is really fast and runs any application or game (GTA V for instance) with ease. It's non-overclock but the cooler that comes with it is fine, no need for an after-market cooler. Probably the best processor for $200 or less on the market. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSweet Spot for Performance & Budget.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2016
Reviews: Intel's Skylake Processors are impressive! I upgraded from an AMD FX-8350 and the performance gain is impressive. I paired this CPU with 8GB of G. SKILL Ripjaws 8GB DDR4 & a Gigabyte Windforce GTX 970 and the performance is lovely, DOOM runs like a dream and never dips below 60FPS. For cooling I'm using the Corsair H60 and idle temps are around 26 Celsius, nice and cool.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsEverything works as it should be.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2019
Reviews: Great product just wished it had been shipped with the old thermal paste washed off or cleaned.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsEnough Speed for any Application.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2017
Reviews: I always buy Intel and this one didn't disappoint me.  Fast, quiet,  very low heat.  Only 65 watts.  I don't play games so I'm completely satisfied with the video performance. Business apps and programming just fly.  Yes, I recommend it.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2017
Reviews: been this using this with the stock cooler for 2 1/2 years and it's been bulletproof. it's consistently clocking ~3.5ghz and the idle temps fluctuate between 27 and 31 degrees. i want to upgrade my build but i have no reason to as this CPU is still performing exceptionally well

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsMore than decent cpu for the money. if you ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2017
Reviews: More than decent cpu for the money. if you have 50$ to spare in your budget go for the 6600k, its the same with hyperthreading and the option of the overclock

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2016
Reviews: Runs like a dream. Considering i had to reseat it twice due to complications with the heatsink, its surprisingly durable. Have yet to come across anything it cant get done within seconds- including downloading fulls games in about 5-10 minutes (where my old pc would take the better part of an hour)

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSkeptic of used but glad I tried it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
Reviews: Was exactly what it was supposed to be wiped the old thermal paste off and installed with no issues running like it should very pleased

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsI mean honestly do you need a review of an ...
