Reviews: I mean honestly do you need a review of an intel processor? there's nothing special about this one relative to any other intel processor. shrug. intel has their game down.edit: no update about the processor, but I'd like to contest my multi-year-old claim that reviews about intel processors are silly in principle.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsI love the speed and the temps this performs at
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2016
Reviews: I love the speed and the temps this performs at, for like another $50 dollars you can get the K model but from myself switching over from a dual core i3 Haswell this is so good

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2016
Reviews: Fast and quiet. I have built many PCs over the years, and this processor does exactly what it is supposed to do. It does come with a cooling fan, and it is very quiet. I am very pleased.The computer I built is a HTPC, and I have found this processor to be more than adequate.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsPretty solid CPU for the price
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2018
Reviews: Pretty solid CPU for the price, no multi-threading of coarse so would bottleneck the 1070 and 1080 in CPU intensive situations.

Product Title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2016
Reviews: Excellent chip!  All of the Skylake chips are now overclockable.  It's no longer just the K versions of the chips.  I overclocked this chip to 4.51GHz on liquid cooling.  It's running stable and handles any game I throw at it!  Also running a Titan X for video..

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2017
Reviews: This, along with the rest of my build, performs admirably when running games at 1080p 60+FPS:Case: Thermaltake Core v21Motherboard: GigaByte GA-B150M-D3HProcessor: Intel i5 6600 @ 3.30GHzRAM: 16GB HyperX FuryGraphics: 8GB Gigabtye GTX 1070Storage:- 256GB Toshiba SSD- 2TB Toshiba HDD- 1TB Hitachi Touro S USB HDDCooling:- Cooler Master Hyper 212EVO- Corsair Air Series Blue LED Fan x2- Corsair Air Series Purple LED Fan x2Power Supply: EVGA 550 G2

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsFlawless performance of the i5 series with the power savings of newer tech.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2016
Reviews: I don't overclock so opted for the non "K" i5 but the highest tier of it. The build in Turbo boost can self overclock the CPU up to 3.9 Ghz and the EIST technology can under clock it to .8 Ghz when idling or at desktop to save power. Flawlessly flows between the two to meet the realtime current demand. Love this processor as I updated from an i5-2500k and it outperforms it on stock speeds while running at 2/3 the power consumption of the 2500k. 100% satisfied for the needs of my build.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent product as expected from Intel. Love the max 64GB RAM capability.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2016
Reviews: Extremely fast. Installed it on an ASUS Gaming Pro H170 mobo, 16GB of DDR4, and a 250GB SSD drive.This processor, combined with the SSD drive, boots Windows 10 in under 10 seconds, not counting the initial boot screen from the Mobo bios.The heatsink it comes with will be sufficient as long as you don't game heavy or do lots of graphics. I installed a CoolerMaster Hyper212 just in case, but no more than I use my computer, the CPU rarely goes above 27C.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat Cpu, not so great cooler.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2016
Reviews: Very powerful for the price you pay, my only complaint is the cpu cooler is very low end, and if your going to be doing any editing on this, you will need to pick up an after market cpu cooler. but besides that, I love it!

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsA nice but basic CPU
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2019
Reviews: If you are a gamer or do/ will like to tinker with PCs, you should probably go with a K model. After about two years of use the CPU actually died and I was perplexed because CPU failure is very rare. Other than that though it held up extremely well for games including CPU intensive ones.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsWe'll see how this holds up. I won the ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2017
Reviews: We'll see how this holds up. I won the lottery with a Pentium D still going strong after 12 years of heavy daily use. If this doesn't last 5-10 years before slowing down with less demanding taks, I will never trust intel again.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLovin' it so far!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2016
Reviews: It's not an i7, but I'm running Arma III on ultra with maxed settings and this CPU is maxing around 55-60% utilization on the high end. My graphics card is the only limiting factor according to my monitoring software.If you're not ready to drop a load on an i7 this will surely handle almost if not everything that's out there right now. Multi-application performance is excellent, as well. No heating issues as of yet, not expecting to have any.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGAMER: Intel i5 vs i7
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2016
Reviews: I find the i5 a Best-Value.Even the bench marks show that the i7 is only marginally faster than the i5 for gaming. If you have a very good graphics card, plenty of RAM (I have 16GB)  and your OS and games on an SSD, the i5 is all you need. I run fallout 4, witcher 3m and other similarly taxing games with no perceptible difference than a system that had an i7.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIntel Core I5-6600 It's a good Processor if you dont plan or not know how to overclock.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2016
Reviews: So far so good , the Intel Core i5-6600 has been performing perfectly since i have received the product. This is the first time i have brought an Intel processor and it runs more smoother than my past 8 core AMD FX-8350. I did some tests and still no BSOD. I highly recommend this processor if you are a gamer or you run a lot of multi task on you computer. and for the price you get a high performance processor.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat bang for the buck processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2016
Reviews: Great bang for the buck processor.  Intel could do a little better with the packaging, though - there was a strand of cardboard stuck in the thermal paste.  Luckily, it came out cleanly and didn't affect the cooling capability.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsZen is supposedly a massive leap for modern AMD chips and will likely be a better price point for a minor performance decrease i
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2016
Reviews: It's an i5, not much else to say about the quality (Which is superb, as always with Intel processors outside of the horrid stock heat sinks). However, with AMD Zen Architecture coming out later in 2016, you may want to hold off on an upgrade. Zen is supposedly a massive leap for modern AMD chips and will likely be a better price point for a minor performance decrease if their promises are revealed to be reality.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600

I would say it runs like one except it says i5 on the box. Make sure to get the K version if you want to overclock, but you need your own cooling system for those.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6600 FC-LGA14C 3.30 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56600
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2016

I dare you to check your framerate before and after an overclock and find that there is barely a difference.That said, this CPU represents a great performance point with a low TDP and with much less cost than the next step up. Reduce heat and power consumption with no noticeable penalty in games by picking this CPU.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-10400 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.3 GHz LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 65W, Model Number: BX8070110400
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsSolid budget CPU with on board graphics when on sale.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2022
Reviews: I bought two of these, one for a budget office build for myself and a gaming build for my son. I paired his with a GTX 1660 super and it performs pretty well, not as good as a 12400 or Ryzen 5 3600 or 5600x, but very close. Only downside going with a 10th gen instead of 11 or newer is the lack of PCIe and m.2 gen 4 support, although neither PC needs those features as neither will saturate the bandwidth of gen 3 fully. The integrated graphics will run some light games (among us, CSGO, etc. ) At lowered settings. The included cooler is as bad as it's always been, it works, loud and temps aren't great, but it works. I would Suggest finding a better solution (I went vetroo V5). Buy this CPU if it's on sale for $140 or less, otherwise go 11th gen or Ryzen.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-10400 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.3 GHz LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 65W, Model Number: BX8070110400
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsNot a bad CPU.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020
Reviews: This CPU is definitely an upgrade from the quad core i7-4770 (non-K) that I previously had! Glad to see the i5 now has hyperthreading, thanks to AMD. But, I may have gotten the worst performing 10400, as my Cinebench R20 and R15 scores are noticeably lower than the benchmarks you'd see online (both single core and multi core and I've got all my drivers/bios installed and up to date). Regardless, I'm very happy with this purchase as this CPU is no slouch. Currently have it paired with an Asus Prime B460-Plus and a Zotac GTX 1070. Be aware that there's two versions of the i5-10400. One has G1 stepping (pure 6 core chip and no STIM) and the other has Q0 stepping (10 core chip with 4 cores disabled, uses the newer thermal interface and shares the similar heat spreader from the higher-end unlocked SKUs). Though, the two should perform very similarly.Update 9/9/20: Went to the previous generation platform and currently using an i9-9900K. 10th generation ain't too bad, but it's best to wait on 11th generation Rocket Lake. It's rumored to use a 14nm backport of WIllow Cove... or just wait on Zen 3. For now, I'm waiting to upgrade my 1070 to the new RTX 3080 when it becomes available at my local Best Buy.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-10400 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.3 GHz LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 65W, Model Number: BX8070110400
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat processor at good price point
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2020
Reviews: Choosing a processor is all about economics. With so many processor choices on the market, the trick is finding a balance between price and power. For me, the 10400 was the perfect balance. A lot of reviews are recommending the AMD Ryzen processors, but it seems most of these reviews are geared to gamers. Unfortunately, the latest Ryzen processors do not include graphics processing on board, and the reviews ignore this point because gamers always include a graphics card in their builds. Well I am not a gamer, and don't need to waste money on a graphics board. So the fact that the 10400 comes with onboard graphics was a selling point for me. I play WoW, and have no problems playing with the integrated UHD chipset. With 6 cores and hyperthreading, this processor is like buying a previous-generation i7. I can run multiple virtual machines on my desktop with no slowdown whatsoever. Nor do I want to overclock, since reliability is more important to me than squeezing a few more clock cycles. I think this hits the perfect balance between power and affordability.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsTerrific midrange CPU for everyday use!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2017
Reviews: Just built a new system and I wanted to make sure I had the latest generation CPU available.  Coming from a 7 yr old AMD Athlon II system, this CPU is a substantial upgrade.  I have detailed the complete listing of parts used below.  I use my desktop for Audio Production (multitrack recording/mixing/mastering) so quad cores are important.  I researched all the latest CPUs (AMD and Intel) and for the money, the Intel kept coming out ahead in terms of benchmarking. I was holding out for AMD's Ryzen CPUs but ultimately I decided it was time to move to the standard in processors.  I read there are still a few bugs to work out on the new AMDs and I will keep an eye out in the next couple of years as to how they compare to Intel's offerings.  I don't have allegiance either way but I just want performance without having to overclock and install pricey water cooling systems. I also do a bit of video editing/conversion and I can tell you this CPU is very fast.  With the MSI board and Samsung M.2 SSD, this system boots up in 20 secs.  I would be faster if I turned on the Fast Boot feature on the mobo but it's not that big of a deal.  When converting a MKV to MP4 (480i) in Handbrake ("23" setting using the "Slow" encoding speed), I went from an average of 30 fps to over 130 fps.  I know it's not fair to compare a 7 yr old AMD quad to this new one but just illustrating how much of a boost in performance you can get.  I would recommend using the Cooler Master T4 instead of the stock cooler.  I'm not a fan of the cheap coolers as they tend to get noisy the harder you drive the CPU.  With the T4 installed and running Prime95, the CPU never got over 54 degrees C.  The cooler fan never went over 900 rpm so it was very quiet.  You need to make sure you have a big enough case to handle the T4 but your ears and CPU will thank you.As others have mentioned out there, you MUST have Windows 10 and a compatible motherboard with the Kaby Lake CPUs!  The MSI board immediately recognized this processor right from the start.  Also, the Kaby Lake processors recognize the DDR4 2400 memory natively so make sure to purchase the right speed.  Get every little bit of performance you can!Cheers!Windows 10 Home 64 bitMSI Gaming Intel B250 MORTAR LGA 1151 mATX MotherboardIntel i5-7500 CPU 3.4GHzSamsung 850 EVO 250GB M.2 SATA III Internal SSDSeagate 2TB BarraCuda SATA 6Gb/s 64MB Cache 3.5-Inch(2) Ballistix Sport 8GB Single DDR4 2400ASUS Blu-Ray Writer BW-16D1HTANEWKODI USB WiFi Adapter AC600MbpsThermaltake Versa H21 Mid-tower CaseEVGA 500 W1, 80+ WHITE 500W Power SupplyCooler Master Hyper T4 CPU CoolerArctic Silver Ceramique Thermal Compound***Update 2/4/2018*** - After almost a year later, this system still rocks!  Very pleased with the performance and have no regrets.  For those who mess around with DAWs, I can tell you this CPU can handle a TON of plugins!  I use Reaper 5 (64-bit) and using a mix of Waves, Steven Slate and other free plugins, this CPU doesn't flinch when you have over 40 plugins running at the same time.  My poor AMD Athlon II X4 would start to struggle once I hit the 40+ mark on plugins.  Some of the Waves and Slate plugins do need more processing power but so far, this CPU has handled everything I've thrown at it.  The only limitation I could see is if you run some high end samplers.  I do run Superior Drummer 3 connected to my V-drums and I would say the sampler is more of a drain on my memory but it does steal some cycles on the CPU.  I still wholeheartedly recommend this CPU for everyday use along with video/audio production work.  Again make sure to pair it with a large heatsink like the T4.  In the right case, you don't even hear the fan running once you start hitting the CPU harder.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat all around CPU
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2017
Reviews: Rebuilt the in-laws computer with this. Upgrading from a build made years ago using the A4-3300, 8GB DDR3 1600mhz ram and a 2.5 inch HDD I had laying around. Suffice it to say their old system was SLOW. The use it for really basic stuff, basically email and internet, but I wanted to make something snappy enough for them to last many years and that would age well.I chose to build using:-Intel i5 7500-MSI B250M PRO-VDH-Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB (8GB x2) 3200mhz DDR4 RAM-Samsung 960 EVO 250GB SSDI reused their 430 watt Antec PSU, Rosewill mATX case, an LG sata DVD drive and a card reader.The install was quick and easy. Everything worked without a hitch from first boot to upgrading BIOS to installing Win 10 Pro and copying their data over and running updates. I doubt they will even come close to pegging this CPU but wanted to give them room to grow and figured the breathing room this would give over a dual core (even with hyper-threading) would be worth it long term.My only complaints, and not worth taking stars off for are the following:-The stock coolers mounting uses some cheap plastic push pins to mount. While it appears to do the job I cant say I am confident in how much pressure it can apply to push the cooler to the CPU surface or how well it can stay in place. For now it appears to keep the tempuratures in check but I havent pushed the CPU.-Out of the retail box the bottom of the cooler has thermal paste pre-applied but is not covered by plastic or anything so in the course of packing and shipping there are tiny fibers of what I assume is cardboard or dust all along the contact surface and on the paste. Having used high end coolers for my own builds and seeing those having covered surfaces that are polished to a shine without foreign elements on the surface this was a little unnerving. Doesnt seem to have had any negative effect afaik but for $200 itd have been nice if they could have attempted to protect the surface with $.05 of plastic.In ending I would recommend this as a decent all around processor for every day use, multimedia, office work and maybe even in a relatively budget gaming build (however for ~$30 more you can get an unlocked i5 7600k and overclock it to squeeze out more performance).

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsEverything was in the box as promised.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
Reviews: Everything was in the box as promised.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsGood for New builds of mid-low tier pc, not good for upgrading processor. Go I7 or AMD.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2018
Reviews: I recently purchased this CPU to replace my i3-7100 which runs at 3.88 GHz.The installation process was easy and this comes with a stock cooler, but I did have some cons about the item. I ended up returning it and just buying the I7-7700K and purchasing a cooler off of newegg since the Kaby Lakes do not come with a coolerThe item (I5-7500) made running multiple programs at once easier as I like to stream not only on twitch but to my friends when we are on discord (via Screen Sharing). The downfall was that I did not experience better frames nor did my computer run any faster. These games included Battlefield 4, Fortnite, My time in Portia, and Player UnknownBatteground (or PUBG for short). When I tested my systems overall performance with NovaBench.exe which in my opinion is a great alternative to a 3 hour stress test, the results shocked me. My systems overall score with the I3 was 1658 and with the I5 it was 1593. The CPU score was lower as well with the I5 as well as all other components (GPU, RAM, and Memory). Even after flashing my bios with new drivers for my MOBO and reinstalling windows the results were the same.I recommend this processor only if you are planning on upgrading from a lower generation processor or if you want to newly build a mid-low end gaming pc for a first build since it is a great price. But if you are looking for bang, I would recommend AMD or just simply investing more money for an I7 so you won't end up having to drop more money in the next couple years to upgrade again. Overall, was an okay experience but I did return it 2 days after installation since the results I got were disappointing. Not a bad processor, not a good one either.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsIt's fine, not great. Let's not reward Intel for making absolutely no progress at all.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2017
Reviews: Now, my 3 stars isn't because this product is in any way bad. As Amazon suggests, "it's OK". This doesn't set the world on fire. It runs things smoothly, period. Some hitches here and there when the CPU seems to be thinking twice about what it's about to do, otherwise fine. Fine, is not OMG AMAZING 5 STARS. It's just that, fine. The 3 stars are because this product, is a joke. IT's the exact same performance as the previous generation, and nobody should give Intel a pass on this behavior. Now that AMD is competing with Ryzen, 8th gen is adding cores. Look at that, suddenly Intel is doing something, anything. That, however, did not happen with Kaby lake, literally 0% performance gains, and for that, you get 3 stars - a mere fine.Not only that - I sold my GPU and spent about 2 weeks with integrated CPU graphics (Intel HD 630) until I bought a GTX1060. I use a 4K screen, which was well supported at 4K30. However, lowering the resolution to 1440p, it was IMPOSSIBLE to get it working at 60fps. Mind you, this CPU is sold and advertised as supporting HDMI1.4 spec, which covers up to 1440p60. No way to get it working. These 2 weeks were spent chatting with Intel support to figure this out, and while they at least made efforts to solve it, nothing (everything else in this build has been used with previous GPUs/monitors up to 4K60, so the rest of the hardware was fine, this was clearly the HD 630's fault). This is a big, big problem, whether it's due to driver support or otherwise, I do not know, but it's certainly unacceptable and nothing that will earn this product an amazing review. It's fine. It did its job, kind of, except when it failed to deliver.I bought this CPU because I had already purchased DDR4 for my new build this past spring, and Ryzen's growing pains with memory support prevented me from using the memory on their motherboards. I didn't want to wait until support came along, so I made an Intel build. In a couple years, we'll see who gets my money: either Intel gets back into the game and innovates some, or I'll make sure I buy AMD the next round.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2017
Reviews: It works. It stays cool. Huge upgrade from my previous AMD FX-6300 (duh). I probably should have gotten the "K" series to be overclockable, but I was on a budget and forced myself not to spend the extra $30. Would have been worth it. I didn't use the OE fan cooler. I put an NZXT Kraken X42 on it. Keeps it around 28C at idle and under 60C while gaming. It's easy to say it's the best processor I've used as it's the newest and has the best technology of any I've used. For the money I feel it was a good purchase.The new Kaby Lake architecture does require Windows10, and I was a little worried as I was still using Windows7. After loading it and starting to use it I actually like Windows10. You do need to disable all of the apps, automatic notifications, and the Cortina thing, but in general it can be configured to look and feel exactly like the Windows7 you're used to. Don't shy away from this process for fear of having to upgrade your operating system.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsCan power VR with ease.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2017
Reviews: I bought this CPU, along with a GTX 1080 FE, to power a dedicated mobile VR platform that I can take to peoples houses for parties, etc.  Not commercial grade, but just for letting friends play with VR for a few days.  I mounted these in a Micro ATX case with a handle for ease of mobility.Since space was at a premium, I was also concerned with cooling solutions.  I decided to go with air cooling for everything (less weight, less complexity) and that was the deciding factor on choosing an I5 over an I7, and I don't regret it.So far the combo of this I5 with a standard GTX 1080 FE has performed perfectly.  Many hours of playing VR games, even outdoors, and it doesn't have heat issues.  There's no issues with VR games though now with Fallout 4 VR, I feel I'd like to kick it up to a 1080 TI.Overall, this processor has exceeded my expectations.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsA year later and...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2018
Reviews: It's been a year since I built my rig and I bought this processor not knowing much about it and when I finally got it I thought it wasn't going to perform as good as I needed it but I was wrong, it performs well enough for me to be able to play any AAA game I throw at it with alongside with the 1070 it BUT is not until I get to streaming, gaming and having other programs open that the processor starts to ask for help, I have an evga 120 egva closed loop cpu cooler that keeps it from burning.It can get tricky with obs all you have to do is set the encoder to use less processing power but it'll come at a quality of picture cost or use your graphics card encoder instead to run the stream but that will also come with a frame rate cost.If you don't stream and only play then don't need to look further but if you want more power for a little extra then go with the i5 6600k

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsits a good cpu for mid tier gaming builds and people that don't want to overclock.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2017
Reviews: it's a solid CPU for my 1st build you don't have to deal with overclocking its hard to crash it, I tried to load like 40 youtube videos at once "playing" before I give up which it was at ~40% load.  comes with a stock cooler and pre-applied thermal paste depending on your motherboard you may need to install the fan upside down because the fan can be way too close to the wire even with zip tiescinebench r15 scores between 600-620  paired a Rx 480 it can run most game in high to ultra and even some less demanding games at 4k 60plus fps I'm enjoying this build it could run a gpu similar to the 1070 without too much bottlenecks  I don't have that many games to test right now ,but it plays well-optimized games like warframe and doom 1080p on its highest setting 120-140 plus fps.  I played doom at ~ 2560x1560  something similar to on my dad's monitor it plays around 100fps on highest preset.  I'll update this when I can get more games or programs to test.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAvoid mistakes, get your motherboard ready (If it's an older one)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2018
Reviews: Works exactly as advertised, word of warning though, so you won't make the same mistake as I did.This is a 7th gen processor, if you have and older motherboard like I do and try to upgrade make sure you have the right BIOS update, or you'll end up thinking you wrecked your board and freak out. It wasn't until I went back to basics and remounted my old CPU that I figured this out . After looking for the right software and setting everything up, THEN it started working . Otherwise, great product.(It also goes without saying to not buy a pre 7th gen motherboard. There's no guarantee it'll have the update)On a side note, if you're debating between this and an i7 and its just a matter of a slightly higher budget go for that one, especially since you can't overclock this. It may not make a difference immediately, but it will eventually. It's one of those things were you start to feel the regret a year or two down the line...

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis is a awesome processor for the money
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2017
Reviews: This is a awesome processor for the money. I highly recommend it. I render 1hour long videos for my YouTube channel in 1 hour and 20 mins where as it use to take me 8 hours on my 3 year old laptop.  Pushing out 5 videos a day now!!!WarningIf you are going to use this in conjunction with a Asus motherboard make sure it is a z-270 motherboard as the earlier models have to have a bios update that can not be done unless you already have a 6th gen Intel processor.  I wish I new this beforehand because this delayed my build and was very inconvenient. This CPU will work with the z-270 boards out of the box.I ran into an issue with the Asus motherboard. I was not getting a video signal. Took my computer to a shop and turns out the Asus motherboard had a pin that was  bent causing me to get a No Signal message on my tv. Be aware of this also with Asus motherboards.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars... for my second PC build and I am very pleased. The CPU and CPU cooler come in the ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2018
Reviews: I bought this CPU for my second PC build and I am very pleased. The CPU and CPU cooler come in the nice little Intel box.The CPU itself has a triangle on it for you to match up with the CPU array on the motherboard for installation. The stock CPU cooler does seem flimsy at first but it makes much more sense and is sturdy once it rotates then snaps into holes of the motherboard. This fan is really loud if noise bothers you or you want close to silence I recommend getting an aftermarket fan. Again, for a quick build or factory build its hard to beat what's designed for and already has thermal paste.At idle the temperature is usually 29-32 degrees Celsius. This CPU easily handles CS GO in highest settings up to 240 fps, League of Legends in high settings, and Fortnite on high stays at 60 FPS paired with the 1050 Ti.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsWorks very well.. takes some mechanical know how.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2021
Reviews: Pretty easy to install new computer core chip.  About 10 min. Job.  Always carefully look at your old CPU s position and markings, dots, notches and match up new CPU position same before plopping it in.  Be methodical and take care.. Immediately worked fine.  Must always get same wattage rating as old CPU being upgraded... (unless planning on new power supply motherboard and all).  Did for minor improvement cause sometime process videos into an mp4/mkv format from many other types vids.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2017
Reviews: I was checking the new AMD offerings with Ryzen while considering a switch, but after some research It became obvious that I still got great performance per dollar with this CPU. A switch would be a waste of time and money. In some corner cases I could have saved at most $20 with Ryzen, money better spent on a cheapo keyboard and mouse combo I guess. After  few months I can say that this CPU gives zero problems, no issues, no throttling. Good performance and features on a mature and optimized platform that works well even with demanding games if that's what you care about.  Even the HD 630 iGPU is able to play games like Mafia II and Bioshock, I didn't expect that. Paired with a dedicated GPU there's nothing to worry about with this CPU whatsoever.  Overall this is a vey good CPU, even if you objectively compare it with  Ryzen.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat processor, some issues with Windows 7, wish Amazon would list "what's in the box"
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2017
Reviews: This is a great processor and if you review cost / speed performance, this one is high on the list.  Be aware, that Microsoft has dropped support for 7th generation processors running anything below Windows 10.  So if your not on Windows 10 you will start getting a message about this processor not being supported every time Windows update runs, and the system can't install security updates.  I got around the message by turning automatic updates off, otherwise it continually pops up.  Haven't found a work around for the security updates yet, which is a bit concerning.  I have an older work related application, that isn't Windows 10 supported.  Just wish Microsoft would understand not everyone can upgrade to the latest operating system.  Also Amazon needs to start listing "what's in the box."  It comes with a cooling fan, so you don't have to buy one separately (which I did).

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLow energy and low temps!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2017
Reviews: Pros:1. EZ overclocking to 3.8ghz without really trying.2. Stock heatsink, thermal paste and fan give very low temps!-- Average of 28 along all cores idle-- Average of 42 along all cores while playing FFXIV for an hour-- Peaked at 70 during PRIME 95 Sensor Test (Real Temp GT)3. Zero input lag when CPU usage at 100%. No blue screens!4. TDW is 61 wattsCons:1. Only Windows 8.1 or 10 are supported. Ubuntu 14.x or higher, not sure on other Linux flavors.Other:Originally I was going to go with Ryzen because, well competition and hype. Intel slashing prices is why I went with another Intel setup (replacing i7 950). The extremely low power usage, cool temps and functioning while under 100% load are very nice. I have a gtx780, so the onboard graphics won't be used, so I can't comment on that other than the specs are impressive (supports 3 displays, etc).

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2018
Reviews: Functions perfectly.  I only marked it down a start because I felt like Amazon was a little misleading about whether or not this included a cooling fan.  IT DOES.  I bought a hypercolor because it was suggested to add and the description never said it had a stock fan with it.  The last time I built a computer, 10 or so years ago, you would typically buy a boxed processor like this and get the fan or an "OEM Build" processor with no fan and the price was commensurate.  I couldn't really tell whether or not this fit in either of those categories.  Shame on me for not just asking the question, but I felt a little duped.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2017
Reviews: Excellent processor for games and graphic design (like Photoshop) or video animations (After Effects). Despite not having the Hyper-Threading technology has a performance with a price/quality ratio that met my expectations.My PC build has the following specifications:- Case: Corsair SPEC-02- Motherboard: MSI B250 Gaming M3- Power supply: EVGA 600 B1- Processor: Intel Core i5 7500- CPU Fan: Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO- RAM: Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB (2x8GB) DDR4 DRAM 2400MHz C14- Graphic Card: EVGA GTX 1060 3GB SC- SSD: Samsung EVO 960 250GB- HDD: WD Blue 1TB SATA 6 Gb/s 7200 RPM 64MB Cache 3.5 Inch- Optical Drive: Asus 24x DVD-RW DRW-24B1ST

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsToo pricey, but OK cpu. Similar benchmark from i3-8100
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2018
Reviews: This is locked cpu, you cannot overclock this cpu. For people who would like to use their pc for long term, this is great cpu with stable temperature and safe from throttling. If you would like to make this cou more stable, out market cooler is recommended, even tiny liquid cooler would work perfectly. Personally i feel like this goes great with rx580 and gtx 1060. I3-8100 has similar benchmark with lower price, you might wanna check it out if you are thinking about buying this thou.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsLeaves a little bit to be desired.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2017
Reviews: I'm slightly underwhelmed, looking back at the purchase I feel my money would have been better spent getting an i7. Really the only issue comes with editing videos, I use a very simple, free program and this has some issues with exporting small videos and can take up to 2 hours to export a video if there is some moderate editing done to it. Not bad at all though. I can game like a champion.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat value for cost, but the Ryzen R5 is a bit better
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2017
Reviews: The new Ryzen R5 chips are basically better i5's.  I probably should've waited to see how the R5's turned out before buying this i5, but the difference isn't TOO pronounced.  You could still easily justify an i5 if you plan on upgrading to Coffee Lake (which will continue using the LGA 1151 socket) down the road, or if you can get a really good deal on one.Otherwise, get an R5!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIt's like racing a Shelby GT500 against a 1986 6cyl Camaro
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2017
Reviews: Got this installed on an MSI B250M Bazooka board.  Went in with no issues.  The included CPU cooler is ultra quiet in comparison to my old Zalman cooler.  As far as speed goes, it flat out flies.  But my comparison is skewed a little because I upgraded from an old AMD FX6100 to this.  It's like racing a Shelby GT500 against a 1986 6cyl Camaro... it's just not a fair fight.  Using the exact same GPU, I saw an increase of 10-15fps on all my games.  Load times were cut dramatically, including Windows 10.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGREAT CPU FOR THE PRICE
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2017
Reviews: GREAT CPU. It does everything it is expected to do and more. 4k media is smooth, multitasking is a breeze and most games play well except for cpu intensive games like arma 3 and ashes of the benchmark (ashes of the singularity). I give it 5 stars because i knew what to expect going in and it met all my expectations. i am happy with the purchase. if you are a gamer who plays gpu intensive games this chip will not get in the way of absolute max fps.Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor (BX80677I57500)

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2019
Reviews: overall great cpu will work great for your standard use and of gaming. max Gpu you could use is maybe a GTX 1050 which will stop you from upgrading to GTX 1070 or even to RTX 2060. Best bet is to save the money and get the i7 or i9

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAwesome processor! Will handle multiple monitors
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2018
Reviews: Awesome processor!  Will handle multiple monitors, TV tuners, and multiple processes.  Have used this on my power user computers and my son's gaming computer and all is good!  No need to get an expensive I7 processor when this one with do gaming and serve as a business based computer.  The I7 is really aimed at super users, with over 40 active processes, quickbooks, surveillance recording with multiple cameras, remote access software apps and over 25 active tabs on Chrome...  Highly recommend the I5 for Gaming and intense business computer users

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2017
Reviews: Great processor for gaming. You may not be able to record gameplay smoothly, but for gaming alone, works great. Very cool and stable turbo boosted to 3.6-3.8 GHz. Only reason for 4 stars is that it is not the best in value, so check out AMD Ryzen 5 processors for 6 core / 12 thread or 4 core / 8 thread processor for similar cost, especially if you plan to do aome multitasking.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsinstall the stock heatsink and you're good to go
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2017
Reviews: No issues whatsoever, just pop it into your motherboard, install the stock heatsink and you're good to go. There's no plastic film to remove for the heatsink, and thermal paste is pre-applied. Not sure if my temperatures are accurate as they don't seem to change, but I'm idling at 42 degree Celsius.Heatsink fan is more than adequate for this CPU. But can get loud as CPU load increases. Not annoyingly loud, but you will hear the fan speed ramp up which is louder than idle. Do consider aftermarket CPU coolers if silence/performance is priority.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent for the cost.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2017
Reviews: Great proc for the price.  Excellent choice for gaming on a budget and if you want something a tick better than an i3 equivalent.  i7s will often score better frames but the extra cost offers diminishing returns, you're better off with an i7 if you plan on 'future-proofing' and don't want to build for a handful of years, or if you really need the extra frames for a 4K monster or raw horsepower for other needs.  For gaming?  This proc offers plenty of performance for the cost.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsi7 stock fan never gave me any issues...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2017
Reviews: Nice processor. Crappy stock cooling fan. Never really seemed to seat right, always seemed to not quite lock down to gigabyte gaming b8 Mobo. When I did feel like every pin was engaged fully, the fan rubbed on the heatsink. Cooling demands had this thing running at pretty high speeds during gaming, was really noisy even when it wasn't clicking. Do yourself a favor if you buy this pick up aCooler Master Hyper 212. (Or obviously any more expensive unit).  Best $30 I have spent. (Just make sure you have room for it its large). 120mm fan spins silently no matter what game you are playing.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat CPU for gaming
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2017
Reviews: Got it on time and still was factory sealed. Works as intended with no issues. Great CPU for gaming, i actually replaced my Ryzen 5 1600 for this due to getting a bad CPU from AMD. I tried AMD for the first time this year and sad to say never going back. If you dont want any issues and just want to install your cpu and start gaming i highly recommend Intel. Not bashing AMD but from my experience Intel has been more reliable for me.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsunlike my previous one which would reach @ 100 when running games like Battlefront II or programs like Vegas Pro
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2017
Reviews: It is far, FAR faster than my previous cpu. When running intensive programs/games, its utilization doesn't rise above 60 percent, unlike my previous one which would reach @ 100 when running games like Battlefront II or programs like Vegas Pro. If you cannot stretch your budget and you need a reliable, mid-range cpu, get this one. No excuses.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsRuns everything I've thrown at it, GTA 5 at ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2018
Reviews: Runs everything I've thrown at it, GTA 5 at 80+ FPS Battlefield 1 between 80-100 FPS with AA on low and other CPU intensive things turned down. At this point however I'd suggest you go with anIntel Core i7-8700K Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.7GHz Turbo Unlocked LGA1151 300 Series 95W BX80684i78700Kif you really wanna future proof and have some additional 3rd party fans and a Z370 motherboard lying around.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood processor for a mid-level gaming rig.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2018
Reviews: I don't regret getting this over the i3 Anymore. It has the right kick and power I need for my entire game library as well as just a good little processor. would an i9 or Threadripper be great. OH YEAH! But for the price in the current market, this does the job. Plus it came with a cooler that isn't too bad. I opted for a different one instead. (White LED lights for the win there)

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsCPU is stupid fast though
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2017
Reviews: Why did I buy this instead of a i5-6500? I'm not really sure. It ended up costing me $25 to a local PC repair shop to upgrade the motherboard I had bought, because it didn't support 7th gen out of the box.CPU is stupid fast though.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGaming/multi-task beast for the price.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2017
Reviews: The benchmark performance for this one versus the i7-7700 shows that this processor is only about roughly 10-14% slower than the unlocked i7-7700. I bought this, put a Cryorig C7 cooler on it, and honestly, I don't see any dropped frames or lag in gameplay. Even with the lowly 1050Ti, I can play "Arma 3" online with zero issues, as well as "Witcher 3" and GTA V This processor works great.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2017
Reviews: I put it in a MSI bazooka board with no problems.( notice then chip doesnt have little prongs, instead ot plops onto the slot and latched down.)it looks like to take a cpu like this and install it, the pros charge up a combo price from 100-200 $$.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsFinally an i5 processor that feels like an i7!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2018
Reviews: I had no clue this came with it's own fan and heatsink assembly and had already purchased my own extra large cooler, but am incredibly impressed with the quality of fan and heatsink this case with. Installation was a breeze, the prize was right, and the performance is incredible - finally an i5 processor that feels like an i7!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat cpu, but the cpu fan is noisy lol
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2018
Reviews: overall the cpu is quite good and suitable for all normal users or gamers. however, the cpu fan is quite noisy that i use my own one instead (also the original fan came with the cpu but different manufacturer). it may be caused by the mistakes from the cpu fan manufacturer.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsDoes its job. Turbo boost allows cores to come ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2017
Reviews: Does its job. Turbo boost allows cores to come up to 3.7GHZ max. But this is the lacking department in my new build. wish the top tier processors werent 300+ but this is what lack of competition in the market creates it seems

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIntel processors never cease to amaze me
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2018
Reviews: At first i had my doubts purchasing this processor as i was on a budget but man it really has helped me and it has persevered in times of great stress on my computer. This processor deserves the 5 star rating from me for the price and powerhouse that it is.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2019
Reviews: Works great from lighthouse to heavy gaming, but clock speeds that are advertised are not completely accurate.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat performance at a great price
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2017
Reviews: Worked perfectly from first boot. I paired it with a new ASRock H270 Pro 4 motherboard and have been absolutely happy with my choices.  Main use is computer gaming and this performs outstanding compared to the dual xeon system I was running with the same video card. The boost in performance is quite dramatic in every game I play.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThe i5 has been excellent for my uses
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2017
Reviews: The i5 has been excellent for my uses: gaming, but not brand-new AAA titles. This CPU paired with an M.2 boot drive has been magical. Would definitely recommend the i5 for anyone who wants to game, but can't afford the big ticket i7. Don't settle for an i3, get a mid-range i5, it's worth the extra.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsProbably too much for an HTPC
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2017
Reviews: quite powerful.  intel HD630 is excellent for general use.use with Win10.  initially installed Win7 Pro x64 but received a warning that several functions are not supported by Win7.powers an ASRock Deskmini 110.  Getting 47-49 degrees on stock cpu cooler.i'm happy with not spending extra for an i7

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsit is what it says it is.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2017
Reviews: what can I say, it works fine, no glitches or freaking out.  it had run any program I have asked it to and its pretty much as fast as you would expect.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat value and performance
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2017
Reviews: It's a good CPU if you don't plan to overclock, and good value. There are better Intel CPUs for slightly more money, but at this price the performance is very nice.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIntel i5-7500 7th Generation Processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2018
Reviews: The Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Generation Core Processor gives outstanding performance. I installed this processor on the Asus Prime B250M-C/CSM Mainboard and was blown away by the performance I have seen when using this processor when I installed Ubuntu version 18.04.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-7500 LGA 1151 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor
Review Title: 2.0 out of 5 starsClose but not what I wanted
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2017
Reviews: The cpu works fine and I would be happy if I had wanted a 3.4ghz cpu. The problem is I wanted a 3.8ghz cpu and Amazon's description said that is what it is. Actually part # bx80677i57500 is a 3.4ghz cpu even though the product description says 3.8ghz. Unfortunately I did not discover their error until I booted up my computer the first time and looked at the bios page then I looked at the box more carefully, 3.4ghz in small print on the side. Again, there is nothing wrong with the product itself, just that I was building for a processor speed of at least 3.8ghz and because of a wrong description I am stuck with what I have.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6400 FC-LGA14C 2.70 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56400
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsDecent Cpu But Some Setbacks...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2016
Reviews: Decent Cpu. Is a 2.7 ghz. Hard to overclock because its not K series, which is easier to overclock. This is on the minimum vr requirements so an upgrade is suggested. Onboard intel 530 hd graphics on par with nvidia 2xx gtx. So its ok. Can run some games but nothing new. To be honest I expect a little better from a 6th gen processor but it is still decent. This cpu can be a mid gen cpu. This skylake cpu is also a ram compatibility issue as it only accepts DDR3L and DDR4 so no putting old ddr3 memory in. As the expression goes, a chain is only as strong as it's weakest link so if you bought this cpu with a powerful gpu and ram, this cpu will hold you back a bit than other cpus. However this is fine watching videos, light servering, and a little gaming. Again the cpu is a 2.7 GHZ and future games will probably require a 3.0 ghz cpu quad core or higher so unless you are overclocking, this cpu might not be best for gaming.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6400 FC-LGA14C 2.70 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56400
Review Date: Reviewed in France on February 23, 2016
Reviews: Il me fallait un bon processeur pour ma nouvelle carte mère ASUS B150M-C.Le i5 6400, qui est sorti récemment, et bien qu’il soit cadencé qu’à 2,7 ghz (3.3 en boost, lorsqu’un seul cœur / thread est sollicité), il a les derniers jeux d’instructions et l’IGP (le chipset graphique intégré au processeur).Il possède 4 cœurs physiques sans hyperthreading, soit 4 cœurs en permanence au top, avec « turboboost » (hausse de la fréquence en thread unique. N’est pas tenue pour plus d’un thread du fait de la dissipation thermique).Ce processeur est ainsi plus véloce que sur un haut de gamme ancienne génération.Cet IGP est de plus compatible avec l’API direct X 12, qui est une retouche logiciel de bas niveau qui pourra avec Windows 10 faire tourner « mieux » avec « moins » de ressources les scène 3d. Et puis il gère la définition 4k.En plus, cette dernière génération de processeur est gravé plus finement que l’ancienne, ce qui fait un TDP (dissipation thermique) de 65 watts au max. C’est moins de bruit de ventilo et des économies d’énergie.Une bête de course à recommander vu le rapport qualité / prix

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6400 FC-LGA14C 2.70 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56400
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on May 4, 2018
Reviews: Dopo 2 anni di utilizzo intensivo non mostra alcun segno di cedimento o rallentamenti. Se siete alla ricerca di un processore con ottime prestazioni in ambito lavorativo o gaming (senza troppe pretese) questo processore fa per voi. Sconsigliato per chi fa grafica o video editing ad alte risoluzioni. La frequenza di lavoro ha un range di lavoro abbastanza ampio (da 2.7 GHz a 3.3 GHz) e la modalità turbo è automatica quindi sarà lui ad aumentarla automaticamente se sotto stress. Questo vi consente di risparmiare energia quando il carico di lavoro non è eccessivo (per esempio navigare su internet). Il dissipatore ingrato è di buona qualità e riesce a tenere le temperature nella norma, in particolare se la scheda madre ha una gestione intelligente delle ventole. Il processore grafico integrato è ottimo ma in coppia con una scheda grafica dedicata riesce a gestire anche giochi abbastanza pesanti (per gli fps a quel punto dipende molto dalla scheda grafica). In conclusione è un prodotto robusto ed affidabile. Consigliatissimo!

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6400 FC-LGA14C 2.70 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56400
Review Date: Reviewed in France on May 15, 2016
Reviews: Toujours plus performant !J'ai acheté un intel I5 2500K il y a quelques années et j'en suis toujours satisfait.Le seul point que je peux lui reprocher c'est le bruit affreux qu'il fait (dans une tour silencio en plus..).J'ai donc acheté ce processeur pour un montage pour une connaissance et... Waouw.Maintenant le processeur est vendu avec un ventirad, qui a l'air en tout point identique, mais qui ne fait plus aucun bruit !Allumé ou éteint c'est du pareil au même... Je sais pas si c'est le processeur ou la carte mère ou autre mais la différence est énorme.Concernant les performances, c'est simplement super.. Fluide et rapide.. Un I5 quoi. Le haut du milieu de gamme. Couplé à 16Go de ram et à un SSD, l'ordinateur est "on Fire" !Je recommande vraiment ce processeur si on veut faire une configuration qui tient la route pour plusieurs années (preuve avec mon i5 2500K que je n'ai pas pu mettre à genoux en plusieurs années).

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6400 FC-LGA14C 2.70 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56400
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on October 29, 2017
Reviews: Tra i miei vari impieghi mi ritrovo spesso ad indossare i panni di assemblatore di PC ed ormai da diversi anni utilizzo e consiglio esclusivamente l'acquisto e l'utilizzo di processori INTEL. Di qualsiasi generazione, di qualsiasi fascia di prestazioni sono prodotti d'eccellenza che non deludono mai, soddisfando sempre appieno le aspettative! In questa recensione si parla di un I5 di sesta generazione, più precisamente il modello 6400. Non è sicuramente un top di gamma, ma è perfetto per tutte le configurazioni hardware medio-alte. Dalle notevoli prestazioni permette di eseguire qualsiasi operazione con una velocità di calcolo disarmante, il consumo in termini di energia assorbita è ridotto ormai ai minimi termini ed affiancato ad una scheda video prestante regala forti emozioni anche ai giocatori più estremi. Dal costo assai contenuto rispetto alle prestazioni che offre attualmente si colloca ai primi posti per quello che riguarda il rapporto qualità prezzo. Corredato del classico dissipatore stock non necessita nemmeno di una particolare attenzione in merito al suo raffreddamento in quanto come già accennato in precedenza è ottimizzato per offrire il massimo delle prestazioni sfruttando il minimo delle risorse. Non penso si possa chiedere di più, consiglio vivamente il prodotto e sfido chiunque a metterne in dubbio l'affidabilità.

Product Title: Intel Boxed Core I5-6400 FC-LGA14C 2.70 Ghz 6 M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 BX80662I56400
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on January 9, 2017
Reviews: Dopo qualche mese da possessore di un fx4300 ho deciso di passare ad intel dopo aver fatto passare la rete a caccia di informazioni ed aver montato un pc con un I5 6500 ad un amico e vedendo le prestazioni Decido di acquistare questa cpu vedendo dei test/bench con il 6500 e non riscontrando grandi abissi nei due.Montato su una gigabyte h170 con 8gb corsair 2133 cl13 mi ritengo soddisfatto in pieno sia con le attività quotidiane che con i giochi testato con una gigabyte 1060 GTA 5 viaggia con tutto al massimo sui 55fps fissi dando una tirata alla vga si ottiene un incremento di altri 5/6fps arrivando a giocare a 60fps quasi fissi, ricordatevi che ora  l'elemento fondamentale è la gpu, quindi a mio avviso quello che riparmierete dal 6500 al 6400 fareste meglio ad investirlo nella gpu.Il pregio di questo processore è che non scalda minimamente installato dentro un corsair air 540 con 2 enermax in immissione e 3 enermax in estrazione tutte da 140mm e raffreddato da un noctua dh14 la temperatura si assesta su entrambi i core 20/21 gradi in idle e 30/35 sotto sforzo con prime95Ottimo il turbo boost che passa dai i core a riposo sugli 800/1000mhz ai 3100mhz sotto stress.Ottima cpu per l'uso quotidiano e ottimo servizio amazon consigliato

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSo thankfully amazon is cool as shit
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2018
Reviews: Only reason I am writing this review as a 1 star is because on this particular CPU... it states 1151 socket, so I matched it with 1151 motherboard thinking I would be ok.  I am going from AMD which I have never owned an Intel.  I have been having a hell of time experiencing some issues with getting everything up and running.  Anyway, after i got everything up and connected with double and triple checking connections... the machine booted up and then powered right back off.  After digging into some research, on the back on my motherboard box I noticed that it supports 6th and 7th edition Intel CPU's..... this CPU is 8th edition ...but has 1151 socket.  My point here.... the socket type should match up with the motherboard and SHOULD work, but to me Intel is greedy and wants more money .... so you have to buy special mobos..... just my two sense here.So thankfully amazon is cool as shit, they are awesome with refunds btw.  I returned that mobo for one that supports 8th edtion Intel CPU 1151 socket.  After I got all of it connected again... it would start up and go right back off.....but this time the CPU light above the 24 pin power connecter was lighting up.  Come to find out.... the CPU was DOA , or something happened when I fired it up in the other MOBO that didn't support the 8th edition Intel CPU.Got my fingers cross as I have exchanged the CPU for an replacement.  I know some of this is my fault ....but I'm not taking all of the blame here haha!  If a CPU says 1151 socket... plain and simple... the MOBO that accepts 1151 socket should work!!!!!!!  I shouldn't have to dig into all the particular info on the mobo and find out every little detail to see if the CPU will match and work with the MOBO.... stupid !!  I'm done venting.... wish me luck when the replacement CPU comes in.ps: Will change review after getting the CPU up and running and actually testing it out compared to my FX 8 core AMD that I have had.CPU works, review changed as this CPU paired with my system is 100 billion percent faster.  Loving it!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
