Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsNot new, but works
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2024
Reviews: Not complaining too much because I did get it on sale, but this was definitely used to some degree. Fir starters, the small package was put into the large shipping box with ZERO filler, so it was shaken around a bunch. The product box seal was opened, clearly cut a d opened. There was a small amount of thermal paste on the outer edge of the processor and the little sticker that you peel off to put on your tower was stuck crooked to the instruction manual. Works and is an upgrade from what we had, but don't advertise new if you are selling used.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsQuite good, one of the best for games currently. Top 3
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2019
Reviews: Quite good, one of the best for games currently. Top 3 right now are 8700k, 9700k and 9900k, and you can include 8086k (if you can find it), but it will be around $600, and who wants that when you got 9900k for ~$510I had 8700k fail on me, so I replaced it with 9700k, 8700k was hotter, but needed less voltage if you were to set it at 4.7 ghz, on 9700k I can't even keep CPU stable at 1.3volts for 4.7, on 8700k I could at 1.21 volts. Feel the difference?Thermals are better on 9700k, with same cooling, if comparing to 8700k. It is slightly faster in games then 8700k, but slightly slower anywhere else while using PC.If you are choosing between the two you can't go wrong with either, but mine cannot even keep stock settings without crashing games. 8700k ran stable, needed less voltage too, so it was cooler because of less volts.I didn't feel like overclocking 8700k to 5.0, I kept it nice and cool. I can't downclock 9700k to anything in comparison. So I kept it stock, but it kept crashing in AIDA 64 with hardware failure message. Also getting bluescreens, etc.I do believe I got a bad chip/bad silicone this round, so I am returning this, and bought 9900k as a replacement.If you get a good 9700k chip, you will get better gaming experience than 8700k. If you stream and do rendering get 8700k, but in Adobe Premiere 9700k is better, because it has real cores, and not threads, so in other words both are good, but neither is better than another.The best for gaming now is 9900k, but you need better cooling. 8700k was quiet hot, and needed more cooling in comparing to 9700k.Hope that helps you choose.As long as you get good chip 8700k/9700k will be perfectly fine. I like 8700k better because it was snappier altogether, but 9700k was better in games.So yeah...both goodBut leaving 4 stars due to getting bad chip, it could have been higher, but I am not gambling with my time no more.9700k is soldered, 8700k is not soldered, so this is why 9700k is cooler. Keep that in mind.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsStable at 4.9 GHz Air Cooling.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020
Reviews: The i7-8700K runs very well, I have 3 profiles where I overclock it to 4.2 GHz, 4.5 GHz, or 4.8 GHz according to my needs. The system will run at 4.9 GHz stably.Using the Cryorig CP7 thermal paste (9.3 W/mK) that was included with the cooling tower.Ambient temperature in my house is about 24 C. The CPU maintains temperatures of 33 C when idle & 40 C under load with air cooling on the 4.5 GHz profile which I use most. Even on the 4.8 GHz profile the temperature remains about the same on idle, but will go up to the mid 40s under load (42-45 C).I've ordered another cooler & will update in September or October when it releases/arrives.The system (built 2018) mainly for gaming with workstation, video editing, & streaming capabilities:Corsair Carbide Series Air 540 High Airflow ATX Cube Case with Corsair High Airflow AF140L fan x33 Noctua NF-F12 industrial PPC-2000 IP67 PWM 120 mm FansASUS ROG Strix Z370-E Gaming Z370 ATX MotherboardIntel Core i7-8700K @ 4.8 GHz on 1.25 VCryorig R1 Universal Dual Tower CPU Heatsink with XF140 & Xt140 FansASUS ROG Strix GeForce GTX 1070 Ti 8GB GDDR5 Advanced EditionCarbon Fiber Graphics Card GPU Brace SupportPCI Slot Bracket holding 2 Noctua NF-F12 industrial PPC-2000 IP67 PWM 120 mm FansCorsair Dominator Platinum RGB 64GB (4x16GB) DDR4 3200MHz C16 on 1.29 VEVGA Supernova 850 P2 80+ PlatinumASUS BW-16D1HT Blu-ray burnerSamsung 960 PRO NVMe M.2 512GB SSDaddlink S70 2TB SSD NVMe PCIe 3x4 M.2 2280 Internal SSDSeagate FireCuda 2TB Solid State Hybrid Drive Performance SSHDSeagate BarraCuda Pro 10TB Internal Hard Drive Performance HDDDEMCiflex Dust Filter Kit Corsair Air 540 (8 Filters)Dell Gaming S2716DGR 27.0" Screen LED-Lit Monitor with G-SYNCLogitech C922x Pro Stream Webcam

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsOne of the best Lakes Intel has produced.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2017
Reviews: Pros:-Easy with either Intel XTU or programs that supports overclocking. Motherboards with overclocking support and UEFI also easy.-Wide stable clock range, like advertised: 3.7 Ghz to 4.8 Ghz. IMO, a future-proof consumer CPU- 6 Cores 12 threads. Multitasking is ever more easy peasy. Although there are several CPUs that has more core and threads, but those prices are for business purposes, I believe.Cons:-Just like other testers have found out, temps can be crazy. At idle, without any tampering/delidding of the CPU, it runs at 27 centigrade even with MSI Frozr Core L (Air cooler) and Gelid Xtreme thermal compound. Running Prime95 for 15 minutes, full load went close up to 80 centigrade. Heat is death for every computer component. Some CPUs previous to this one can run idle temps lower than ambient with just an air cooler and decent thermal compound.-Because of the wide clock range, there is little room for going above 4.8 Ghz. However, my current setup cannot fully test the clock ceiling of the component without possibly destroying it. I’ve came to this conclusion based off articles and enthusiast testers.-Price. Maybe. It’s the new hype for many Intel customers. And also availability. This will be remedied soon enough, as Intel plans to make more assembly line in places, which probably lowers the price.Other Thoughts:Upgrading from i7-2600, (non K mind you) this component is the answer for me. It is, as some previous iterations of the 14 nm lithography, as an optimized and core/thread-added CPU. Basically, it is a minor upgrade if you are already within the 14 nm tech.TLDR: I like this CPU coming from a 2nd gen i7.Current rig:Fractal Design Define R5 Windowed, with x2 140mm Case FansMSI Z370 Gaming M5 Motherboard.MSI Core Frozr L Air CoolerNvidia GTX 970 GPUG.Skill DDR4-3600Mhz 16GB Memory ModuleEVGA 600W 80+ Silver PSU non-modularGelid Solutions Xtreme Thermal Compound.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 1.0 out of 5 starsIts A No Go From Me
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2024
Reviews: Was excited to find what I thought would be New Old Stock i7 8700.  Item was listed as new.  Showed up quickly, but when I opened the box, I was met with a strange CPU box that clearly stated, "This Is Not Original Intel Packaging."Okay....  So I crack it open and take a look.  The CPU fan was damaged upon arrival.  Didn't have any faith in it as it looked pretty bad from the top, and the insides looked a bit dusty as well.  I was starting to doubt this "New" item status.  The CPU was in a plastic tray, and clearly had a fingerprint on it.  Again....not looking too new boss.Since I had no faith in the included air cooler, I decided to install a better one that uses a tower style radiator with a 120mm fan.  Fired the PC up and had to update my nVidia graphics card drivers.  Had my temp monitoring software open and saw one of the CPU cores was hitting 100c.  Holy cow.  And I was just doing driver installs.  No way would I trust trying to run a game or something like Cinebench to see what would happen.  And I know this tower cooler is more than enough as I've cooled much higher TDP CPUs with it.So, I'm returning this thing.  I highly doubt this thing is new by any stretch of the imagination.  And there's something definitely wrong with my particular chip.  I do not advise buying.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat processor, but if you're overclocking, you're gonna need a good cooler.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2018
Reviews: Per title; good processor. I can't complain about it. It was as all processors; easy to install. I got this with a motherboard and I can safely tell you that I don't regret my upgrade. I built my PC about three years ago shortly after the release of the 6600k and 6700k and stupidly, I skimped on processing power and went with the 6600k thinking "I'll just overclock it as far as I can safely take it with watercooling" and thought I'd be fine. Well, I was for a while, but three years is a lot, and with that constant overclock, while I wasn't noticing anything "bad" I was just noticing I wasn't getting as much out of it. So I upgraded, a thing I wouldn't be doing had I gone with the best processor in the first place. Lesson learned.So here's what I think. The ease at which you can overclock this particular processor is absolute. It's great. You can't get much better unless your motherboard has onboard profiles for maximum overclock, but what kind of scrub doesn't do it manually? (Well, me, this time...)Unfortunately, without a beefy cooling solution, you have yourself a radiator in the winter and a nuisance in the summer, and so I bought myself a box fan to set under my desk pointed at my tower to deal with this. Yes, I could buy a new cooling solution (I use an AIO that's now just over 3 years old, I know this is what I have to do) but right now can't swing the cost. So remember that if you intend to overclock, and you do if you're getting the unlocked K series, you're gonna want a good cooling solution. Whether you go air or water.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
Reviews: I used to have this processor around 2018. A few years down the line, I decided to upgrade to an i9-9900k. I can tell you that if you're just a gamer and/or don't do heavy video editing, upgrading to an i9 is just not worth it. The extra amount of money to dish out compared to the slight performance increase is just not worth it. Because of my motherboard, I couldn't overclock my i9 to its max without constantly crashing. The safe overclock limit ended up being weaker than this i7 @ 4.7GHz. Long story short, stick to this processor if you plan on upgrading to the 9th gen 9900k.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIntel i7-8700 leaves me good experience.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2018
Reviews: It is a component that many already know and there is not much to say about it more than my opinion.I will not use the factory fan, I think you all know that it does not have a good performance to mount it with this processor, for that we will use a Corsair Hydra H100i.I'll mount it with a MSI Z370-A Pro motherboard and 32GB of DDR4 Kingston HyperX Fury RAM.The performance, in some cases, was lower than my old i7-4790, although it was not so much the difference, it would be expected that having 2 cores and 4 more threads, its performance would be much higher than an old i7 4th generation.If you are thinking of changing from 6th or 7th generation to 8th, I suggest you do not spend your money, maybe it is better to wait if you are not a professional who took advantage of the cores, remember that this processor runs at less speed than its predecessors , which maybe in some applications leave it standing still.My experience was brutally satisfying, since I dedicate myself among other things to video editing, in games, I have not noticed any great improvements, but in many other applications it does show.Suggestions before buying the 8th generation.Think about what you want to achieve, if you put together a totally new team and you do not have a PC, of ​​course you should always buy the latest technology, but if you have a 4th generation team, I do not think you should change, unless, I repeat, Be a professional in any area that takes advantage of the improvements and number of cores.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsdelidding is a must intel TIM was play dough the day it was bought out the box
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2018
Reviews: so far so good ten min after it arrived i used my vice and delidded it, and cleaned away the already drying  TIM and the silicone adhesive.i replaced intel TIM it with liquid metal, i would suggest anyone buying this cpu to do the same .Dont let the liquid metal scare you, just go to home depot and get the small jar of liquid electrical tape and cover the three tiny gold dots on the left side of the die that will be under the IHS (you can also use good fingernail polish ) let it dry five to ten min. then apply liquid metal to a good qulity tight wound cotton ear swab (hard pointy ones are best) and "paint" the back side of the IHS and shiny die with the liquid metal ...( do not use a pea sized amount use a half a grain of rice size applied to the ear swab first do it away from the work area and the pc!!! one messup will squirt liquid metal all over your pc ) and thats ityou can put four very tiny (micro) drops of atv silicon to the four corners of the IHS if you want but be sure to let the pc cpu socket clamp the IHS down firm so as to not have it hovering above the die under the ihs and not cooling as it should....if you did it properly it will be a min of 10c cooler up to 20+c cooler anything less than 10c means its not touching properly under the IHS.......

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat processor but don't shy away from the other Intel CPUs
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2019
Reviews: Installed the i7-8770K CPU, put the heatsink on, assembled the rest of the computer and loaded Windows 10. Nothing went wrong. Honestly, it is overkill for my use -- basic Internet searches, media server, some programming and desktop software. My motherboard uses the H370M chipset and 2666MHZ memory and Samsung EVO or PRO SSDs. I saw some CPU speed recommendations for a media server and bought this CPU as I didn't want to have to buy something else if a "lesser" CPU didn't work out.I used the built in graphics (UHD 630) for a while and it is very good for low-intensive graphics use. Then I added a low profile GTX1050Ti  (was curios) and was impressed and then added a GTX1060 in another computer (still curious) which is even more impressive. With my lack of gaming skills I cannot put any graphics to a test so I downloaded some demos from NVIDIA which allow you to pan and zoom around the scene.I have the i3-8350K in another build and it works great for what I use computers for. So, while this i7-8700K is fantastic and may be what you need for a great media server or workstation I recommend investigating other processors using a User Bench Mark site and see how they stack up for gaming, desktop or workstation use and then decide.  8th generation i3, i5 or i7 are great from bench mark comparisons and two actual purchases.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2017
Reviews: -excellent gaming cpu-smoother framerates coming from a my older Haswell 4690k , improved .1% minimum lowsOverclocking:-  using a H100i Pro RGB I was able to achieve  4.3 @ 1.13  /  4.7 @ 1.20 / 4.8 @ 1.24/ 5hz @ 1.35 + with LLC on high (BF1, pubg , gta 5 ghost recon wildlands, World War Z, Division 2, Ring of Elysium  and Witcher 3 )-  temps @ 4.3 very cool , 40s-50s gaming, low 60s peak load / @ 5 ghz 50s -60s gaming w spikes in the 70s , 80s+ peak load will vary on ambient temp , I live in the southwest(temps will get slightly hotter gaming at 240hz , about 5-10 degrees at most)-  the IHS TIM is the obvious reason for higher temps when  overclocking, silicon lottery will delidd this for $40 for those extreme overclockers-  I do recommend a good air cooler if not OC'ing with high quailty paste-  I would stay away from multicore enhancement setting in bios , it sets the vcore to 1.33 @4.7 on a gigabyte z370 gaming 5 , a manual overclock is betteroverall :10/10highly rec if your coming from 7th gen i5 or lower , previous i7 (4core 8thread) owners all the down to sandy bridge might not notice a difference in gaming at 1080 60 fps but 144 hz -240hz,  a powerful cpu like this is neededi7 8700k @ 4.7 with h100i PRO RGBMsi 2070 gaming @ 1950 mhzGigabyte Aorus gaming 5 z37016 gb of gskill @ 3200512 ssd PNYCorsair rm 850x gold psuThermaltake v71 caseAlienware 1080p 240 hz

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGood all around CPU but not worth the price for most.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2018
Reviews: Overall this CPU is quite nice and works well for just about anything you could hope do with it.There are obviously some CPUs with more cores that will work better in specialized tasks such as video editing but once again this CPU really fits the jack of all trades role. Personally I think it functions best as a gaming CPU due to how well it overclocks combined with how well it performs in single thread benchmarks compared to most multi-core CPUs. Worth noting that the 8700k's single thread speed is comparable to the 7700k. Although the 8700k is a bit more future proof due to two extra cores it has over the 7700k. The biggest downside i've experienced is that this CPU can and WILL run hot so be prepared to buy top of the line cooling. Preferably water cooling.Overall the CPU itself is excellent and checks off most of boxes in things you want out of a CPU. The biggest problem is how expensive things become when you factor in all the things you'll probably need to buy. Remember at the very least that you'll need to buy an entirely new motherboard with the 8700k. Potentially DDR4 and a high end cooling solution assuming you don't already own these. Due to the price I would only advise upgrading to this if you are currently running on an extremely dated CPU. If your CPU is only a few years only then just hold onto your money for awhile and wait for something better.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis Processor is awesome
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2018
Reviews: I recently decided to upgrade my gaming PC.  The system I built a couple years ago was pretty good but I soon realized the I7 6700 I had picked with a max turbo speed of 3.7 GHz on all the cores  was not up to the task of making my GPU work hard and it was pretty slow at content creation as well.  I went back and forth between Intel and AMD and eventually settled on this processor.  The difference is night and day.  The I7 8700 is able to officially turbo to 4.3 GHz on all 6 cores and with sufficient cooling can do that all day long.  I say officially because my mobo has a "performance mode" in the BIOS which, according to CPUz, is allowing the CPU to turbo to 4.4 GHz on all cores when I'm gaming and it holds it steadily.  My GPU went from 55 to 60% usage in Planetside 2 to 99% and my average frame rate at 1080p went from 90-100 FPS to 130-140 FPS.  Rendering times were also reduced by a fair margin.  One word of advice.  Go ahead and get an aftermarket cooler and throw the stock one in the trash.  It gets warm pretty quick.  I went with a Cryorig H7 which was probably a little overkill but my max temp has only been 54 degrees.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsCoolest K on the block?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2018
Reviews: Edit- So I did finally delid my cpu and managed to get temps and voltage even lower. From a cold boot it idles at 23 degrees Celsius on the package. In games and rendering it goes ups to 45-48 and after 6 hours of streaming it peaked at 53. This is all with a 5ghz OC @ 1.3V. It hits 5.3 @ 1.39 but not completely stable and didn’t feel like going any farther.So instead of the silicon lottery I believe I may have hit the TIM lottery? 5ghz all day 1.345 VCore 25-30c idle 55-60C when gaming and after beating the brakes off of it with Aida64 (after 2 hours of other benchmarks) for 30 minutes solid it wouldn’t 70c. I’m using a Nzxt x62 AIO but I’m still impressed with my temps after hearing most people are hitting 80c @ 4.8 and 4.9ghz. I was planning on delidding but I’ve changed my mind as of this moment. All the temps were for the cpu package and using HWinfo64 the highest the cores themselves actually reached was 80c which is still 5 degrees off from the throttle temp. I’m over the moon about this cpu the performance is mind boggling and I haven’t been able to make it stutter or hiccup once going through my daily routine. The only thing I was worried about was temps and I apparently got some golden chip in terms of that.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsIt works fine but..
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
Reviews: I recently purchased this for my boyfriend and while it does work as it should.. it arrived as a refurbished product. Just a plain brown box no packing label no nothing. It was sealed in a plastic static bag. We asked our tech savvy friend and he confirmed it was refurbished aswell. Buyer beware because this seller claims it’s a brand new product when it’s not. I was expecting the box in the photos shown, sealed securely.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent chip & VERY fast!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2017
Reviews: Pros:-Outstanding gaming performance.-Just about the fastest single threaded performance you can get.-Over-clocks fairly well w/o deliding. (A good quality cooler is a must).-6 cores/12 threads is no slouch for content creators & productivity either.-Will be a viable CPU for many years to come.Cons:-Difficult to acquire.-A little pricey due to scarcity. (I paid $419 which I think is reasonable).-Non-soldered integrated heat-sink...they used thermal paste instead so depending on your situation it can run warm.-To really push the limits of over-clocking, deliding is recommended, along with water cooling.Other Thoughts:I bought this CPU in order to finally make a leap up from my trusty i5 2500k Sandybridge that I'd been using since 2011. I have zero regrets. This thing is super fast. DO NOT buy from greedy scalpers. Just be patient and diligent and you can snag one for a reasonable price.***My build:***i7 8700k (Mild OC @ 4.8Ghz w/ 1.24 Vcore)Arctic Freezer 240 AIO water coolerMSI Z370 Gaming Pro Carbon16Gb DDR4 3200 Corsair Vengeance RGBSamsung 960 Evo M.2 250gbPowercolor Vega 56 (Do not overpay for these either. At $450 or less, there is no better value, especially for free-sync).EVGA SuperNOVA 750 Gold 80+Phanteks Enthoo Luxe Full Tower (Fantastic, roomy case)"New Pixio" 27" 1440p 144Hz Free-sync IPS panel monitor (Sexy monitor and perfect companion for Vega 56/64).

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2018
Reviews: i am a little biased since i love intel, i grew up taking field trips to the portland, or headquarters and i became a computer engineer when i first learned assembly code, the beauty of the architecture was instantly apparent.  the new generation of chips does not add too much stuff, and seems more like a product designed to fill the gap until the 10nm chips are ready for consumers.  it means that the jump isnt huge over the 7th gen chips in terms of features, but the stability and performance feel greatly improved to me.  like the 7th gen chips, the VT-d and IOMMU technology means i can run linux as my OS and still play games natively, the turbo boost means i dont have to turn my overclock off when im just doing basic work, 6 cores means i can pin multiple cores to my windows VM and it feels just as responsive as a 4 core box, the common simple physical design makes relidding a breeze and compatibility a non-issue.  it has encouraged me to get back into computers as a hobby, and i have since bought the 8086k as an upgrade and keep this one as a backup.  i am now waiting with baited breath for an X series.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2018
Reviews: It is good, not great.I have it OC'ed at 5Ghz all the time using Asus Apex 10 z370 motherboard - zero issues.I delidded it because it needed it for temp control - temps dropped by 25 degrees C at 100% load and 1.38 volts.It is too expensive and I paid too much.I built a new rig and I wanted to get the z370 chipset and the Gen 8 cpu so I did... meh.Not much performance increase over my previous Gen 7 i7 which I sold for what I paid for it.I was able to clock the i7 to 5.3 Ghz stable (it was a crazy good cpu).It is very true that computer parts vary in quality - I think this cpu is just very average.I am tempted to purchase another one, but you just cannot determine if another cpu is higher quality without trying it out.I have not been able to get a stable OC over 5.2 Ghz on this chip.I do like the additional cores which helps with mining.With 5 active cores on the cryptonight algo the cpu will hit 415 h/s... 5 cores is the sweet spot so if you mine set your cores to 5.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPleasantly exceeded my expectations
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2019
Reviews: I built my first brand new system last year using a Ryzen 2700 and still love it. I have read so much about AMD vs Intel and only knew that I was pleased with my CPU...I still love it.BUT when I bought this i7 for a Hackintosh build and benchmarked it in Windows, I couldn't believe the increase in performance vs the Ryzen. I was literally blown away by how fast this thing is. Unfortunately the first 2 motherboards I purchased had defective LAN ports and I am currently awaiting a new board to complete my build. I can't wait to get this up and running when the board comes in. My Ryzen build is beautiful and will be won't be going anywhere, but if I had it to do over again, I would have paid the extra money last year to buy this CPU and just have the one system with dual-boot for Mac and Intel. As for the 9th gen Intel vs the new Ryzen, I have no advice, but this thing is great. Overclocked all cores to 5 GHz with no issues on both boards before discovering the LAN defects with the motherboards.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2019
Reviews: Almost dont want to write this review and jinx it but so that this processor is kicking as and taking no names. I installed on an Auros Z390 Pro board and I actually think I might need to up the board a little. I have run some pretty nasty stress tests on it and comes through with flying colors, do note I have a water cooler on it for extreme temp management. If your thinking of getting one and dont want to spend the bucks on the next family up this is a GREAT processor. I run a few of the most intense games out on it, yes I know that is more video card than proc, but a great video card needs a good board and processor or you bottleneck it. Anyway, you wont be disappointed in this workhorse and I upgraded from 980extreme (which is over 1000 dollar processor when I bought it and it still retail over 800.)Z390 ProI7-8700kAORUS GeForce RTX™ 2080 XTREME 8GSamsung SSD 960 EVO Series - 1TB PCIe NVMe - M.2 Internal SSD32GB corsair vengeanceAny questions just reply I will check regularly

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars5.1GHz Stable for One Year
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019
Reviews: I’ve had my 8700k running at 5.1GHz for <20 days away from being one full year, vCore at 1.38v. Paired with a Strix z370e board, 16gb 3000MHz DDR4, Strix 1080 until December when I purchased a Strix 2080. I use one Samsung Evo SSD for my OS, everything else on WD Black drives (games too). At 1440p 16:9 Max settings I get 100+ FPS steadily and temps with h100iv2 and Arctic Silver 5 (outdated paste), never exceed mid 60s while gaming and max I’ve ever seen running cinebench or 3DMark or even Aida64 is 84c. Chip not delidded. The chip does really well at gaming and even multitasking, my only oddity is that my system does not like tighter timing on the ram. I decided to disable XMP and manually overclock the ram but when I tighten the timings from 16-16-16-38 to 15-15-15-36 and DRAM voltage at 1.4v, the system will not boot. Enable XMP and redid my overclock (system booted into bios in safe mode, undoing and deleting my overclock profiles.) and everything’s back to running flawlessly. Very pleased with my 8700k chip and glad I got my rig built before the 9th gen launch fiasco.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsTurbo speed is misleading. 1 core 4.7GHz or 4-5 core 4.4GHz take a guess which one you see more of.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2018
Reviews: Back when I was using my 4690k I seemed to hit the turbo clock all the time with my little 120mm rad. With this I have never hit 4.7GHz on any core and I have only seen it reach 4.4GHz. it's a modest turbo clock I guess but not anywhere near what the packaging indicates. I have a h115i pro cooling it with a total of 6 case fans, (4 noctua chromax, and the two radiator fans) but it just heats up until it's at around 70 degrees under load and stops the turbo right at 4.4GHz. they have this screwy system of boosting a certain number of cores to a certain frequency or boosting 1 core at a time to 4.7 I guess I haven't had a task that the processor thought should be run on one fast core instead of several reasonably quick cores. Whatever. It's not like I'm going to return it and eventually I'll figure out how to get it to overclock or turbo how I like but it's a bit stupid for it to advertise some super high frequency when it has to date never seen the need to reach.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPerfect for Gaming and General Use
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2018
Reviews: Recieved with no obvious defects. Performs great for gaming and general use. 6 cores with 12 threads also enable multiple processes to be executed effectively. Easy to overclock, typically up to 5 Ghz with 5.1 Ghz usually possible, but this increases TDP from 95W, so you might need to get a new cooler for this.Standard clock per active core: 4.7 Ghz Single Core, 4.6 Ghz Two Core, 4.5 Ghz Three Core, 4.4 Ghz Four and Five Core, and 4.3 Ghz Six Core.Only margainally less capable than the ~$75 more i7 8086k, which has a Single Core clock of 5.0 Ghz stock (the rest is the same). The i7 8700k is a better value, but if you have tons of money to blow and/or want a special edition, the i7 8086k is at least as good.Comparable only to the more than twice the price AMD Thread Riper 1950X in gaming and desktop performance, but cannot compare as a workstation (as the TR has 16 cores and 32 threads).Gaming Example: GTA V Ultra running at ~15-35% CPU usage with peaks of 40-50%. (With factory overclocked Zotac 1080 Ti)

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsI am one very happy customer. i7-8700k @ 5
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2017
Reviews: Having the i7-4790k I waited for a few generations before upgrading my CPU. I was waiting for the right time to upgrade and I bought the i7-8700k w/ Aorus Gaming 7 Combo after waiting for years.It took a while to get the CPU after I bought it but it finally arrived. Patience paid off, I am one very happy customer.i7-8700k @ 5.0GHz - 4133 DDR4 RAM RGB TridentZ Ram w/ Aorus Gaming 7Overclocking:All I had to do was go into BIOS and enable 5.0GHz mode and enable Memory XMP and I was setup within minutes, I couldn't believe it.Performance in games:Don't expect to get 20-30+ FPS increases in all gamesOverwatch I bumped up 25-35FPS I run 1440p 150% Render Resolution at Max at a constant 144fpsDestiny 2 bumped up 5-10 frames in some areas and 20 fps other areas, definitely could notice and tell the difference between CPUsAnother important thing, I can finally watch things on my 2nd monitor (netflix, cabletv, etc.) without visible gaming performance impact. Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsi7 8700k by far my most favorite processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2021
Reviews: this processor is a an animal would never recommend doing this but i like messing with stuff dont try it as you could destroy it im sure that being said highest clock setting i got it to go to was 6 Ghz or 6.2 i believe could have been more but cpu failure or some dumb shit happened still works awesome dont do this tho lol thats hard on it we were at 90 or 92 c when it said that i run mine max frequency 5ghz daily minum is at 4.3 ghz i want to upgrade to get the i9 but afraid it wont be as promising but this processor is solid if your wanting to game or doing coding this handles a decent load im not sure how it would handle streaming and gaming at the same time will have to try sometime

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsMost excellent CPU, but as others have said
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2018
Reviews: Edit 9/19/23:Still running this beast 5 years later. Yeah, it’s about time for an upgrade, but this thing still runs practically any game. With a 280mm AIO cooler, heavy gaming doesn’t break 65c now. I feel I was too tough in the temps 5 years ago.Original review:Most excellent CPU, but as others have said, I have to knock off a star for how hot this thing runs. Intel's "toothpaste" between the die and heatspreader is just not acceptable. A powerful cooler or a delid is a must, especially if overclocking, to maintain comfortable temps.At first I used my old Hyper 212, and at stock settings this thing could reach 80c if pushed hard enough. No room for overclocking. Opted for a Noctua D15s, and things are very much under control now (iirc a short Aida64 cpu+fpu stress peaked around 75c but backed off to around 65-70). I'm still not comfortable overclocking unless I delid, but that's not something I've ever done before.Overall I'm impressed with performance though. I plan to keep this in my computer for quite a few years.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat choice. Purchased to add to my son's first gaming build.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2022
Reviews: For what we paid vs what we got was superb. The unit is allot better than what he had and you can really tell the difference, paired with an awesome cooler it is great. The price was hard to beat and the fact that it arrived several days earlier than expected added to this all around great purchase. Would definitely recommend for anyone's first gaming build, can handle that and beyond.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2018
Reviews: Amazing processor.  I paired this with a ASRock z370 Taichi and Noctua NH D-15. My chip overclocked easily to 5.0GHz @ 1.29 volts LLC level 2 (no delid). I got quite lucky with the silicon lottery on this one as I've read a good number of chips require 1.35v+ for a stable 5.0GHz.  Temps are 30-35 idle and 55-65 while gaming.  Coming from an i7 4770k I wouldn't say the difference is day and night but definitely noticeable. Roughly 10-20 FPS gains in BF1 and PUBG.  It seems to help keep the minimum FPS at a higher and more stable level, especially in PUBG.  Cinebench CPU score came in at 1650.  I don't do any other CPU intensive tasks such as video encoding or rendering so I can't comment on the real world performance there.  I realize this may have been overkill for strictly gaming, but I wanted to have the option available in the future.  Definitely recommend but do note it will require a z370 motherboard.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2018
Reviews: I build P.C.'s for 24+yrs and I built a Ryzen(1700x) last summer & a  new intel P.C. this summer.I will give the edge to intel because if you get this I highly recommend getting the ASUS ROG STRIX Z370-E GAMING LGA1151The difference as I bnuilt many PC every month for all types of people but the main difference is the AMD Ryzen is very subborn with ram &* overclocking and the intel isnt and you can use many, many different modelks & get 3200mhz.I own g.skill & decided to see if the ripjaw 5 @3200 would do 3200 w/o any problem & on the intel it worked flawless witrh just clicking one option in bios & that is xmp profile 1. that is how easy. On the ryzen it wouldn't but it should as it is more satubborn ( i know you can buy the flare X ) I am talking about 3200 with the ripjaw 5. anyway this is a great cpu and I managed to get all 6 cores stable under load at 5.0 ghz.great cpu for gaming & other video software.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsI really like what I have done.  And I would do it anain if I could.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2018
Reviews: I am impressed.  I don't even use this computer to do very much anymore.  I brouse the web.  And play DVDs, as I don't even have a real DVD player for my living room TV.  And I still get to do some Photoshop projects.  As, I, get to be the go to whenever a book is needed at my church.  And I really did not expect to see very much difference.  As I was coming from an 6700k.  And even today, I cannot be sure if this added snappy-ness is from the extra 2 cores I have now, or the 3200 MHz ram I have now.  Either way, I feel it was worth my investment.  And the biggest part was that I had to buy a new motherboard.  The new architecture will not preform on the old 1151 boards.  So, that is another $250, plus an operation on this rig.  But, it was STILL worth it.  Snappy, snappy, snappy.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat device - highly recommended
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2018
Reviews: Thank God for AMD getting themselves back in the game.The i7 lineup has been somewhat "meh" for years, and in my opinion the i5, overclocked, has been the best option for gaming.But AMD putting pressure on Intel has now given us two more physical cores on the i7, and this is an excellent device.  I'm not an overclocker, so I didn't get the K version, but the 8700 is a great device.  It runs noticeably cooler than the 7700 in a friends PC (the transistor pitch is bigger on the 8700, making it's thermal characteristics better, but it's on a bigger die).I play a lot of simulations, where the processor is generally the bottleneck (it doesn't matter how fast your graphics board is, if the processor can't calculate the physics fast enough, you're frame rate will drop), but this brute forces it's way through.I'm extremely impressed with this.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsIt works fine. It's overpriced, like all Inter CPUs.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2019
Reviews: Typical wildly overpriced Intel CPU, but works fine. This thing should sell for $150 if Intel had any competition (AMD is not competition, no matter what anyone says - too many little gotchas to be usable).I did not buy the overclockable version because I don't care about that. However, I did get an aftermarket cooling solution because like all the Intel "we include a fan" coolers, the one that came with this was underpowered and LOUD. I wanted a pretty much silent machine, and you can't do that with Intel's coolers while also maintaining decent cooling.And one last thing: You can't install Windows 7 while running this CPU. However, you can boot a drive with Windows 7 on it, and it will run long enough to do a Windows 10 update. Just don't let it go online while running Windows 7 - it will crash instantly.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat upgrade from previous intel processors
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2019
Reviews: So far so good, this thing is a beast.  I upgraded from a Core i5 7500 which I used mainly for office work and some training.  I wanted to get into PC gaming so I decided to upgrade some components.  This is an extremely worthy upgrade from the 7500 and loving the multi threading.Went with the 8700K over the 9700K because of the multithreading as I may need some workstation functionality in the near future.  Paired it with an ASUS Tuf Z390 Gaming Plus motherboard and it was easily overclocked to 5GHz and was stable for a short time.  Whether or not that speed has any longevity, I have no idea yet.  Even at stock speed it is clearly much, much faster and more efficient than the 7500 (apples to oranges comparison, but still).Would suggest to anyone looking for an upgrade at a reasonable price/performance purchase

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBar-none this CPU is the best bang for the buck out there
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2018
Reviews: Bar-none this CPU is the best bang for the buck out there.  Best single thread execution speed available prior to the 8086K (think X-Plane), and performs very well for multi-threaded applications as well.  High end I7s and I9s with higher core counts or quad-channel memory that even come close to this CPU in single threaded execution speed cost twice as much and require much more expensive motherboards (and at least 4 sticks of RAM $$ to achieve the performance boost of quad channel).  Overclockers:  the 8086K is basically a binned version of this CPU with some of the clock speed settings opened up.  That means that if you are thinking about finding a new 8700K that will do a stable OC past about 4.8GHz, forget it.  Intel has already snagged them and put the 8086K label on them at a price premium (genius, in my book).  Go and pay the Man...

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2023
Reviews: Still running strong, never overclocked and plays 2023 titles with ease. (paired with a 1080TI)

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPower - With more untapped
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2018
Reviews: Out of the box, stock, the 8700k is a beast. Currently, I use it to game as well as stream, concurrently. I've noticed in the past that this combination really bogged down the system. Where transcodes were skipping frames and the quality needed to be turned down.Long gone are those days. I'm able to game at 4K while transcoding videos for streaming. The leap from 4 to 6 cores is immediately noticeable during multi-tasking (6 physical w/o HT). The speed at which these handles task makes me grin.I have paired the 8700K with an EVGA Z370 FTW motherboard. This combination, with my H100i cooler, has allowed me to overclock this bad boy with INCREDIBLE ease. The CPU can easily sustain 5Ghz.With the 9-Gen CPUS literally around the corner, perhaps these will fall down in price. The 8700K is an incredibly capable processor and should not be overlooked.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2018
Reviews: Awesome CPU.I was a bit wary of purchasing this CPU as I already had a 6700k @4.7GHz. I though that for gaming the new CPU may be a side-grade, or even not as fast in some games. However, I have been very happy with the performance, as I am getting better performance in almost every game, except the few unoptimized ones, but even those are less than 10% slower with the stock settings, just at stock it has 0 trouble running anything at all. Heavy multi-tasking is a breeze. I can watch Netflix or Youtube, while on voice chat programs, in game, with no hit to performance whatsoever. Not to mention running simulations take no time at all, where it took several seconds to do on my 6700k, it does in a fraction of a second on my 8700k.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2018
Reviews: The media could not be loaded.The attached video shows the unboxing of this processor.The technical stuff is listed above, and I talked a little bit about it in the video.After getting my system built, and the testing I have done this far (not to mention the gaming I've been doing), all I can really say is "WOW".  What an upgrade from the 4790K that I've been using.  Which...importantly enough, is no slouch. But just everything about the system seems to be running so much better and faster with this processor.The i9 series is coming soon.  I am sure they will be better/faster.  But for now, this is an awesome value, and overall, just a great processor!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest i7 chip i ever owned
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2019
Reviews: this has to be the best cpu i owned tbh i only have the 8700K and the 4790K. this is a really good chip but it has issues that i don't like very much. 1. it gets super hot at 1080p gaming 77-85c seems to be common but i do start to worry when it gets that high (cough cough AC Odyssey). other games run fine and i can do Medium to High settings on games well that is mainly my gpu but it is bottlenecking my cpu (gtx 980).productivity is great on this chip i can make videos and render them way faster than my old 4790K.Rendering 1080p 30 Minute Video:4790K - 2 Hours - 2 1/2 Hours8700K - 30 Minutes - 40 MinutesStreaming is also way better on this chip

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsi am sure this could easily be solved by a better graphics card or more ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2018
Reviews: the corner stone of my new pc build  have not even kept it over clocked.  but on a cheap aftermarket cooler it was up to 5.6ghz.  all overclocking done with the motherboard auto feature.  turned off the over clocking due to video encoding seemed between over clocked and encoding the temps would get too high and the system would reboot.  at the stock speeds it don't have that issue don't get past high 70's low 80's when full usage during encoding.i am sure this could easily be solved bya better graphics card or more rammaybe another fan to help pull off the heat (have a coolmaster tower cooler has a place for a fan on the back side as wellor better yet if your comfortable (which i am not) liquid cooling

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsVery nice CPU, but as been stated many times - ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2018
Reviews: Very nice CPU, but as been stated many times - CPU can get hot....so above adequate cooling is needed especially when overclocking. Another point to make when taking other poster's review is ambient temps, are you in a 3rd or 4th floor apartment? do you or do you not have central air? These are all important factors when OC'ing and getting good temp's. One person saying they are running 5Hz and getting 60c on load must live in a igloo or spent a lot of money on a custom water loop. So take those temp's with a grain of salt. All in all a nice CPU but if you cannot afford going with a 8700k then there is the i5 8600k or even go with the AMD Ryzen 1700. All great CPU's for the money...good luck!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsI cannot be happier!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2018
Reviews: EDIT: By the way - the chip arrived NOT SEALED. Looks like it was opened then sent back. I took the risk, because I did not notice thermal paste, and all the items were in the box untouched.Simply put, this is a monster. I originally ordered a Ryzen 5 for my next major upgrade,and upon install,I was not happy with it. So I sent everything back and bought this instead. The performance blew me away. This should serve me well for years to come,like my old trusty CPU which lasted 7 years (which I still plan to use - it still works just fine). I cannot be happier.The downside is the lack of a stock fan and heatsink. For the money I spent on this thing, I am sure Intel can afford to throw in a fan and heatsink. Cheap chaps, they are.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat CPU that lasts
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2023
Reviews: Bought this 5-6 years ago and it still runs great. Just as powerful as current generations.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsReceived What Looks Like A Previously Used Product
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2018
Reviews: It may not be visible in the attached photo, but the CPU I received looks used. There's what looks like dust particles all over and inside the plastic holding the processor itself.I am very skeptical, but am leaving this review at 1 star until my PC case arrives to test if it will even work. I paid good money for a new product, not some used/refurbished bullshit.EDIT: The CPU has been fine for these couple months and has not died on me. This thing is such a beast, but of course can get hot. Especially in a small form factor PC. It's almost a necessity to delid, which I have done. Either that or use an AIO.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis is a great choice for a CPU, this will boost your overall gaming performance tenfold!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2018
Reviews: This was a huge upgrade!Previously I had an Intel - Core i5 - 4460 3.2GHz quad-core processor which I paid around about $200 for. It was a good CPU for its price, but I was looking for something a little bit better after a while. After saving up a bit of money, I was able to purchase this CPU. After using it for one day, I knew that this was a very good purchase. I'm not getting as much stuttering as I used to, games are starting to run a little bit smoother. And overall a really good processor! Also, had the time of my purchasing, it comes with a free copy of Call of Duty - Black Ops 4 which was an awesome addition!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat for new computer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2018
Reviews: Great for new computer:CPU Intel - Core i7-8700K 3.7GHz 6-Core Processor $347.89 @ AmazonCPU Cooler Cooler Master - Hyper 212 EVO 82.9 CFM Sleeve Bearing CPU Cooler $22.50 @ AmazonMotherboard Asus - Prime Z370-A ATX LGA1151 Motherboard $169.06 @ AmazonMemory Crucial - Ballistix Sport LT 32GB (2 x 16GB) DDR4-2400 Memory $319.72 @ AmazonStorage Samsung - 860 Evo 1TB M.2-2280 Solid State Drive $219.99 @ AmazonVideo Card Asus - GeForce GTX 1060 3GB 3GB Phoenix Fan Edition Video Card $233.99 @ AmazonCase Corsair - Air 540 ATX Mid Tower Case $119.99 @ AmazonPower Supply EVGA - SuperNOVA G3 650W 80+ Gold Certified Fully-Modular ATX Power Supply $89.99 @ AmazonCase Fan Noctua - NF-A14 PWM 82.5 CFM 140mm Fan $21.95 @ Amazon

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsgreat cpu advertised boost clock may not be accurate for some people
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2018
Reviews: single core boost up to 4.5 ghz all cores can boost to 4.4 ghz on asrock z370 killer i heard it depends on the mobo you have but you may not get the full 4.6 ghz on some lower cost boards. with a hyper 212 evo cooler at full load after a hour it runs around 65c tho most games only put this cpu at 20 - 40% load keeping the temp well below 60c. overall this things a monster i was using a i5 4690k it would hit 100% load in alot of games and bottleneck this cpu tho i've tried rise of tomb raider witcher 3 and alot of other demanding games and with dx 12 this cpu will not go over 40% load on any game i try.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat CPU, owned for over a year with no problems
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2020
Reviews: I had bought this cpu sometime in the fall of 2018 and it's not failed me. It runs cool, is stable and does all I need for it to do and more. I can run most software and games without any hitch. I can see some life on this cpu for some years to come, despite more advanced cpus being available right now. I've been happy with it and has proved its worth many times over. However, one may be better off getting the newer core i7s or core i9s over this one if building a new rig. Having said that, you can't go wrong with this cpu.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars1% lows are much higher leading to overall a much better experience believe it or not even though I'm using ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2018
Reviews: This processor dominates I came from a fx8350 overlooked to 4.9 ghz to this processor for gaming there is a huge difference not in over all higher frames per second I would say but my 1% and .1% lows are much higher leading to overall a much better experience believe it or not even though I'm using a conventional harddrive I can tell this thing is a bit more responsive  my noquada d15 got a stable overlook of 4.9  I could get 5.0 but I had to pump so much power into the chip I wanted nothing to do with it I'd consider my cpu as far as overclocking ever so slightly above average some have gotten to 5.0  or higher the worst I've herd was 4.7

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSolid CPU for gaming.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020
Reviews: Purchased this back in May 2018. Has been good to me for two years. It is common knowledge that there is an Intel tax & their chips run hot, however if you are able to find this for $250 or less you’re getting a great deal. Ryzen has made great strides, but if you purchased this from when it first released you may want to hold onto it for a bit longer. I have it undervolted so it generates less heat, and have water cooled it as well. I’m sure this will last me another 2-3 years before I make the jump to Ryzen.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsVery fast and solid buy for the price.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018
Reviews: Was getting into more VM work and needed more cores than my 6th gen i5 had to support them all. This did the trick. This is lightning fast on multi-core intensive processes. Never even breaks a sweat when gaming. Annihilates video processing. Does everything I need it to do and does it well. I don't both with overclocking components anymore since most processors can 10-20% overclock stock as long as they are cool enough. This one is pinned at a 20% overclock when under load since I have a lot of cooling for my case. Never been let down with my Intel CPU  and this one is no exception. Always recommend this as a solid CPU buy.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIncredible processor, stable & cool at 4.9GHz on all cores.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2018
Reviews: This is an amazing processor.Gigabyte Z370 Aorus Gaming 7 using Corsair H110i v2 liquid cooler:Easily overclocked mine to 4.9GHz using Gigabyte's Auto-Tune (via EasyTune app) feature on all 6 cores.At 4.9GHz on all cores, temperatures range from 25C-44C, while gaming it ranges from 35-44C... I've seen one core get up to 48C a few times but that's it. Have never seen it hit 50C.Voltage on mobo seems to stick around 1.2V, and I think I saw it get up to 1.24V once... but much lower than I expected!Could I OC it further on my own? Sure... but why? I love that it runs at 4.9 easy and cool for me, and am perfectly happy with its performance.Excellent chip Intel, thank you!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSmaller box then expected, 8086k certificate included, great CPU, fast speed, happy I got this instead of 8700k
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2018
Reviews: Coming from an i7 2600K overclocked at 4.5GHz, I expected only a mild increase in speed. That 8086K to me feels about 50% faster then my older overclocked system. Everything is fast and responsive as it should be and I have lots of overclocking headroom. The nicest thing for me is the CPU temp, which went from around 60 degrees when idle to now 37 degrees at idle and a mere 50 under full load, and my CPU fan speed is still not maxed out. Planning on overclocking to 5GHz on all cores soon, and eventually more. For this purpose I'm glad I have a 8086K and not a 8700K. Intel's binning process guarantees that 8086K will run at minimum 5GHz on all 6 cores.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2018
Reviews: I bought a k-unlocked processor in the past (6600k) but chose to go with a locked one for no real reason this time, other than the imperceptible ~4% performance gain at the cost of my risking messing up my brand new processor made me decide to try the locked processor.  I could care less about where I rank in synthetic benchmark software and there's virtual no "feelable" real life difference between the 8700 and 8700k, so that was my choice this time around.  The improvement over the 4c/4t 6600k I was running at 4.1ghz is substantial, and I can stream in OBS while still pulling full FPS in all my usual games (PUBG, CSGO, etc.).  Very happy with it.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2018
Reviews: If you're here then you probably already know this CPU's reputation so I don't think I need to say much more. I'm using a cyorig H7 to cool it (at stock clock speeds) and that works fine, at 100% load it reaches around 60c but I rarely have it at full load as I'm not rendering video or anything. In all gaming scenarios so far, including PS3 emulation, it hasn't gone over 50c even with ambient temperatures varying between 24c and 30c throughout the day. I'm sure with overclocking that would change, and I'll probably get a more capable cooler for when I do (eventually) decide to overclock but air cooled temperatures, even with a relatively cheap air cooler are perfectly fine.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsNo support for Windows XP, 7, or 8 Operating Systems, Only Windows 10
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2018
Reviews: I did not like the fact that Intel and Microsoft decided to support only Windows Operating System 10. Both companies no longer provide hardware and software support for any other Windows based Operating System.  This is not stated on the Intel Processors i7-8700 and up with Intel and Microsoft not stating that fact anywhere in Advertisements or packaging.  That information is only available on their websites in the requirements and/or specifications that the general Amazon purchaser needs to know up front since it requires both products users to completely upgrade all hardware and software if they want to upgrade either product, Windows 10 or as mentioned Intel CPU's in the 8th Generation and beyond.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2019
Reviews: Great chip. I bought this for my first ever PC build. I followed all instructions and it was fairly simple to install with limited knowledge. I bought my 8700k before the 9th gen i-series chips came out. The 6/12 c/t are great. I've had no buyer's remorse with this chip. I've managed to hit a solid 4.9Ghz OC with this chip work an air cooler (Dark Rock TF). ~35c idle, and 82c peak on load with a 3jr stress test. Gaming temperatures are around 62c in demanding games (BFV, R6 Siege, Overwatch).Pros:- No bottleneck- Good [average] consumer multi-taskerCons:- Silicon lottery, not everyone's chip will be the same.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsFast and stable CPU
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2019
Reviews: Bought with a ASUS ROG B360-G motherboard about a year ago now. The CPU is fast and works great, both in games but also in photo and video editing. Value-wise, Ryzen is the better buy I feel, but I had issues trying to use 1st-gen Ryzen so I had decided to switch back to Intel, hence this i7-8700. I set the motherboard to keep the CPU at 4.3GHz (max all-core turbo) during heavy workloads, which is about the best "fake overclock" you can do on this CPU, and with the B360 chipset. Cooling the CPU is a CRYORIG M9i cooler I already owned.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsit doesn't come with a cooler
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2018
Reviews: this cpu being as it is amazing sadly does not come with a stander cpu cooler and fan like older ones did understanding a stock cooler is not the best but i couldn't use it till i got one in the mail 2 days later so the entire build was useless and not known if it was going to work right away was a bit stressful but it did thankfully other than that with the right cooler the cpu can run over clocked at low temps and even on its bas 3.7Hz clock runs very good and had no issue with it

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2018
Reviews: I choose this processor to finally update my old 4770K (@4.3Ghz) living room gaming pc.  For 1080p@60Hz gaming with a GTX1060 of course there is almost no difference in game performance, but I plan on keeping this one for a while.I've settled on an easy 5Ghz all core+cache overclock at 1.25volts with 4.7Ghz AVX and haven't seen above 71C using a H110i cooler at 20C ambient and 30C to 32C water... ran some Cinebench runs and an hour of prime95 along with a couple hours of gaming with no issues (and stayed under 71C).  Trying to run prime95 with 5Ghz AVX would result in a blue screen after ~75C unless I had the voltage at 1.32v...but then temps rose above 80C.  I will be delidding this one...

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2019
Reviews: If you are looking to upgrade your CPU this i7-8700 will not let you down. I got it for my personal rig as it was my first build and I am not interested in overclocking so didnt need the "K" version. It it does everything and then some excellent for gaming if anything its overkill for gaming and for doing multiple tasks its a great choice.I used to hate not being able to have  multiple chrome tabs open while streaming or doing other stuff on my i5. However I can say this was a great buy and if you go this route you wont regret it.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2018
Reviews: I have two HEDT computer builds, one is the 5930 K with 1080 SLI and now an 8700 K with two 1080 TI’s. It’s pretty funny because the 5930 K can keep up and hold it own pretty much to the 8700 K.  I did try to go with Amd In the end I guess I’m an Intel fanboy,  because Intel just puts out amazing central processing units and I will always be building Intel from now on.  I do wish AMD’s X3 99 chipset wasn’t such a huge mess it’s starting to get better but in the end I’m staying with Intel and this processor is freaking amazing especially for overclocking.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat CPU for Gaming but Overpriced!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2018

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2018
Reviews: I waited a while to replace my old i7 processor (1st gen)  I almost bought the 8700k but glad I waited.  I ordered this 8086k as soon as it was announced.  I have an Aorus Gaming 5 motherboard with Corsair !6Gb RAM, Corsair Hydra H75 water cooler.  I have a 8Gb RX480 Nitro video card.  I’m not a gamer, I’m a photographer so Lightroom and Photoshop performance is my concern.  Let me tell you it’s fantastic.  Imports, previews, exports are lightning fast.  Best choice for me by far.  I obtain 5Ghz without any effort at all and stays a cool 29-34 degrees Celsius.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsA heavyweight CPU for OC and Gaming
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2018
Reviews: If you already own the 8700k your waste your money on upgrade to the 9th generation This 8700k run very fast and with a good cooling water solution you can OC this beat to 5.1 Ghz at 1.35v with good stable temperature as I did , I get in idle 34 degrees celsius and full load all cores around 77-79 degrees celsius.  This CPU for gaming and programs than use no more than 2 to 4 cores is the king of mainstream . The only downside is the price , it will be a very heavy weight to compete with Ryzen 2700x on the price range

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis CPU is very excellent performing tasks is flawless no lags or delays
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2018
Reviews: I have brought and installed this product already into my motherboard. This CPU is very excellent performing tasks is flawless no lags or delays.Summary of the performance:-High clock sped base runs at 4.5 GHz constant on high performance mode.-Able to run 3 dfifferent files on around 4GB each being compressed into a ZIP file at the same time. Along with running mutiple tabs on browsers.-Extremely fast CPU runs at 50 degrees no overheating.-Handles video editing very well for basic cutting video clips in a couple of seconds.Thsi is an overall amazing CPU chip and would recommend it to anyone is after a very fast CPU.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsMaybe pricey, but it's actually great.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2019
Reviews: I got so used to working on my PC with this processor I almost forgot how slow other PCs can be. I use my PC for development and I run a lot of heavy processing code on it, never felt lagging behind.I used this to build Android OS from source-code and it took about 40 minutes for 100% clean build. Any modifications thereafter usually take about 2-3 minutes.I also use my PC for gaming and quite frankly I don't feel like there is a game it can't handle well in combination with my GTX 1080.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2018
Reviews: I did try the 9700K, came back to the 8700K hyper thread processor, my applications were sluggish with the 9700K even overclocked to 5.0 ghz.I guess if you’re into core heavy games only it would work for you, for the applications and gaming I do this is hands down  the best all-around processor at this time and price point.You’ll need an appropriate AIO or larger air cooler to support the CPU.There is a reason this sells so well...all-around flat-out performance!Run this all day at 5.0 ghz and when needed absolute stability at 5.1 ghz with the ASUS Maximus XI code motherboard.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsI am happy with the build
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2018
Reviews: I used this to build a mini itx gaming rig. I am happy with the build. I didn't realize it was an 8700, not an 8700k until after I got it. Totally my fault. I wish I had paid more attention to this so I could attempt to over clock it. But that being said, it runs all the games I currently have 10 times better than the old xeon I had in my last rig. It wasn't meant for gaming though.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsHandles video transcoding quite well
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2018
Reviews: I waited four generations of Intel i7 CPUs to upgrade and it was so worth it! I didn't bother to get the unlocked version of this CPU because I don't overclock and I am still so impressed with this CPU. I use Handbrake to transcode video and this is so much faster than my i7 3770S. I will have this CPU running for many hours at 100% load and there are no issues using the stock CPU cooler. I can even browse the wed while this CPU is at full load. I couldn't do this with my 3770S.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 1.0 out of 5 starsDefective CPU— Atrocious warranty support cost me a customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020
Reviews: I had this thing for two years before it died. No overclocking, not even once, and it stayed below 60 for hardcore gaming.It died. So I sent it back to Intel for the warranty...Do you know how long it took to get a response? FOURTEEN DAYS. It took my package 5 or so days to get to Louisville from Houston, then they didn’t respond so I had to call them demanding information as to what happened.The response? “We found your returned product, it was DEFECTIVE. We’ll try fixing it.”Waited another two days. Got an e-mail at 2:00 AM(when I’m asleep so I don’t see this until a third day), days that can’t give me another i7-8700K.Their offer? A minor upgrade to a 9700k.I needed the CPU, so I took it.It took a WEEK for it to arrive. No priority mail, no communication nothing of the sort.Intel has the most incompetent warranty team possible to exist. Customer service was nice and they helped me as best as they can, but I am going to call their manager and ask them “Why did this happen, and what are you going to do to ensure this never happens again to anyone?”I waited four weeks, a MONTH to get a replacement, when the website and everyone else said at most it’d take 7 business days.This instantly made me reconsider ever purchasing another Intel product and I may migrate over to AMD.Also, I lost a customer because I need my PC to edit and make voice lines.Thanks, Intel. You owe me a lot more than a measly upgrade.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 3.0 out of 5 starsI am still a fan of Intel but this experience has definitely left a bad taste in my mouth
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2018
Reviews: I struggled for close to 3 weeks, trying to get my computer operational, going through three motherboards and two PSUs, dealing with amazon and ASUS customer service, waiting days at a time before I could take the next troubleshooting step thanks to snail mail before I thought to switch out my intel brand CPU. Which turned out to be the problem. What does that say about the brand? It certainly says I trusted it more than I probably should. But at the same time it speaks to the quality Intel is known for. Now that I've received the second CPU my computer is running flawlessly. I've yet to try overclocking but my temperatures are exceedingly stable while gaming and multitasking. I guess this means I was a statistical anomaly and such things are bound to happen. Overall, I am still a fan of Intel but this experience has definitely left a bad taste in my mouth.TL;DR: Got sent a bad CPU. The second one works like a charm.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2019
Reviews: With a nice $100 Noctua air cooler you can destroy all your friends in benchmarks. Probably the best cpu next to the i9-9900k that you can buy. I can stream at higher quality than all my friends and get a little higher fps than most of them. Its fantastic. Best cpu I have had in my 20 years of gaming. COOLING IS KEY IF YOU DONT BUY A REALLY NICE AIR COOLER DONT EVEN BUY THIS. I was able to overclock mine to 4.7 without even touching voltage.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-8700 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA 1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2019
Reviews: It hauls ass. It is a powerhouse. Not much else to say. It is a good CPU and the best part it is a INTEL not some second rate CPU. Intel is the only way to go. Ive been building PC's since mid 1980's. For compatibility with other hardware, speed, durability, bang for the buck...you cant beat intel hands down. You get what you pay for remember that. Want to build a cheap PC? Then expect to get cheap results. Just that simple period!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-3570 Quad-Core Processor 3.4 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80637I53570
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2013
Reviews: This chip for high end games is awesome! It has more than enough power to eliminate the cpu as any kind of bottleneck for modern games. You can certainly buy a more powerful chip but i will tell you that i have not found a need for anything more powerful. I use it to game and transcode video. My only SMALL gripe is that it does run a little warm with the stock cooler. I know you can buy aftermarket coolers and all but i didn't buy the k series for a reason i just want to put the chip in with stock parts and have it run relatively cool even under load. It's not terrible and isn't at alarming temps it would just be nice to run a tad cooler. Overall though awesome chip for the money and you should be set for a little while.
