Product Title: Intel Core i5-3570 Quad-Core Processor 3.4 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80637I53570
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsOne of my best buys
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2014
Reviews: I upgraded from Pentium G620 and the difference is H-U-G-E ! 4 cores @ 3400 Mhz with a sweet overclocked gtx 660 gpu and my custom-built PC is just the gaming machine I needed. Definitely recommended for those who don't want to do overclocking and experimenting. Cheaper than the K version, newer model, and their only difference is that the K has better integrated graphics and is able to overclock. Also this cpu has some extra features the K version doesn't. And btw integrated graphics suck anyway.P.S: For those of you who chose to upgrade to this cpu and are using windows 7 , make sure after the installation, that your cpu is running on 4 cores. Sometimes the system can't read more than 1 core if the previous cpu was 1 core. Google for more information ;) hope i helped !

Product Title: Intel Core i5-3570 Quad-Core Processor 3.4 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80637I53570
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazing chip for the price
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2012
Reviews: Bought this as a compromise to the higher i7's and saved a lot of money.Still extremely pleased with this product.  All of my games just scream, and most of the time using only 20% of the CPU's total power.  Compressing a 2GB fraps avi video down into a 3 minute clip used to take 2 hours; now it takes about 6 minutes.  Combined with the board, ram and video card I have, I'm seeing an average of 100fps in games.Diablo 3, WoW and Battlefield are ten times more playable.  Loving it.  For $200 you can't go wrong.  I didn't buy the "K" version because I don't overclock; fried my hardware once and it wasn't fun.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-3570 Quad-Core Processor 3.4 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80637I53570
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2012
Reviews: Very fast CPU.  Upgraded from a Core 2 Duo and it was quite the jump in performance.I use this PC for internet browsing, email and P2P file downloads so I barely tax the capability.Processor idles at 32 degrees with the stock heat sink and fan.  My motherboard defaults the CPU fan to max speed...so the fan noise was quite noticeable.  I turned on smart fan in the bios and now the typical rpms are about half of max....and the fan can't be heard. At idle I didn't notice any difference in CPU temps running the fan at max (2000) or half of that.All in all a great improvement in PC power.....

Product Title: Intel Core i5-3570 Quad-Core Processor 3.4 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80637I53570
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWorks as expected. very quickly.

Since I'm not overclocking, I went with the stock heat sink and fan.  I'd heard the fan can be quite loud, but I don't feel that it's very noticeable at all except when first booting up the computer.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-3570 Quad-Core Processor 3.4 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80637I53570
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest Bang for your buck

Product Title: Intel Core i5-3570 Quad-Core Processor 3.4 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80637I53570
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat value. Does Everything Well.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2015
Reviews: It rocks "Second Life" and Google Earth, Video Editing etc. AND you don't have to worry about leaving your email open or browser tabs, etc.I was a little surprised that Second Life almost pegs one of the cores on a steady basis, but it seems to work ok. I am thinking that there might be some glitch in the viewer, since my Pentium G640 started to peg earlier, which is why I upgraded.Otherwise it tears through anything I sick it on.The one MAJOR issue I had was not the fault of the CPU, but an obscure setting in my HP P6-2220t, which came with a dual core cpu (Pent.G640)It only allowed 2 cores to function. "Task Manager" only saw 2. "Speccy" only saw 2, Etc. I thought I had a dud and was attempting to return it when I learned something;There is a setting that limits the machine to 2 cores. It is located in Run/Msconfig/boot/advanced options. MAKE sure that the little box "number of processors" is NOT CHECKED!!!!!  If it is, then uncheck it and reboot. Then you will be using all 4 cores !  -BA

Product Title: Intel Core i5-3570 Quad-Core Processor 3.4 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80637I53570
Review Date: Reviewed in Italy on August 26, 2015
Reviews: Questo processore è oramai 'vecchio' secondo gli standard del mondo PC ma vi assicuro che è ancora una bomba , che non sfigura minimamente coi fratelli più giovani (4570 - 4670 e 4690) anzi le prestazioni sono quasi identiche , cambia solo il supporto a nuove funzioni che questo non ha ed una gpu integrata molto più performante, ma veramente poca roba . Quindi un acquisto ideale per chiunque voglia un quad-core performante ed ha ancora un socket 1155 (senza perforza andarsi a buttare su un i7 che costa almeno 100€ in più).Segnalo anche che con determinate schede madri Z77 (solo Z77 e alcune Z68) è possibile applicare un overclock leggero (sia automatico in alcune schede sia manuale) nonostante il processore non sia K , a patto ovviamente di avere un buon dissipatore, anche se ad essere sinceri , io lo uso con il dissipatore stock, l'overclock ho provato solo per vedere a quanto poteva arrivare (4,2 Ghz), ma con frequenze stock non scalda poi tanto , in piena estate mi ha raggiunto al massimo i 65 gradi dopo 3/4 ore di gioco.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-3570 Quad-Core Processor 3.4 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80637I53570
Review Date: Reviewed in Spain on January 17, 2013
Reviews: Este procesador es el "compañero" del i5 3570K: la principal diferencia entre los dos es que los procesadores de la serie K tienen el multiplicador desbloqueado para que, en placas que cuenten con soporte para overclocking (casi todas las de gama media en adelante) puedas subir la frecuencia base y variar el multiplicador con el que se obtiene la frecuencia de funcionamiento del procesador.Hay, sin embargo más diferencias: los procesadores i5 3570, sin K, soportan tres tecnologías orientadas a la virtualización y seguridad por hardware más Hyper Threading. Las cuatro tecnologías son: Intel vPro para implementar sobre todo la seguridad por cifrado en las comunicaciones, Intel VT-d para la virtualización de interfaces de entrada/salida que mejora el rendimiento de dispositivos de comunicación virtuales, Intel TXT para ejecución cifrada de código indispensable para usar un TPM e Hyper Threading, que contextualiza la caché del procesador desdoblando cada núcleo físico de la CPU en dos virtuales. Es interesante observar que estas características están directamente traídas de la gama Xeon de procesadores para workstation y servidores, y que puede ser muy interesante para entornos de trabajo donde sean necesarias, como redes VPN seguras o entornos de desarrollo. Como este procesador es para el socket 1155, puede instalarse en una placa del año pasado para Sandy Bridge sin problemas, a costa de no tener soporte para PCI Express 3.0 ni soporte nativo para USB 3.0.Y en cuanto al rendimiento en sí de este procesador es, por supuesto, espectacular. En una época donde los procesadores son cada vez más potentes y es más difícil que se queden obsoletos para uso real (un Intel Core i5 760, por ejemplo, sigue siendo una CPU de cuatro núcleos más que solvente y lleva más de dos años en el mercado) comprar un i5 es una apuesta segura. Por supuesto, el que lo quiera para jugar debe mirar el de la serie K y aunque no se tenga ni idea de hacer overclocking, usar la función automática que incluyen la enorme mayoría de placas base con chipsets de gama media en adelante y subir el procesador de frecuencia cómodamente hasta 4,1-4,3 GHz sin necesidad de usar ningún componente especia, sólo un ventilador decente. Si se cuenta con un presupuesto muy ajustado, este procesador puede suponer un ahorro de 20€ respecto del K, y hacer atractiva su compra sólo por eso. En cualquier caso, subiendo la frecuencia o no, con este procesador tendrás CPU para rato.Por supuesto, las características de los i7 también pueden animar a los entusiastas pero dada la diferencia de precio con los 3770 yo no lo recomiendo. He probado los dos 3770, con K y el modelo normal, y prefiero sin dudarlo adquirir un i5 3570 y gastar la diferencia en otros componentes. La temperatura, que también preocupa mucho en Internet, es algo superior a la de un procesador 2500K de la generación anterior pero no es nada preocupante. Lamentablemente, los procesadores de AMD ya no son una alternativa, porque como la mayoría de aplicaciones usan uno y a los sumo dos núcleos físicos, estos procesadores rinden mucho mejor que los comparables de AMD. El Hyper Threading puede venir bien en aplicaciones muy específicas que estén preparadas para separar los procesos en muchos hilos y puedan asignarle un hilo a cada núcleo, pero para usarlo principalmente para juegos y de oficina yo lo desactivaría. Con las memorias no hay problema, incluso mezclando de distintas velocidades el controlador integrado se las arregla bien. La gráfica integrada, HD 4000, sigue siendo una gráfica poco potente pero me ha sorprendido el poder jugar a juegos 3D complejos como Fallout 3 aunque eso sí, a un nivel de detalle bajo. Para reproducir vídeos no presenta ningún problema con Windows Media Player Classic o VLC.Puntos positivos:+ Mejor relación rendimiento real/precio en los procesadores Intel Ivy Bridge actuales+ En Amazon vale 10-30€ más barato que en tiendas físicas+ Soporta tecnologías de los Intel Xeon+ Puedes usar una placa 1155 con chipsets de la serie 6, pero entonces pierdes PCI Express 3.0 y soporte nativo de USB 3.0+ La gráfica integrada es casi decentePuntos negativos:- A poco que te pongas, te cuestan igual las placas de socket 1155 que los procesadores- Se calientan un poco más que los Sandy Bridge, pero no es nada preocupante

Product Title: Intel Core i5-3570 Quad-Core Processor 3.4 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80637I53570

So brauche irgendwann nur eine neue GraKa für neuere Spiele einzubauen und habe die nächsten Jahre Ruhe.Spiele (z.B. Diablo 3, World of Tanks, Risen 2) laden aber gefühlt sehr viel schneller.Bisher bin ich rundum zufrieden und kann das Produkt nur weiter empfehlen.Die Lieferung verlief durch amazon.de verlief wie immer zügig und reibungslos! Product Title: Intel Core i3-9100F Desktop Processor 4 Core Up to 4.2 GHz without Processor Graphics LGA1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 1.0 out of 5 starsNew i3 series has taken a turn for the absolute worst. DON'T BUY!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
Reviews: There was a time when i3's were good, but I couldn't even play a game of CoD on the absolute lowest settings. I was using a 1660 Super (a $300 Graphics Card) so I know it wasn't the card. I was getting maybe 25 fps, and constant freezing. Totally unacceptable for any i series CPU. I'm very very unimpressed. In fact I'm appalled that this CPU hit 100% utilization so easily.For gaming, this CPU is completely non-functional for modern titles.As for general use? It does well, as long as you only plan on doing one task at a time.There is very little room for workload on this CPU. Even my programs were freezing when I had two or more open at a time.I know people test this CPU with solid states and lots of ram so it has no bottleneck, but that's not the price point of this CPU. Most will buy a HDD or an SSHD with 8gb of ram. And for that kind of build, this CPU is slow enough that it gets stuck any time it handles files off a disk drive.My hardware isn't bad either; I'm running a 2TB Firecuda with plenty of space left on it and good SATA cables.So I'm not sure what intel is doing with this CPU, but you'd clearly be better off spending 99 on a 1st or 2nd gen Ryzen 3. Terrible terrible CPU. I've seen Pentium Processors that perform better. Maybe even Celrons.

Product Title: Intel Core i3-9100F Desktop Processor 4 Core Up to 4.2 GHz without Processor Graphics LGA1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat value for the money
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019
Reviews: Most software benefits very little from more than one or two cores, certainly four cores. This CPU is inexpensive, does not require exotic cooling, and provides more than enough "oomph" for almost any gaming or family PC.Workstation professionals in the graphics/video/audio business may wish to look at higher-end models.

Product Title: Intel Core i3-9100F Desktop Processor 4 Core Up to 4.2 GHz without Processor Graphics LGA1151 300 Series 65W

Product Title: Intel Core i3-9100F Desktop Processor 4 Core Up to 4.2 GHz without Processor Graphics LGA1151 300 Series 65W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat value if you are using a discrete graphics card
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2019

Note: even of your motherboard has physical connectors for video, they will not work with this CPU without add-on Graphics, howevee if you plan to have a dedicated card, why pay for what you aren't going to use.

Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars9th gen B0 stepping can essentially run on 200/100 chipsets

Review Title: 1.0 out of 5 starsFair **WARNING** To The Next Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2021
Reviews: I am here to warn my fellow honest living people. Be careful as the seller advertises new. Under my investigation and examination I found a lot wrong with this picture to bring me to the conclusion that the seller is giving misleading information about the product being "new".Variable and factors that determined this conclusion is the fact the box is in horrible shape and that there is thermal paste on the CPU. I ignored the box cause the box does not matter what matters is I was expect a "NEW" CPU and I get a CPU that has used thermal paste and has the molex brackets that hold the CPU in socket marks. I am disappointed. I would make sure your buyers know they are buying renewed or used CPUs.Best of luck to the next buyer cheers!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGood Processor, Just DON'T BUY USED!!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsA sweetheart of a processor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2014
Reviews: I chose this for my first build back in late 2011.  It's a strong processor, up to any task I can throw at it.  I ran it for 6 months on the stock Intel HSF but then put a Cooler Master Hyper 212 Plus on it. ON a recent test with IntelBurnTest at Maximum stress gave a max temperature of 61C.  Suits me.You might notice that the Sandy Bridge processors lie the I5 and I7 have pretty well maintained their price of the last two years - the paragraph above is a good reason why.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsA nice little workhorse that keeps your wallet thick
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2012
Reviews: I've pushed this CPU through a lot in the past year. Hundreds of hours worth of rendering high-def video and live compression. It is possible to OC this to an extent but if you are a real speed demon, spring for theIntel Core i5-2500K Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500K, which is about the same price. Not like you will need to OC it - you'll likely be bottle-necked by another comportment in your PC. I love this CPU and I highly recommend it.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2012
Reviews: This is a fantastic CPU for its budget range.  The main decision is whether or not to bother with getting the unlocked 2500k variant.  My opinion is that overclocking is rarely worth it, but if that is your thing, the price difference should not stop you from getting the k variant.This is the coolest running CPU I have ever used, and is relatively low wattage in general- these are my main concerns beyond performance, as there wasn't really a winter in Los Angeles this last year.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2011
Reviews: If you're thinking of cheaping out on a new CPU --  don't.  But you also don't have to spend a whole lot to get something powerful, versatile and efficient either.  I'm not into the over clocking scene so I picked up the standard 2500 model and I have been nothing but impressed with the performance. Very few software apps are written to take advantage of more than 4 cores in the current environment, so you really don't gain a whole lot going to the 6 or 8 core competitors.  If you are really in budget territory, the i3 Sandy Bridge range is very competitive, but if you don't feel like forking out money for the 2600, this is a nice price point.  I don't think the factory cooler is very good - I opted for a Cooler Master - the processor rarely gets above 30-35c even under the highest gaming loads.  There isn't anything I can find even to nit-pick.  This is a good processor for a good price.Oh yeah, no Hyper-threading, but I've yet to encounter anything that would make me miss it.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPower at my finger tips
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2011
Reviews: That is the best cpu i have ever own, low power consumption, runs very cool at max load 46 degrees Celsius (i think it could be 10 degrees less) when fans is max. I use my built in graphics card to play games and runs great. No lags no problems, (then again i have not max the game settings). I convert movies and play games at the same time still no problems. Movies convert in 25 mins or less. When the pc is idle.I love this cpu. I cant wait for the ivy bridge to come out and to upgrade.But honestly i would rather the i72600 100Mhz X4 faster.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 22, 2012
Reviews: This CPU goes along with my new system build, and HTPC for the lounge. See my other reviews for the rest of the hardware.I have not built a new system in about a year. I build them for other people, and had not built myself one for quite a few.This CPU is awsome, now that multi core CPUs are around and not too expensive -Xmas 2011 when I bought this one.If you are building a new system; from P4 2.6GHz to this, you will notice a big difference. Especially from DDR1 or 2 RAM and IDE hard drive then it is a big step up if you move to new everything.My motherboard I have used (ASUS P8H67-M PRO R3) takes DDR3 RAM and my new ASUS nVidia GTX550 ti graphics card. All a big step up from P4 3.0GHz DDR1 2GB and IDE HDD etc.There is room for the motherboard to take an i7 so it could be upgraded in a year or so.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on February 19, 2012
Reviews: Den Prozessor habe ich bewusst als nicht k Version gekauft, da ich sowieso nicht übertakte und zu gegebener Zeit, meist 3-4 Jahre, einfach alles ersetze.Die Wahl fiel auf den Intel Core i5-2500, 3,3GHz, 6MB Cache, 1155 Sockel, da er mir nach dem Wälzen diverser Benchmarksites, Kundenbewertungen usw. das beste Preis Leistungsverhältnis bot.Bestellt hatte ich zum Prozessor das MSI P67A-C45 (B3)und 8 BG Corsair XMS3 PC-1333 Arbeitsspeicher. Da ich schon den einen oder anderen PC zusammengeschraubt habe, verlief der Aufbau recht problemlos. Etwas "überrascht" war ich davon, dass es keinerlei IDE Support mehr gibt. Da ist die Entwicklung der letzten Jahren schlicht an mir vorüber gegangen.Insgesamt bin ich mit der Leistungssteigerung sehr zufrieden. Meine Hauptanwendung ist dabei ein recht bekanntes MMOG, das mit meinem alten Rechner deutlich lahmte und jetzt wieder brauchbar läuft. So soll das sein.Die Bestellung wurde von Amazon wie gewohnt prompt ausgeführt und das Päckchen kam sogar einen Tag früher als angekündigt ans. Auch hier bin ich vollends zufrieden.Darum 5 Sterne.

Reviews: I used the i5 sandy bridge standard version as I was not into overclocking it was cheaper than the 'k' version and is very quick anyway why do intel try to confuse people with the incompatable versions this is socket i5 1155 but will not fit into a i5 1156 motherboard it pays to research before buying motherboard and processor, should be no problem with ddr3 memory as long as you check the motherboard manufatures website for compatible memory,

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500
Review Date: Reviewed in Japan on June 3, 2020
Reviews: 古いパソコンの動作改善のために購入しました。他のパーツも交換したのでcpuだけの影響ではないと思いますが、明らかに以前より良くなったので満足してます！中古品のため少し不安でしたが、非常に綺麗なものが送られてきて良かったです！

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on March 16, 2014
Reviews: Jeder der den Intel I5 2500 bestellt muss wissen dass es eben bereits 2 neue Generationen gibt.Für mich war dies soweit verkraftbar und wenn man das entsprechende Board hat kann man ja ganz leicht auf nen Ivy Bridge umrüsten.Jetzt zu den Leistungsdaten.Wenn ich meine Musikdateien bearbeite oder beim Zocken mal wieder viele Gegner berechnet werden müssen kriege ich schonmal ne volle Auslastung von im Schnitt 80 % hin. Aber das ist für alle normalen und mittelmäßigen Anforderungen genügend.Im Idle Betrieb habe ich mit einem großen Lüfter von BeQuiet Temperaturen von 32-35 Grad. Dabei muss ich dazu sagen dass ich ein silent Gehäuße habe welches stark gedämmt ist. Daher dürften bei normalen Gehäußen die Temperaturen zwischen 30 und 35 Grad liegen.Die Grafikeinheit der CPU kann einen Monitor mit 1920x1080 Pixeln beliefern Windows Aero ist (glaube ich) auch ganz normal möglich. Ein ganz klein wenig Zocken kann man auch. Bei COD MW2 lief alles bei voller Auflösung gut aber sobald Gegner kommer ruckelt es. Stellt man die Einstellungen etwas niedrigen müsste es aber ruckelfrei laufen.Für mich ist es genau das richtige Preis/Leistungsverhälltnis gewesen. Sollte die Leistung nä. Jahr nicht mehr reichen werde ich eine Intel Ivy Bridge CPU beschaffen und fertig.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-2500 Quad-Core Processor 3.3 GHz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 - BX80623I52500

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThe best CPU I've owned so far. Rivaling even the 5900X! Intel is killing the game as of now.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2022
Reviews: I upgraded to this CPU after some HEAVY research, asking Reddit (Both Intel and AMD subreddits), weighing in money VS performance gained. I have used AMD since I was a teen and started building computers. The conclusion is this: It is an amazing CPU, runs faster and cooler than my Ryzen 7 1700. The price AND performance VS AMD (Also including a board) was better than if I had went with a Ryzen 7 5800X.Some background information: I wanted to upgrade after receiving an Amazon gift card (I have never ordered computer parts from Amazon though). I upgraded from a Ryzen 7 1700, with an ASUS x370-f board. I really wanted to upgrade, and was sad also that Windows 11 did not support my CPU! I will give it to Microsoft for this, as it made A LOT of people upgrade their entire computers, all for basically the same OS as of now with newer looks, and not much done under the hood (EXCEPT for 12th gen Intel, so good news there too). Sadly, my old board STILL doesn't support the Ryzen 7 5000 series, and only the 3000 series (They are working on a BIOS apparently for the 5000 series, because of people who were in my shoes). I first almost ordered the Ryzen 7 3800XT, for $400! After a couple hours of research, asking, and thinking about it... I cancelled that order (Thankfully) and thought "Well, if I am going to spend this much on upgrading my CPU, I might as well go all in/spend a little more for something better, as this may be my last big upgrade in this regard for awhile." I was then going to get the Ryzen 7 5800X with an Asus board. There lied a problem of price, I could not find a board AND get that CPU still within my budget (At-least not a board that wasn't worse than the one I had in ways). I mentioned I had posted on the AMD subreddit, and even they suggested I go Intel (Intel is just killing it as of now, hands down, although I am sure AMD will retaliate). I ended up getting the MSI Z690-A DDR4 (I wish I had the money for DDR5 RAM, I would have went with the DDR5 version as it was basically the same price). I had A LOT of second thoughts on this board though, as it just didn't seem "Premium" as the one I had (I am going to do a whole review on it after this. I'll save my Pros & Cons for there.) This CPU also auto-clocks itself up or down depending on the load (Saw it clock down to 1GHz, although not for long, for example if not much processing power is warranted, which makes sense and I wish everything did). So if idling, it will clock down and save power/heat/and therefore longevity is increased. I absolutely love this CPU coming from AMD. Anyways...If you have a Corsair H100I RGB Platinum or similar cooler already: The included 1200 screws work just fine with the 1700 socket and this CPU, even though you are supposed to get the 1700 kit/screws for this CPU (Which I did, but they are taking FOREVER to ship, so I googled, and someone said using the 1200 screws will work just fine). I get better temps. than my Ryzen 7 1700. I can even overclock EVEN MORE but have no need, and no point.TL:DRUpgraded from: Ryzen 7 1700, Asus Rog Strix x370-f gaming.Upgraded to: i7-12700K, MSI Z690-A DDR4.Parts kept: 4x8GB 32GB DDR4 CL16 3000MHz RAM (With XMP, D.O.C.P), RTX 2070. The RAM works great with this CPU as well, although it TECHNICALLY (Latency wise, runs at 2T on Intel instead of 1T on AMD) runs slower than when on AMD (AMD's infinity fabric) but obviously whatever Intel is doing makes up for that, and therefore my RAM either runs faster/the same)Pros: It is an amazing CPU for price VS performance. The i5-12600K is good as well (I almost just went with it), and you would be fine going with it for gaming (As even it still has more cores technically than the Ryzen 7 5800X, it also beats the 5800X even though THIS CPU is supposed to be its comparison rival brother.) This CPU has cool temps on my Corsair H100I RGB Platinum cooler, and the P&E core structure are REALLY cool and fun to watch when doing tasks/gaming. It shipped fast!Cons: Literally none with the CPU itself. Just with shipping - It shipped really fast! Was here in 2-3 days after purchasing on here. The biggest complaint I have is Amazon's shipping (SO BE AWARE OF THIS) I have never ordered computer parts from Amazon, and have always used New-egg. They just left the CPU in my mail-box, and if it weren't for me looking at my camera's, and looking out for this part, it would have sat in the mail-box all day. My mail-box sadly is not very weather proof as well, and if it had been raining... It wouldn't have been good. Although it did come in a big box around it. The CPU also was jarred loose and flopping around in the box (Not held into the front window).I hope this review helps people!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsstable, fast, and smooth.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
Reviews: This is my first intel build coming from past AMD builds (Ryzen, FX, Athlon, Phenom). I am nowhere near a hardware engineer level to distinguish or feel the differences in performances but for the average gamer and turning on this CPU with instructions followed, this chip is very well to be worth it and confident to be future proof until at least 2026. I overclocked this via the motherboard/bios settings and it stays cool with a $30 fan cooler. (don't get a super cheap or small cpu cooler otherwise would risk overheating) Just follow installation instructions carefully the chip is delicate. windows experience rating is a 9.7 so that says it all. If you have the extra 50-60$ go with the i9 i should have done that. AMD seems to be all the hype but I see why Intel won't be going away anytime soon this is a solid chip.

Reviews: I upgraded from the i7 6700k to the i3 13100 and saw a great performance increase. I was eager to test ddr5. However,  I also wanted to experiment with 6+ core processors. But the i7 12700k is a ferocious beast that has crushed all tasks I've given it and brought immesnse life back to my RTX 2060 super and it stays cools & fluent.Z790 auros elite axI7 12700k overclocked pcores 5.2 ghz ecores 4.0 ghz 50-65°C during multi intensive tasks and games for long periods of timeRTX 2060 super 8bg ddr6Corsair vengeance 6000mhz ddr5Cyberpunk 60-65 fps 1080 ultra+psycho with medium ray tracing with a low of 59Starfield 30- 40 1080p fps high settings the devs need to optimize thoughHorizon zero Dawn 80-85 fps 1080 ultraShreds through video editing and music editing all at onceAmazing at multitaskingPowerfulFastCan be placed in ddr4 mobos and ddr5 mobos

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAwesome upgrade and great value
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
Reviews: Compared to the Coffee Lake generation I had been (willingly) stuck on for 4 years this is a massive leap. Before buying I was a bit skeptical since I'm not a fan of Intel's newer way of handling cores, but the first thing I tried when I got it was emulating PS3 games and right off the bat I saw compile times cut tenfold and stability at least doubled.The older CPUs from the 8th, 9th, and 10th gen are perfectly usable for most people so if you're on a budget maybe look on the used market for those. But if you really need something powerful this is a good option.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsRun dual displays smoothly without any hiccups, here are my notes…
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2023
Reviews: This item has been with me for a very short time.So I recently decided to upgrade my gaming rig, and after extensive research, I made the bold choice to order the Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 Cores. Let me tell you, this processor is the absolute best! With its 12 cores, it brings a whole new level of performance to my gaming experience. Whether I'm playing graphically demanding AAA titles or indulging in intense multitasking, this processor effortlessly handles it all. And what's even better is that it comes with integrated graphics, meaning I didn't have to shell out extra cash for a separate graphics card, yet. The integrated Graphics offer the flexibility of running dual displays smoothly without any hiccups. Plus, with Intel's reputation for reliable and high-quality products, I know I can trust the i7-12700K to last me for years to come.I hope you find this review helpful.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W

Reviews: The morning after building and setting up windows, drivers, etc. The PC had blue screened because of temperatures, and after a reset and entering the BIOS I saw that the temperature was 89 degrees celsius. Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWatch the price on this one
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2023
Reviews: The i7-12700K is in the top 5 for gaming CPUs right now. AMD is doing fairly well as of late but Intel has a solid performance lead with it's single core performance on newer generation chips.If you're on the fence and want a quick top 5 for overall gaming performance, it goes as follows:1. i9-13900k2. i7-13700k3. i9-12900k4. i5-13600k5. i7-12700kThis chip is no slouch though, it trades blows with the 13600K in some situations if overclocked but overclocking isn't really fair for comparison.In conclusion, if you're looking around this price point, check both this CPU and the 13600k. Pick whichever is cheaper. Higher end 12th gen Intel motherboards can be flashed in the BiOS to take 13th gen CPUs too, but do your research on those before going that route. This one will serve you well. :)

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2022
Reviews: It's been roughly 6-7 years since I last build my gaming computer. Upgrading to this has been more than significant. As of this writing, I hope you've done your research the I7-12700k's price point and its competition. For this price point, it may be the top dog.Some things to consider before purchasing:1) Make sure you are purchasing a LGA 1700 motherboard. I went with the DDR4 motherboard because DDR5 is still at its infancy. The DDR5 ram may not be the best option for your buck right now. You'll be fine with DDR4.2) This CPU does consume a lot more power compared to its predecessor. Double check if your PSU will be enough. There are online resources that will help you calculate your PSU. It's always good to have a little overhead.3) Make sure your heatsink has retrofit screws that's compatible with this motherboard. You can purchase them separately. If you have a heatsink that's very old (<2016), it's more than likely it may not be compatible.Good luck!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023
Reviews: Bought this for a new personal PC. My last was an i7 4790K build that got totaled out (crushed) during shipping. After building a new one on a z790i platform, the performance gain was stunning, completely night and day! I cannot say enough about this CPU, and would totally recommend this product!!

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsA better deal for most people vs. the i9
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2022
Reviews: I had been planning to hold off for Raptor Lake, but my Z370 mobo died, and I decided to go ahead and get an Alder Lake i7.  So far it's impressive.  It runs much cooler than my i9-9900k (mild OC) ( 59C-63C under a gaming load vs 75C+) but that could've been due to the my old AIO being in it's death throws for the past few months.  3DMark CPU score went up noticeably as well.  Overall, I'm pretty happy with it.  Haven't messed around with overclocking yet, but there doesn't seem to be as much headroom left as there used to be,  from what I've read 5.3 Ghz is about what you can expect.  The days of getting another 800Mhz - 1 Ghz+  over stock clocks out of a CPU are gone it seems.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2022
Reviews: I've had this overclocked at 5.0 GHz for a couple weeks now and it hasn't skipped a beat. I bought an MSI Z690 MPG Edge Motherboard to pair with this beast of a chip. Keep in mind, it does NOT come with a cooler so make sure you have a reputable thermal paste and a solid cooler to pair with this. I have a pre-filled watercooler (Corsair Hydro Series H115i Pro) which is giving me temps idle as low as 19°C (not joking, look at the picture). Under full load, I have yet to hit over 50°C even gaming at 1440p (2k resolution). If I'm being quite honest, this CPU is overkill for gaming. If you have the extra money, go for it. If not, a i5-12600k will be just as powerful for less money.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2022
Reviews: This 12th Gen Unlocked CPU is amazing for a Gamer PC Build compared to the Ryzen 5000 Series. The new LGA 1700 boards have an added benefit compared to the aging AM4 boards. This CPU support PCIe 5.0 and DDR4 or DDR5 RAM. I like how efficient Intel designed it because the P cores are optimized for gaming while the efficient E cores deal with the background tasks. Make sure to buy a good AIO cooler because the CPU will run hot when there is lots of load! Please note a new Intel CPU will come with its Intel factory seal outside the box. Moreover, I ran the CPU under 6% when running Minecraft with raytracing.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700KF Gaming Desktop Processor 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsReally fast. and great for gaming!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2024
Reviews: Paired it with 32 gb of dominator platinum 5600, and a RTX 4070 ti. I overclocked it via turbo ratio's and it boosts up to 5.5 ghz while gaming. using a 360 AIO gaming temps are around 55c, and even during a cinebench loop for 10 mins it doesnt get past 75-80c.If you're on the fence about this CPU i would suggest getting it.  you could always drop in a 14th gen processor and get a nice boost to performance(on a later date), without having to change motherboard.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700KF Gaming Desktop Processor 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSwitching back to Intel from AMD
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
Reviews: Was stuck on the fence between I9 and the I7 for my everyday needs. My focus was to future proof the next build because my first experience with intel ever was a good one. I went with an I7 build back in 2010 and that system outperforms lasting a good 8-9 years before encountering some issues with heating and performance. Compared to my current AMD build which unfortunately has only been around for 3 years experienced performance issues earlier on due to the higher demand these newer games require.Yeah I'm glad with my choice of going back to Intel. It feels like a solid choice and with the sales right now for the I7, now is a good time to buy this processor. Yeah, I'm missing out on like 4 cores of processing speeds and could maybe potentially boost the lifespan of my system by a couple of more months with the I9, but that extra hundred or so would be better spent towards a dedicated graphics card. Hoping the 4060-4080 line of cards get a sale! I probably wouldn't even notice the performance difference from the get go, but I'm happy with this reputable brand.

Product Title: Intel Core i7-12700KF Gaming Desktop Processor 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGood processor, poor internal graphics
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
Reviews: I bought this CPU with internal graphics primarily to have backup if my primary installed GPU should fail. Also for the speed and quality of the CPU itself, it satisfies. But the internal graphics not so much. I used it's graphics for the time I was shopping and waiting for my ordered GPU and was not impressed. I would never want to depend on it permanently. My TV monitor continually had issues with detecting it's source and would drop connection on occasion, forcing me to have to continually reset HDMI cable in it's port. A real irritation and pain. Is this a problem with the MBs HDMI port or the CPU. I don't know, but either way it ain't good. Nor did I care much for the overall look of the graphics it provided. Just not quality.I have been using a big screen TV for a monitor my for many years and never had this issue, so I don't think it's the TV. Still the cost of an I7 K vs an I7 KF is negligible so why not go for the one with graphics in case I ever need it. For a short while.

Product Title: Intel® Core™ i7-14700KF New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsUnstable at default oc settings on asus motherboard
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2024
Reviews: Even running at the default 6.1ghz turbo settings the processor is extremely unstable and causes constant crashing.  Only way to stop it is to go in bios and set the core ratio to 57 max for power cores and 43 for efficency cores. Drove me nuts trying to figure out the problem for months also buy a hefty duty power supply if you're buying a 40 series rtx graphics card constant crashing of apps and games from lack of power to the graphics card from even a 1000 watt supply

Product Title: Intel® Core™ i7-14700KF New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2024
Reviews: It's a processor. It's like any other processor that processes, only better.It destroys video editing and processor intensive brush strokes in Corel Painter. Product Title: Intel® Core™ i7-14700KF New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis is a Beast
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
Reviews: Case: GOPIE Micro ATX Case T07 (branded as ABIT on the case)Motherboard: MSI MAG B760m Mortar WIFI IICPU: I9 14900kCPU Cooler: ID-COOLING SE-207-XT SlimDDR5: 64Gb T-Team Create Expert 6000Mhz (4 x 32Gb)3 x m.2 Gen4: Lexar - 1 x 512GB (OS)/1 x 1TB/1 x 2TBSSD: 1 x 4TB CrucialCase Fans: Thermalright TL-9015B CPU Cooler Fan 92mm (2 x Intake Bottom/2 x Exhaust Top/1 x Exhaust rear)PSU: Montech Century Mini 750w GoldGPU: N/AThe I9 14900k is a beast and runs hot. While doing benchmarks, a few Pcores would hit 100c while others would hit 92c. Ecores was about 87c and low of 83c on 4.3Ghz all Pcore and 4.2Ghz all Ecore. Offset voltage was at 0.3. After switching back to auto clock, I still managed the same temps, but getting 5.1-5.2Ghz on Pcore and 4.3 on Ecore. If my case allowed 120mm fans, I would of most definitely installed 240mm AIO cooler. That for sure would of helped with the temps and get me higher benchmark numbers.When it came to rendering a 20 minute 4k video on sony Vegas Pro 18 (IGPU only), it took about 15 minutes to complete it vs my I9 9900k that would of taken over an hour to finish it (RTX 3060). This system was meant specifically VR/light video editing. So, considering how fast it is on the rendering without a dedicated GPU, I am pretty excited about it. I haven't tried the VR aspect yet.Overall, if you are coming from a few gen older CPU and want to upgrade to the 14900k, you wont be disappointed.

Product Title: Intel® Core™ i7-14700KF New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) - Unlocked

Product Title: Intel® Core™ i7-14700KF New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2024
Reviews: Switching from a 5800x3d for my 4080 super.. this is one heck of a cpu. I only put a $60 280mm aio "I'd cooling" and put it on smart fan. After that gaming has been a breeze with crazy high fps that give me 99% GPU usage in every game. Jedi survivor is getting over 130fps with dlss quality on. Which is unheard of from everything I read. Totally glad I went with this over 7800x3d. Mobo was much cheaper with every bell and whistle I wanted. My newest build is definitely nice enough to leave any builder drooling.. Thanks to this cpu at its core.

Product Title: Intel® Core™ i7-14700KF New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2024
Reviews: Upgrading from a 10700KF to 14700K. Lots of forms posts are degrading this processor but I’m here to tell you it’s well worth the money! Just make sure to go to your BIOS and limit the power to 253W. The whole heat of this chip is blown out of proportion. I haven’t gotten heat issues while gaming.Overall I have this chip paired with a 3090, while I’ll wait for a new 50 series card.Some of the gains I’ve gotten at @1440P, 45 in ultra wide 21:9, max graphics settings:Overwatch: overall 50fps gain, consistent 240hz capped out for my monitor.Black Desert Online: overall 35-40 fps gains.These are the games I normally play a lot and it’s truly notice when upgrading to this chip. Overall the computer is a snappy and fast and haven’t notice any hiccups. Really great chip and planning on keeping this for the next 4-5 years.

Product Title: Intel® Core™ i7-14700KF New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2024
Reviews: I bought this as an upgrade from my trusty i9 10900k. I was worried the performance boost would be marginal but I was pleasantly surprised to get a solid boost on 1440p with my rtx 4080 super. Playing Helldivers 2, my fps went from mid 70s-90s to 120-140s at everything maxed out. Playing VR sims like il-2 and DCS has mostly eliminated little stutters and performance drops. Similarly, MSFS 2020 at ultra settings in populated areas provides a smooth and stable experience. My temps generally stay around 65 to 75 underload/demanding gaming. I have seen brief spikes to 80. I'm using an EVGA CLC 280mm cooler. I may need to reapply thermal paste.

Reviews: I paired this with a "GIGABYTE Z790 Eagle AX LGA 1700 Intel Z790 ATX Motherboard with DDR5, M.2, PCIe 5.0, USB 3.2 Gen2X2 Type-C, Intel Wi-Fi 6E, 2.5GbE LAN, Q-Flash Plus, EZ-Latch" mobo and TGDGAMER "T-240MM Black ARGB Liquid CPU Water Cooling with 240mm ARGB PWM Fan, Temperature Display, Computer Water Cooling". The Intel application used AI to tweak my CPU to squeeze out more performance, but under 100% load it will often thermally throttle and sporadically hit 100C. I am considering finding a better cooler to keep up with this racehorse.

Product Title: Intel® Core™ i7-14700KF New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSo far so good.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
Reviews: Sorta came from a 13900k but I gave that to a relative after their x299/i9-7940x system began to have issues. He bought a z790 board and was amazed how far ahead the 13900k is in comparison an overclocked Skylake-X processor. He fixed the issue with the x299 system, but he decided to stay with Raptor Lake. All of which is okay by me because that old 13900k had no overclocking headroom, and I could only undervolt it by 5mv before it became unstable. I was going to buy another 13900k or maybe the ks version, but I decided to wait for the 14900k.The 14900k I got on the other hand has some overclocking headroom. I already set all P-cores to 5.8GHz, while keeping the double-core Turbo Boost at 6.0GHz. I also set the cache to 5.2Ghz and it's completely stable. I was not able to raise the multiplier at all with my 13900k. Just happy my 14900k isn't a lottery loser.While the clock of both the 13900ks and 14900k are the same, the 13900ks has a cherry picked memory controller. If you're looking to do a ton of RAM overclocking then the 13900ks may be the way to go.... but that's not to say if you'd get a 14900k with a good memory controller. Both my 13900k and 14900k work with DDR5-7200 RAM with XMP set, and no adjustments to the memory controller voltages.If you're buying the 14900k off the get-go and building a new system around it, then I recommend pairing it with a motherboard that has the BIOS Flashback feature.

Product Title: Intel® Core™ i7-14700KF New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsA Monster CPU with One Major Caveat
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
Reviews: I built PC with the new Intel i9-14900k, and I must say, it's a beast of a processor. Coming from an i7-8700k, the performance boost is nothing short of incredible. Multitasking, gaming, and content creation have all seen a significant improvement. Multithreaded applications and gaming experiences run smoother.  It's a productivity powerhouse. The clock speeds are no slouch either, making it excellent for single-threaded tasks and gaming. The major downside of this CPU is the heat it generates. Even with a high-end cooling solution, it tends to run hot, and that's something you must take into consideration when setting up your cooling solution. Be ready for this CPU to draw a significant amount of power at full load. It can put quite a load on your power supply and might necessitate an upgrade if you're not already prepared. The Intel i9-14900k is an incredible processor, and the upgrade from an i7-8700k is substantial. Its exceptional performance in various tasks justifies its price tag. If you're willing to address these challenges, you'll be rewarded with a fantastic computing experience.

Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsVery good and reliable processor

Reviews: Very good processor, upgraded form a very nice Ryzen 1700 (6 years old with me) to this one, decided to go intel due to memory stability. Went with this over the 7800X3D since I feel this is more future proof for productivity since I upgrade every 5-6 years. While I know the AM5 socket will last longer, anyways, every time I upgrade I also upgrade the motherboard. Very nice product, will recommend it.

Product Title: Intel® Core™ i7-14700KF New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsRuns hot, get a good cooler!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
Reviews: Awesome CPU thing can handle anything and everything for at least my needs as a gamer, and programmer! HIGHLY SUGGEST getting a 360 AIO or a custom water loop, and a CPU bracket if you are getting this CPU. It run's very hot getting a CPU bracket cut down my temps about 5-10 degrees. I'm not sure how good air coolers are for this CPU but I've seen a lot of people not suggest it. I use a 360 AIO Loop and it works great at keeping this thing cool!

Product Title: Intel® Core™ i7-14700KF New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
Reviews: I've built computers for more than 20 years, and I have never in my life had so much trouble booting with stock bios settings. I think I finally lost the silicon lottery. Using an Asus mb, I had to go into bios limit voltage and manually tune each pcore. Temps were wild and out of control 100°c, clock speeds were low thermal throttling, random crashes, blue screens inability to run simple programs without them crashing and shutting down. Tried intel xtu auto overclocking, ai suite, and asus ai overclocking via bios.. none of that worked. Had to just dig into bios, set limits, and manually tune each core. Now system is stable and solid. Been benchmarking and stress testing for a few days now. Temps are great, and I am happy. Not sure if mb is culprit, gonna get another board and test the chip. Just be ready for some trouble. Looked over many forums of others having the same issues.

Product Title: Intel Core i3-10100 Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.3 GHz LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 65W, Model Number: BX8070110100
Review Title: 2.0 out of 5 starsSpend a little more for an i5
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2022
Reviews: The i5-10400 crushes the i3-10100 in real world use for only a little more money. If you are going to do anything that's CPU intensive, like gaming, photo/video editing, content creation, etc, spend a few more dollars for the i5-10400 or i5-11400 which is even better.If you just want a cheap CPU for your LGA1200 motherboard consider the much less expensive G5905 or similar. Intel is sadly reducing their offerings for desktop CPUs. The 13th gen series doesn't even have an i3 let alone less expensive options (at least available retail for DIY builds). But, IMHO, this chip is an albatross. I only bought it due to supply issues as nothing less expensive was in stock. I needed a 10th CPU to boot my motherboard to upgrade the BIOS to support 11th gen (a common Intel catch 22 issue). I should have just bought something used.

Product Title: Intel Core i3-9100 Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.2 GHz LGA1151 300 Series 65W
Review Date: Reviewed in Germany on June 11, 2023
Reviews: Der Intel Core i3-9100 Prozessor mit einer Taktfrequenz von 3,6 GHz und 6 MB Smart Cache bietet eine zuverlässige Leistung für produktives Arbeiten.Dieser Prozessor eignet sich optimal für alltägliche Aufgaben wie Surfen im Internet, Textverarbeitung und Multimedia-Streaming. Er ermöglicht ein reibungsloses Arbeiten ohne Verzögerungen.Mit seiner Quad-Core-Architektur erfüllt der Intel Core i3-9100 die Anforderungen eines durchschnittlichen Nutzers. Obwohl er nicht für intensives Gaming geeignet ist, bietet er dennoch solide Leistung für verschiedene Anwendungen.Der 6 MB Smart Cache sorgt für eine verbesserte Datenverarbeitung und schnellere Abrufzeiten. Dies führt zu einem effizienten Gesamtsystem und einer reibungslosen Nutzung.Der Intel Core i3-9100 Prozessor ist einfach zu installieren und energieeffizient, was zu geringem Stromverbrauch und geringerer Wärmeentwicklung führt.Wenn Sie einen zuverlässigen Prozessor für effizientes Arbeiten suchen, ist der Intel Core i3-9100 eine gute Wahl. Mit seiner soliden Leistung ermöglicht er ein reibungsloses Arbeitserlebnis für verschiedene Aufgaben.

Product Title: Intel 3.70 GHz Core i3-6100 3M Cache Processor (BX80662I36100)
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsthis chip is 95% or more as good as an i5 or i7 of the same generation (for gaming)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2016
Reviews: for even high-end gaming, this chip is 95% or more as good as an i5 or i7 of the same generation, for 50% and 33% of the price, respectively.paired with a 960GTX and even moderately clocked DDR4 ram, this will play most games on ultra on 1080p, namely:- CS GO- Any Blizzard game, including OverwatchNote that this chip, along with others of the same generation, will benefit much more than previous generation intel chips from higher clocked RAM.It's no longer just a 1-5% increase in FPS, but more like 5-20% increase.An SSD is still a much more bang-for-buck upgrade than faster RAM, though.Only difference with this generation is that faster RAM comes in at a close second for best bang-for-buck upgrade.

Product Title: Intel 3.70 GHz Core i3-6100 3M Cache Processor (BX80662I36100)
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsNot sure you can find a better all-around processor for the price
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2016
Reviews: Not sure you can find a better all-around processor for the price.  Only a dual core, which will limit performance in heavy multitasking, (beyond your average office/Internet work) but hyperthreading and Intel's fabrication and chip design allows it to shine in gaming and everyday tasks while absolutely sipping power.Great processor to pick up if you're waiting to save up for a higher end Skylake CPU.  This CPU should hold its value very well in the coming year.  A must get for gamers on a budget.  Outperforms most AMD Chips regardless of cores or price.  Check out some of the real world benchmarks on Youtube if you're curious.

Product Title: Intel 3.70 GHz Core i3-6100 3M Cache Processor (BX80662I36100)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2017
Reviews: I was a little worried about performance issues for the budget build i was doing ,i was wrong ..and i can admit that .THIS IS A LITTLE BEAST paired with 16 gig good ram a nvidia 1060 and it is flying.The dual cores with the hyperthreading was very surprisingly strong and quick.Of course ill be getting a bigger intel but im in no hurry cause the i3 is holding its .TY Intel and ty Amazon .

Product Title: Intel 3.70 GHz Core i3-6100 3M Cache Processor (BX80662I36100)
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsIts hard to beat the single-thread performance of this processor ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2016
Reviews: Its hard to beat the single-thread performance of this processor for the dollar. That said, even with its hyper threading - you will notice the lack of cores in intense operations.Still - I used it to build a budget PC and it performed well. Initially I had it paired with a 950, but I traded that out for a 1060. It definitely bottlenecks the 1060, no question about it. But then again - its less than $120.

Product Title: Intel 3.70 GHz Core i3-6100 3M Cache Processor (BX80662I36100)
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat for an entry level gaming rig!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2017
Reviews: Great budget processor for a entry level gaming PC. The hyperthreading on this works well even though it only has 2 cores. But it is perfect for the budget builds that would do light gaming as well as some video streaming and HTPC style workload.

Product Title: Intel 3.70 GHz Core i3-6100 3M Cache Processor (BX80662I36100)

Basically, unless you *need* more than 2 cores (some games require quad cores, video rendering, etc), this processor is a fantastic buy. Efficient, (relatively) inexpensive and a high clock speed make this my go-to CPU of choice, except for extremely low-cost systems, or really high-end systems.My office PC has a 6100 in it, and I use it 8+ hours per day. 100% satisfied with the performance it delivers.

The stock heatsink (which has thermal paste preapplied) and fan keeps it at the 30-40 degree level without issue, and is quiet enough for my tastes.

Reapplied thermal paste and made some space in my tower for better airflow and it more or less remained the same. Idle temps are around 35c.Everything is running very snappily, particularly loading models in Stable Diffusion now takes only seconds when it used to take minutes with my 4790k. Product Title: Intel Core i5-13600KF Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2023
Reviews: I have no idea why people are praising this CPU. It is a power hog, when I load something I literally see my computer slowing down for 13600k to power up. It is constantly thermal throttling to the point of blue screen of death, even though I am using it with 240 Thermaltake GlacierOne liquid cooler on a higher end Z790 board. 13600k is very unstable and absolutely requires 360 liquid cooler to handle it, even at stock speed. Sure, I can limit it and it will not affect gaming or I can turn off E-cores, but what is the point of spending so much more money then? I had an excellent experience with 12400F, no stability issues, perfect temperatures all the time. I may go back to 12400F or get 13400F, I am definitely not keeping 13600kf.In order to get a full potential of 13600k you need RTX 4090. I have a brand new RTX 4080 and it is used at 100% while playing Cyberpunk 2077, CPU was showing only at 70%. Save money and get 13400F instead or wait until 14th gen comes out later this year.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-13600KF Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsThe K igpu is worth more than the $30 price difference
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2023
Reviews: The 13600k foundation is without doubt a great cpu.  But, even if you have a beefy GPU on hand, spend the extra $30 and get the K version with onboard GPU…. Beyond making non booting systems easier to troubleshoot, it turns out that Intel’s QuickSync encoder/decoders offer benefits that even the top range NVIDIA cards do not offer.  Apps like DiVinci or Adobe Premiere can utilize Intel’s QuickSync in addition to NVIDIA transcoders, making the K cpu significantly faster in those use cases.Granted that in gaming cases the K and KF provide the same performance - but if you ever need the encoding options in the future, you’ll miss them.The K series will retain the $30 premium later on the used market when the time comes, so why not invest in the most options you can right now?

Product Title: Intel Core i5-13600KF Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) - Unlocked
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2023
Reviews: For gaming this CPU is excellent. I use it for 4k gaming and use it with a dual monitor set up. Runs both with zero issues. I wanted a CPU that didn’t run hot like the i9. This never seems to heat up even under the heaviest loads. I also use it for ethical hacking and other cybersecurity applications and also have never had an issue. Saving money on the CPU allowed me to allocate more money to other components that would have had a greater impact on overall performance. I don’t regret skipping a more costly CPU. This gets the job done and at a cost that seems unreasonably low for what you get…but definitely not complaining!!! If you want to spend more money on components like a better GPU (got the 4090) and upgraded RAM this is a great way to save a bit of money without sacrificing much in the way of performance.
