Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars5 ghz easy at 1
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2015
Reviews: After a long dilemma between the i5 4690k and the i7 4790k i finally pulled the plug and went for the 4690k and boy i am not dissapointed at all. I actually saved a 100 $ in the process which i spend on a liquid cooling system. Although the base clock is a mere 3.5 ghz this one overclocked to a 4.5 ghz easy at 1.25 volts by someone like me who is fairly new to the overclocking scene. I did manage to push it as far as 4.7 ghz at 1.34 or 1.35 volts, im not sure. But rather than justifying my ego I decided to play safe and and stay at 4.5 @ 1.25 volts which is a significant 1 ghz overclock than the base and a safe voltage at the same time. Im not sure if i made the right decision there but if u ask me, am i happy about it?? Well yes very much so. And yes i have experienced incresed fps in arma 3 which makes my whole experience (all the painful stress tests and the agonizing blue screens) worthwhile. I must also say that the temps stay pretty low under 65C during stress tests at 100% load, thanks to the all new thermal interface material and the corsiar h105, job very well done. Above all intel leads the way and i shall follow.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazing cpu for the price!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2018
Reviews: With Windows 10 being out for almost a year I decided to make a new gaming build for the upgrade from windows 7. I think I finally put it together around oct 2016 and have been using the same CPU and build ever since without any issues. I paired it with a Gigabyte GTX1080 OC thinking I would need to overclock everything to get what I needed but OC numbers aren't that impressive and it runs everything smoothly as is. Witcher 3, Ark survival, GTA, anything you want can be played on ultra and still be butter smooth with the setup im running.Save money on your CPU so you can spend money on your GPU. this is a great buy for the casual gamer or hardcore graphics feindsSpecs:Intel i5 4690kHyper 212 CoolerMaster heat sink (push/pull dual fan sandwich)Gigabyte GTX 1080 OCGigabyte z79x gaming-3Corsair 750w PSUCorsair 12gb DDR4 RAMCreative Sound Blaster AE-5 sound cardSamsung evo 500g SSD (runs windows 10 and most frequently played games)WD 1tb HDD (for games and everything else)

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat processor and easy to overclock
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2014
Reviews: This is a tremendous processor.  I was quickly able to overclock it to 4.5 GHz with my z97 MSI Gaming 5 mobo. It is an unlocked chip (that is what the K stands for-- it means it is made to overclock)!  My computer is running around 60 degrees C, I am sure I could push it harder, but I'd rather keep the temps down to maintain the chip's lifespan. This was my first home-build and I couldn't have found it easier.The stock cooler that comes with the chip is junk.  You are going to want to get another cooler (but I suspect that most people reading this and about to build their own computer knows that!) .It has 6MB of L3 cache and 4 cores.  No hyperthreading, but I am using my computer mostly for gaming.  Most games don't take advantage of hyperthreading technology so it didn't bother me a bit.  Computer is super fast with 16 GB of 1866 MHz G.Skill RAM.If you are going to overclock make sure to download CPU-Z to monitor your processor, Real-Temp GT to monitor your core temperatures, and Prime 95 to torture test your overclocked computer to ensure your computer is stable (all free!).

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsStill Good Enough for High End Gaming in 2016.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2016
Reviews: Recently gave my computer a serious upgrade with this chip alongside an AMD R9 390x graphics card. At stock speeds I'm able to run The Division at ultra settings without bottlenecking the GPU. I'm very confident that I'll get milage out this CPU for the next 2-3 years. The moment games become a little too much for it to handle--BAM!--overclock.Be mindful that if you plan to overclock you will need a Z97 type motherboard. At the time of this posting, the most budget friendly Z97 motherboard is the MSI PC Mate Z97.If you're deciding between this or the I7 4790k, I recommend you get this one. The i7 is only about 30% more powerful (don't take my word for it, google the benchmarks) and is about 50% more expensive. Did I mention the i7 is overkill or high end gaming? Sure, you could drop the extra money, but its performance you won't use. I recommend you take the savings and buy yourself a z97 motherboard so that you can overclock this puppy when it starts to slide into obsolescence.TL;DR: This cpu = best value. It won't let you (or your GPU) down.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat CPU, Doesn't cost a fortune but is a beast!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2016
Reviews: To start this off, I had a laptop about 6 months ago and decided to ditch the laptop and go desktop. I'm am a heavy PC gamer and I decided to use this CPU for my next PC build. And its puts a good fight to its bigger brother the 4770k. While the difference isn't much you can overclock this CPU and you will pretty much have a 4770k (Minus the Hyper threading).I had mine clocked at the base speeds with a H105 CPU cooler and it worked like a charm. But like any other PC gamer I felt I need more power.So I overclocked it! And its a great overclocker! I now have mine overclocked at 4.4GHz and the temps are staying well under the max.The highest temps it hits is about 78c under full load. And never any higher. And the idle temps are about 26c.All in all I use this CPU for heavy gaming and Photoshop use and it actually does very well. If your looking for a cheaper alternative than buying a i7 then this CPU would be great for you. It does for me very well (Even at stock speeds)

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBeast CPU. No issues running current gen games in ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2016
Reviews: Beast CPU. No issues running current gen games in the slightest. Anything I play, even multitasking this thing doesn't even hiccup. However, BE AWARE! if you have an MSI z87-g45 apparently there's a bug where the third and forth ram slots won't work with this CPU (this isn't an issue with the CPU, but the board just giving a warning). It'll work, but only ram slots 1 & 2 can have a stick of ram in them. Doesn't seem to matter how big the ram is in each slot.edit: nobodies ever gonna read this review nowadays lol, but reading this now as an experienced PC builder, holy cringe. If you have the issue I mentioned above, it's not a "bug" you very likely have bent pins in your CPU socket. I was too stubborn to check thinking I wouldn't have made such an error, but that was indeed the problem and it was a good year or two before I even checked. This is why you should always be careful of reviews on e-commerce sites because there's all sorts, like myself here, who thinks they know what they're talking about when they don't.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat chip for gaming, handles overclocking like a champ.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2017
Reviews: This processor has done phenomenally in my build. I paired it with a MSI Krait edition board, hyper212 cooler and q16gb ram. This chip has ran smooth, and up until recently had a stable overclock at 4.6ghz. Protip- BIOS updates can cause loss of over clock, and adding an M.2 drive as boot disc means my computer starts up faster than my keyboard gets power and I can no longer get into BIOS at the moment. Quite a funny situation. During stress testing, temps of chip never went above 80C, and idle temps were quite low. I am really pleased with this chip, however my needs have changed and will be upgrading to an i7 chip in the near future. Gaming wise, this chip is amazing which is what my original build was for but I am transitioning into editing and an i7 is more suited to the task. This chip will live on, however as my son is quickly approaching the age of being able to build his own computer.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLet me tell you a story of woe, triumph, love, loss, and legacy.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2016
Reviews: I'll tell you a story about a computer.Once upon a time, there was a computer. It's processor, a hardy 1st generation i5, helped all those around it complete their task very fast.  But as time went on, the tasks became greater and greater until the i5 was starting to get burdened.  "Fret not," said the processor.  It bowed up its capacitors and completed each task with a steadfast manner.The processor eventually found a wife and had 2.5 kids with a family pet.  All was well.  Until his close comrade, the motherboard, decided he'd stop working.  This stopped the processor in his tracks, completely.  And being an older, first generation processor to find a new comrade would have been just difficult.  So, the processor has since retired.But his son lives on.In the form of the core i5-4690k!Zippy processor I've had zero problems with.  Paired with a Gigabyte board instead of Asrock.I do all kinds of gaming and feel the CPU is barely taxed at all.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat processor at a reasonable price.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2015
Reviews: ADVICE: For those unfamiliar with these heat sink fans, if you need to remove them after installation, you must twist each of the securing pins in a certain direction to release the lock. If you look closely on the top of each pin, it will show you which way to rotate them.What can I say, its a processor. I haven't had a chance to overclock it yet, but I'm sure from all the reviews I've read that it'll perform marvelously. The only con worthy of note is that the thermal paste is pretty underwhelming and so is the heat sink. Would definitely recommend upgrading both if you decide to overclock.About a week into this build and everything has worked without a hiccup thus far. Would suggest to friends.My build:Case: NZXT Noctic 450 http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00VX1L31KMotherboard: MSI Z97A Gaming 6 http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00W7FE5HAProcessor: Intel Core i5-4690K http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KPRWB9GRAM: Corsair Vengeance Pro (2 x 8gb) 2400MHz http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00EUPV2RQGraphics: MSI GTX 970 GAMING 4G http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00NN0GEXQPower Supply: EVGA SuperNOVA 750W http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00IKDETOWSolid State Drive: Samsung 500gb http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00OBRE5UEKeyboard: Corsair Vengeance K70 Cherry Browns http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00IYJD5CY

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsBest bang for the buck
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2016
Reviews: Pros: Absolutely everything.Cons: Doesn't warm my room up as well as my old Q9650 rig.But in all seriousness, I wish there was an option to buy the chip without the cooler. This would reduce the price (not to mention waste) by a non-trivial amount. I'm sure most of the people who purchase at this level toss the stock heat sink in favor of superior solutions, especially for the "k" series processors which imply the intent to overclock.Other Thoughts: I have this running with a msi z97 gaming 5 and a Cooler Master Seidon 120V. I was able to overclock the turbo from 3.9GHZ to 4.6GHZ and REDUCE the turbo voltage from 1.2V to 1.12V. Idle temps are around 26C and full load (Prime95 small FFT test) temps are from 60C to 65C. This was truly a great purchase, and I would highly recommend spending the extra $$ for this CPU.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsAn excellent CPU with a lot of potential!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2017
Reviews: I recently purchased the I5-4690k for my first rig, which was also a budget build. I read over countless reviews such as this one and finally selected this CPU for my maiden voyage in rig building.See, I wanted something that could perform really well right now, and for some time to come with little quality loss. Everything pointed me here. Quad core, and as it turns out, the K series of Intel chips are specially for overclocking.Now, I haven't had to OC yet, so I can't speak of that, but I have this paired with a Gigabyte GTX 1050 Ti Oc, and they are performing superbly for me. Its crushing everything thrown at it at max with low temps & 60fps plus.Overall I think this is a perfect budget CPU, partner it with an aftermarket cooler & nice GPU, and you are set.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsBest value for performance on the market at this time
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2015
Reviews: After doing a lot of research for a new gaming build I ended up with this CPU and it's been great; the bang for buck quotient is quite good.  My reduction in rating is due to the stock cooler, which isn't something I'd expect to be stellar.If you plan to OC this at all (which is why you are looking at the unlocked version, right?) def go with an aftermarket cooler. Don't bother with a fancy liquid setup as it's a waste of money IMO.  If you have that much to spend, why are you buying this processor?  Go with the i7 or something better.  I got a Corsair Hyper 212 EVO air cooler for ~$50 and it keeps this CPU at a stable and cool 45 degrees at stress-test load -turbo boost @4.2Ghz-, with just one fan and decent (not top of the line) cooling around the case (stock NZXT 410 Phantom).

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWas my first CPU install and was incredibly easy to do
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2014
Reviews: Immediately noticed the difference between my old CPU (AMD A8-5500) and this one. Increased my game play on ARMA 3 from about 20 frames to about 40-50. League of legends from about 65 to 250. Was my first CPU install and was incredibly easy to do. The manual was very straightforward.I highly recommend getting an aftermarket fan of some sort as the one that comes with is really bad quality. Using CPU-Z I was running about 4-5 degrees higher than recommended (not bad at all) but with the new fan there isn't ANY issue with heat.As for a remark to the manufacturer:Not that it's directly related to this upgrade or not ever since the install I've been experiencing graphical issues though. There are times of random frame drops to 0 for a few seconds than speeds itself back up. I've spoken to experts and they recommended I purchased a new power supply (currently using a 500w) to go along with this CPU and my Nvidia 760 VCard to help with this issue.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2015
Reviews: Love it!  It is a beast!  I bought this for gaming, but I only play WoW.  I did a lot of research for what I needed to optimize gameplay without spending more than I needed.  Some people will say go AMD, and in the past, this was true!  AMD has been outperforming intel processors for gaming forever!  But these new gen intel chips are AMAZING!  Do your research, you will find that both benchmarks and real life performance comparisons put this chipset ahead.  I bought a hyper 212 evo cooler and was able to overclock this using the ASUS mobo bios menu to 3.9Ghz with a click of a button!  You can get more out of it with the custom settings if you are comfortable and knowledgeable.  I now run WoW at ultra max settings with not a hint of lag.  In quiet areas I can pull 170-180fps, in populated areas and raids, I still get 50fps and smooth as butter!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBEST CPU available for the dollar to run Amra2/3 today.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2015
Reviews: Was able to test and clock to 4.81GHz @ 1.25V and picked up 35+ frames on Arma3 set on Ultra with a 200+m draw distance. I am ONLY using a Gigabyte 760 Windforce 3x 4 GB OC, so the gains I saw were from the massive single thread capability of this processor.Ran CPUID benchmark and this thing outclassed the i7 4790K by over 200 points on the benchmark while at only 4.2GHz, and I further exceeded that by triple that number when I clocked stable to 4.81, though most people will find that they can get to just 4.6GHz at 1.20-1.25V, it is still a impressive overclock and makes a massive difference in the Arma series.I bought a LEPA Aquachanger 120 with the money I saved over buying the i74790k, and I am SO happy I did. Stays under 60 degrees Celsius under full oad in 50-100 man operations while I have the game set to Ultra everything.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent for gaming and stays pretty cool!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2014
Reviews: I purchased this processor as an upgrade to my computer to replace my i3-4130. The i3 was running games well enough but sometimes it was struggling a little on cpu intensive games like dayz and bf4 and trying to multitask while gaming was tough.Im using the i5 4690k on an AsRock z97 m itx/ac motherboard and using a silverstone argon heatsink with push/pull to cool it. I overclocked it to 4.4 ghz on 1.2 V hitting in the 70's C on Intel Burn Test. I could overclock it further but I am comfortable with it and the heat its putting out because its my first overclock.In games like bf4 im able to play at around 60-90 fps and sometimes dips to the 50's fps on ultra with a gtx 660. DayZ is also signifigantly better because it plays much smoother. This processor gets in the 40's and 50's degrees C while gaming so it stays pretty cool even overclocked.So overall, the i5 4690k is an awesome cpu for gaming and great for multitasking and its stays pretty cool while gaming.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2023
Reviews: Saved our pc

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis Processor is a Monster!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2015
Reviews: For some reason, Intel has removed the Devil's Canyon markings from the marketing of the G3258, 4690k, and 4790k, but the Next-Generation Polymer Thermal Interface Material that they feature allows for incredible heat dispersion. Overclocking to 4.0 GHz with the piece of trash stock cooler, the 4690k has yet to break 45 C. I have yet to put a Hyper 212 Evo, but I'm expectingThe Intel HD Graphics 4600 integrated with the card are the best integrated graphics I've seen in DDR3 systems. With 2 channels of fast (1866 MHz) ram, it is quite possible to play 8th Generation (PS4, XO) games at comparable settings with, of course, the minor lag from ram delay.In short, this is my processor of choice for DDR3. The 4790k may be better, but it is $100 more expensive, and at that price point, the upgrade to DDR4 becomes a logical choice. Great job Intel!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBetter then expected.....from a Mac guy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2015
Reviews: I purchased this cpu along with a Gigabyte MB, MSI GTX970 GPU, Corsair RAM and a Corsair PSU. My system has been super stable since day one. I'm impressed so far with the performance I'm getting from this i5 CPU. It benchmarks well and overclocks extremely easily. I'm currently running at 4.5Ghz perfectly stable. Will push it up to 4.7Ghz when a better CPU cooler has been purchased. The stock cooler is actually nicer then I expected it to be but still not designed for pushing the CPU's limits.For clarification purposes, this CPU comes with a cooler AND thermal paste already applied to the cooler.Highly recommend this processor for those of you looking to do some general computer tasks and gaming. You might want to step it up to the i7 if you're serious about video editing, otherwise this i5 will do all the serious gaming you want without a hitch.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis Intel CPU crushes AMD processors, highly recommended!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2016
Reviews: I have ran AMD cpus for the last 8 years due to price and their pretty good performance. I rocked Intel on my very first computer build and remember it to be solid but was quickly beat by my AMD Phenom II Black Edition. Recently built a brand new computer and decided to go with this i5 vs AMD and WOW what a HUGE difference!I didn't know what fast was until I made the switch from AMD to Intel again, easily 10x faster than my old cpus and could run any game right now on max settings without any issues (also have an r9 gpu to boot). A little bit more expensive than AMD, but I think the price difference is definitely more worth it for a superior quality product, I HIGHLY recommend this processor! Running on stock settings, going to try OC speeds soon.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 4.0 out of 5 starsCPU = Amazing, Fan = Replace Immediately
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2014
Reviews: Processor is 5*+, as of Sept '14 it is the best bang for the buck from Intel (which will likely change when the 14nm architecture is released).Have to knock a star off because this is a boxed product including a heatsink/fan that is worthless, but hopefully everyone knows that they really should be using a better fan for long term (and short term) system reliability. Especially on an unlocked processor meant for overclocking. Point in fact: running the Intel Extreme Tuning software's stress test with the stock cooler at stock speeds (3.5GHz, turbo not enabled) had my cpu breaking 90*C in less than 15seconds. With a Corsair H80i, the processor sits about 56*C after several hours of stress tests at 4GHz....Overall really great processor, just expect to throw away the fan/heatsink. :)Highly recommend, would buy again.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsVery nice i5-4690K CPU
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2016
Reviews: This is a solid CPU. After reading reviews from others it took me all of seconds to purchase this i5-4690K CPU for my new computer build. I didn't need the i7 CPU as I'm using my new PC build for running 2 digital audio workstations and there is no lag or any problem getting work done with this CPU. Simply put...this rock solid CPU does the job and processing is lightning fast for what I use it for. I'm impressed and satisfied that I purchased it and would highly recommend it to others. If your an over clocker do your homework before you buy so you'll know ahead if this is the right CPU for your needs. From what I have read...it works nicely for many others who over clock their systems. I highly recommend it!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWorked well years ago
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2022
Reviews: At the time when I bought it, gaming was good. Now that it’s outdated it’s difficult to run recent games on good graphics settings

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2015
Reviews: Great piece of hardware.  I recently upgraded my entire computer and chose this CPU.  Unless you're running heavy video editing or 3D rendering suites you really don't need to pay for an i7 and hyperthreading.  Stock speed is 3.5GHz and with a Corsair H100i water cooling setup I've been able to overclock it to 4.1GHz without even raising the voltage.  Idles at around 31C and at full load using Prime95 it sits in the mid-50s.  If you have the extra money I'd recommend this over the AMD 8 core series.  The performance is just plain better, it uses less power, and runs cooler.  I don't think I can link to external sites but check out benchmarks for yourself and decide on something that fits your budget.  For this price point, it doesn't get any better than this.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020
Reviews: The product got to me a week before the expected delivery date, which I was very happy about. The reason for the 4 stars is because the packaging of the processor was not the safest/orthodox way, along with the thermal paste included doing no conductivity at all for my thermals (were in degrees of 80 in BIOS). Other than that, the processor works fine from what I can tell.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2016
Reviews: Really can't beat the power and reliabiliy of Intel. I've built plenty of computer systems and used both Intel and AMD. While I'm a fan of both and it really depends on what you want to do with the computer, I'd recommend Intel for reliability. Also note that you won't get much more FPS/performance out of your games when switching from an i-5 processor to an i-7. Graphics cards are a much better in vestment when it comes to that.This one is k series so its unlocked and can be overclocked with an aftermarket cooler. I never saw the need for it because once again, 5 or so fps for less life on my processor just doesn't seem worth it to me. But to each his own!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2015
Reviews: I was using an AMD FX6100 cpu before doing some research and deciding to switch to Intel.And let me tell you, I am so glad i did.With AMD in Planetside 2 i was getting around 30-60 fps, now i'm getting 80-125fps.In DayZ i would get 25fps, now i get 70.I can't comment on the stock cooler because when i ordered this cpu i ordered a Zalman cpu cooler and haven't used the stock one.Also ordered an Asus z97 Pro Gamer mobo to install this cpu in.I love this cpu. It literally doubled my fps in all my games. It's more expensive than AMD but the increase in performance is phenomenal and well worth the money. Would highly recommend the 4690K if your looking for a serious upgrade.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat product and seller!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2019
Reviews: I was a little skeptical about getting a used cpu, but it has run flawlessly for me. I was concerned at first that it was faulty as it started to run at 90 degrees when I first installed it! Turned out to my fault as my cooler wasn’t on the chip flatly due to my motherboards configuration. After mounting the cooler on properly, it is sitting at a cool 35 degrees and idle and is just what I needed for my secondary gaming pc. (I keep one at home and one in my dorm)

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIt's great! I'm easily at 4
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2016
Reviews: can u believe i'm upgrading from a Pentium 3??? I'm even trying out some overclocking. It's great! I'm easily at 4.3 with only 1.184v. ..and i'll just stay there. My ASUS mobo has a TPU switch for "easy overclocking" and I think i reached 4.5 with that, but that was a big mistake! Never use mobo switches as I read too late. I did that for a week before stopping, and then cpu idled 5C higher back at stock than from before using that stupid switch. (motherboards send way too much voltage to cpu if u were curious.)I paired this with a hyper tx3 and very pleased Folding@home at 4.3Ghz at average of 72-75C (and that's even after i probably fracked it somewhat)

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSo far so good

Reviews: Intel has always worked for me.  This CPU has been the same.  I do not expect problems.  I do suggest using a better cooling system if you expect to run it hot.  I put on a CoolerMaster tower cooler.  CPU been staying at 36 C on an Asus Z97-E MB.  MB, CPU and Crucial RAM are all over clockable, but I have not gone there yet. I advise to always buy a little better than you think you will ever need.  That way if you decide to push the equipment there is room, and if not the components are not stressed.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K

Reviews: This CPU is still an absolute beast even in 2017. If you plan on overclocking and do not want to spend an arm and a leg then this is a great CPU for you. I'm currently running mine at 4.5GHZ at 1.25v with 0 issues for the months since I bought and overclocked it. Insanely happy with my purchase!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2015
Reviews: Runs insanely well. Very fast, easily overclockable. Runs most games at high speeds. I have bumped it up to 4.0Ghz on air with a $30 Hyper Evo 212 cooler fan (air), runs great and cool. What else is there to say? Quad core, very fast, easy to overclock.This was my second Intel processor ever. My first was an i3 4130, which ran very fast compared to AMD that I was used to, even on 2 cores. Now this processor has sold me. I probably won't be going back to AMD's processors that run hot, have 12 cores and still can't perform quickly at the same clock speeds.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K

No wonder intel is considered better. I noticed how it ran cool even under heavy loads like streaming league of legends or playing fallout 4. My Amd cpu (8350) would run these games and junk at about 40% use and run 60c. This cpu streams league and records fallout at a surprising 35% use average and 45c average! Definitely worth it if you have the money.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K

Reviews: excellent processor. hums along at like 3.8 Ghz for me, and I haven't set up my motherboard overclock settings yet.Disclaimer: Don't trust the pre applied thermal paste that comes on the heat sink, wipe it off with some rubbing alcohol and put your own on. The stuff that came with it didn't work at all, after 2 seconds it was running at like 90 Celsius. once you have your own on it runs like a dreami'm even impressed with the built in graphics,it wont run any new games but its playing my old ones just fine while I'm saving up money for my graphics card

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsthen this i5 is the perfect choice. The most powerful i5 to date

Reviews: If you are in the market for a high end CPU, but not in the market for $350 high end CPUs, then this i5 is the perfect choice. The most powerful i5 to date, are getting the most out of those 4 cores, and with this being the unlocked chip, and given adequate cooling, you can pull some impressive overclocks. I wouldn't recommend this to someone who isn't going to be doing anything that requires a decent CPU, if you plan to browse the web and use MS Word, get a lower end chip. The locked chip is only about $15 cheaper, and Is also a great choice for people not willing to overclock.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K

I've paired this processor with an MSI Z97S Krait SLI Edition board, it's also being liquid-cooled with a Corsair H60 in a pull configuration it idles at about 30C for me and gets to about 35-40C under load. Overall, I'm very satisfied with this processor as another added bonus my steam library has had a back log of older games I could never play due to the way the FX series chips are designed with this chip however I've had no such issues what so ever with older games.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4690K Processor 3.9 4 BX80646I54690K

Product Title: Intel Core i3-10100F 10th Generation LGA1200 Desktop Processor 4, 4 Cores 8 Threads up to 4.30GHz 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in Canada on 3 October 2022
Reviews: great budget CPU for gaming and streaming Fast and zippy does very well with a MSI MPG Z490 Wifi motherboard (just set memory too 3200MHZ in Bios) and M.2 NVME 1TB Timetech , 16gb 3000MHZ ram DDR4 Gskill Aegis and i paired it with a RTX 2060 6GB and it does not bottleneck or disappoint at all in this setup i get a steady 165-175FPS all high settings in Fortnite chapter 3 1080P HD- 3D setting too 80% and 120-165FPS in all high settings in Call of duty WarZone !!! this CPU is GREAT, it is better then a Ryzen 7 1700X or R5 2200G bye far the extra cores dont match the i3 10100F,s better instruction set and higher core clock out of box the 6MB cache only hinders this i3 for video editing but not streaming too twitch or youtube . if you want too future proof for later get a Z590 motherboard too upgrade too 11th gen later when you can afford it and gain all the benefits PCIexpress 4.0 .. this CPU makes all the previous gen 4 core 8 thread cpuz obsolete like the i7 7700 and below and devalued as this is faster and better and has a upgrade path for only 95$ !!! you guys had too upgrade platforms someday and well this is so affordable you should do it now .. the F Sku at the end of i3 10100F means their is no onboard graphics thus you need a GPU or graphics card which Gamers and enthusiasts will anyways

Review Date: Reviewed in Canada on 19 January 2023
Reviews: Used this for a cheap upgrade for the family PC which sees light gaming, web browsing and school use (MS office).Pros:1) Price/value;2) low 65w TDP meant I didn't have to upgrade the power supply;3) Decent desk top performance;Cons:1) Only 4 Cores (still adequate for normal desk top use);2) The 10100f doesn't have built-in graphics.Note: The requirement for a discrete graphics card isn't really a con, as any cheap/used graphics card will be better than the Intel graphics on the normal i3 10100. Just be aware of this requirement before purchasing.

Product Title: Intel Core i3-10100F 10th Generation LGA1200 Desktop Processor 4, 4 Cores 8 Threads up to 4.30GHz 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in Canada on 30 August 2022
Reviews: This processor is a great budget-friendly processor for gamers that want to create their own custom PCs.I bought this processor back in November 2021 and it arrived a week from ordering it. The packaging was solid (I believed that the processor's box would be well cushioned if dropped accidentally). Although, the box of the processor was a little scuffed; as if it was overly used. This concerned me until I tested the processor along with its heat-sink fan. I used this processor for University, programming, and gaming.Like I said, the processor comes with a fan and pre-applied thermal paste with it. Overall, this is an authentic Intel processor and would recommend to my friends in case they want to start with a budget-friendly PC component.

Product Title: Intel Core i3-10100F 10th Generation LGA1200 Desktop Processor 4, 4 Cores 8 Threads up to 4.30GHz 6MB Cache

Product Title: Intel Core i3-10100F 10th Generation LGA1200 Desktop Processor 4, 4 Cores 8 Threads up to 4.30GHz 6MB Cache
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on 6 August 2022
Reviews: This offer allowed me to build a super low budget PC which beats the i7-4770 it replaced in every single aspect. More performance, less power draw, less noise, better thermals. Don't buy an old used i7-4770 which will still go for $50 or more when you can buy this CPU new with fresh thermal paste and CPU cooler already included.The only issue you might face is finding a good offer for a motherboard but if you manage to do so you'll be ready for future upgrades. Mind you, you will need a dedicated graphics card or you might want to look for the non-"f" version.My order was shipped very fast and arrived in an original sealed box in immaculate condition which makes me a happy customer.

Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat value for an entry level gaming PC + upgradability
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2022
Reviews: I purchased this processor for my first PC build, and so far after about a month, everything has worked great. I chose the i5-11400F because it offered a decently priced CPU option that will fit my current RTX 1070 build, while also supporting when I decide to make the move to a 20 or 30 series a year or two down the road. This processor really is perfect for gaming, and my experience has been entirely smooth so far. I really think this is the perfect option for someone looking to get into PC gaming while also having enough power for decent GPU upgrades in the future.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4590 BX80646I54590 Processor (6M Cache, 3.3 GHz)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2014
Reviews: It's a top performer. You don't need an i7. This thing is a beast for its price. the 4770k and all those other ones are fluff.However, if you can get a "K" version of this, I'd recommend that. I wish I could overclock this processor more, since it never even goes above room temperatureIf it helps your decision anymore, I calculated this processor's price-to-performance ratio based on single-core speeds. The i7's have 4 cores but 8 threads total, which most applications don't even use. Most applications pretty much max out at 4 single-threaded cores, which is what an i5 is. And this i5 happens to be one of the fastest i5's, which basically puts it on par with the high end core i7's which are nearly $100+ more. The hyper-threading in i7 is really not worth the extra cost.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4590 BX80646I54590 Processor (6M Cache, 3.3 GHz)
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPlays Spec Ops: The Line and Bioshock on High at 900p.....with just the onboard graphics.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2015
Reviews: "Games that this processors on board can handle on med-high at 720p-900p that I have played."  Spec ops:The Line(awesome game and ran the best) Bioshock, The Darkness 2(suffers a bit of frame rate dips but not too bad), Alien vs Predator, Trials Fusion, Red Faction Guerrilla.  If your like me and have to buy parts when you can afford them than you'll be happy to know that if your buying this card before you buy a GPU that you can still have a bit of fun with it.  The onboard graphics might not be quite as good as AMD's APU but they are still good and the processor is way better.  Plus you can always upgrade the GPU like I did and have a better all around system.  I recommend it.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4590 BX80646I54590 Processor (6M Cache, 3.3 GHz)
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood for its time.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2023
Reviews: Bought this CPU for my first gaming PC. It did well.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4590 BX80646I54590 Processor (6M Cache, 3.3 GHz)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2014
Reviews: Built two PCs for my kids and it is a great little gamer chip.  Put this CPU in an MSI Mini ITX H97I AC motherboard and no issues.Do NOT buy this processor if you plan on overclocking as you will not have the options to tweak the BCLK or multiplier any higher than stock...  Get the "K" model i5s if you intend on overclocking.  You can overclock these with the Turbo feature and that worked great.This chip is a low power variant meant for quiet low power builds which this was meant to be.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4590 BX80646I54590 Processor (6M Cache, 3.3 GHz)
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsRuns like a charm with my EVGA GTX 960 SSC
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2015
Reviews: Runs like a charm with my EVGA GTX 960 SSC.It can play Dragon Age: Inquisition on ultra settings, no problem. I didn't use a FPS counter but I'm guessing it's constantly between 35-50 fps. BF3 runs on ultra with 60 fps. This is paired with an i5 4590 processor. Previously I was using a 1st generation i3 and 960 SSC was only pulling 50% power. You gotta have a new generation processor or you won't get what you need out of this graphics card. Even a 4th generation i3 will do because its hyper threading can simulate 4 cores.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4590 BX80646I54590 Processor (6M Cache, 3.3 GHz)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2015
Reviews: Honestly, now-a-days, nothing you can buy will blow your socks off anymore!Once you have 64bit OS, a reasonably potent GPU, at least 8gigs of ram, and a normal CPU,nothing this side of switching to a Solid State Drive will make a huge noticeable difference in speed.So, I shopped for the fastest CPU considering the dollars I had, to devote to this part of the computer build.Don't spend money on something that will cost an arm and a leg, only to seem a 10th of a second faster.Nobody really cares.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4590 BX80646I54590 Processor (6M Cache, 3.3 GHz)
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsI upgraded from a crap Celeron and this bad boy is a beast
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2016
Reviews: I r8 8/8 m8. I upgraded from a crap Celeron and this bad boy is a beast, nothing can trump the 4590! I was lagging hella bad on games like World of Warcraft and Overwatch, bought this upgrading from a Celeron crap and boom no bottleneck lag from my CPU anymore :D I got for 183$ was a great deal. You can even play most games on minimum graphics just with the onboard graphics. But as a CPU it's a tank!

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4590 BX80646I54590 Processor (6M Cache, 3.3 GHz)
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsOffers great balance between price/performance at $200
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2014
Reviews: Intel's Core i5 processors are well known for their high-end gaming potential at reasonable prices, the 4590 it's not the exception. Offers great balance between price/performance at $200. This CPU's multiplier is locked but you don't need any overclocking to achieve good frame rates with it. It does run quite hot with the stock cooler, my best advice will be to invest at least US$20-30 on a third-party cooling solution to increase the stability and longevity of this chip.

Product Title: Intel Core i5-4590 BX80646I54590 Processor (6M Cache, 3.3 GHz)
Review Title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAll that is really necessary for gaming
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2016
Reviews: As far as gaming, you really don't need anything more than this. i5 is honestly as much as is needed, because i7 wouldn't be able to add anything useful for gaming, and only actual computation. For the price, when I bought it, this was probably the best choice I could have made. I highly recommend Intel processors, specifically i5 for gaming or even just workstations.
